original: @20b # // rgya gar skad du /
analyzed: @20b # // rgya gar skad du /
translated: In Sanskrit:

original: a'arya sh'a li sta m'a ka ma ha' ya' na s'u tra t'i k'a /
analyzed: a'arya sh'a li sta m'a ka ma ha' ya' na s'u tra t'i k'a /
translated: Ārya-śāli-stamba-mahāyāna-sūtra-tīkā

original: bod skad du /
analyzed: bod skad du /
translated: In Tibetan:

original: 'phags pa s'a lu ljang pa zhes bya ba theg pa chen po'i mdo'i rgya cher bshad pa /
analyzed: 'phags pa s'a lu ljang pa zhes bya ba theg pa chen po'i mdo'i rgya cher bshad pa /
translated: The Extensive Explanation of the Noble Sūtra of the Green Sāla Tree, Called the Great Vehicle

original: 'phags pa 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pa la phyag 'tshal lo //🔽de la / yon tan mtha' yas bsam mi khyab //🔽ces bya ba la sogs pa la yon tan mtha' yas zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: 'phags pa 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pa la phyag 'tshal lo // de la / yon tan mtha' yas bsam mi khyab // ces bya ba la sogs pa la yon tan mtha' yas zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Homage to the noble Mañjuśrī, the youthful one.🔽In that [sūtra], it says: The qualities are limitless and inconceivable.

original: yon tan ni stobs dang / mi 'jigs pa dang / ma 'dres pa la sogs te /
analyzed: yon tan ni stobs dang / mi 'jigs pa dang / ma 'dres pa la sogs te /
translated: Regarding this, qualities refers to the powers, fearlessnesses, unique qualities, and so forth.

original: yon tan don du gnyen ba'i lha dang mi rnams kyis 'dris par bya ba dang ; bsten par bya ba dang / goms par bya ba dang / bsgom par bya ba dang / mngon du bya ba dang / thob par bya ba'i phyir yon tan rnams so //
analyzed: yon tan don du gnyen ba'i lha dang mi rnams kyis 'dris par bya ba dang ; bsten par bya ba dang / goms par bya ba dang / bsgom par bya ba dang / mngon du bya ba dang / thob par bya ba'i phyir yon tan rnams so //
translated: They are called qualities because they are to be known, relied upon, cultivated, familiarized, actualized, and attained by gods and humans who seek qualities.

original: de rnams ni yon tan mang po yin /
analyzed: de rnams ni yon tan mang po yin /
translated: Those are the many qualities.

original: mtha' ya pa dang / bsam gyis mi khyab pa yin pas zhes tshig bsdu ste /
analyzed: mtha' ya pa dang / bsam gyis mi khyab pa yin pas zhes tshig bsdu ste /
translated: The phrase because of being limitless and inconceivable summarizes the above.

original: yon tan bsam gyis mi khyab pa nyid ni nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas dang / so so'i skye bo thams cad dang / rtog ge pa thams cad kyi tshogs dang sems kyi yul las yang dag par 'das pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yon tan bsam gyis mi khyab pa nyid ni nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas dang / so so'i skye bo thams cad dang / rtog ge pa thams cad kyi tshogs dang sems kyi yul las yang dag par 'das pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The inconceivability of the qualities is because they transcend the domain of the mind and the assemblies of all śrāvakas, pratyekabuddhas, and ordinary beings, as well as all logicians.

original: de'i phyir yon tan mtha' yas shing bsam gyis mi khyab ba de rnams dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir yon tan mtha' yas shing bsam gyis mi khyab ba de rnams dang ldan pa'o //
translated: Therefore, he is endowed with those limitless and inconceivable qualities.

original: gang zhig ce na /
analyzed: gang zhig ce na /
translated: What is he like?

original: smras @21a * //
analyzed: smras @21a * //
translated: It is said:

original: pa ; rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas thugs rje'i bdag / ces bya ba smos te /
analyzed: pa ; rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas thugs rje'i bdag / ces bya ba smos te /
translated: The perfect buddha, the lord of compassion.

original: yang dag par phyin ci ma log par sangs rgyas pas rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas te /
analyzed: yang dag par phyin ci ma log par sangs rgyas pas rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas te /
translated: He is the perfect buddha because he is completely and unmistakenly enlightened.

original: chos thams cad mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang stong pa dang / bdag med pa la sogs par chos dang gang zag la bdag med pa'i ngo bo nyid ji lta ba bzhin du thugs su chud pa'i phyir sangs rgyas so //
analyzed: chos thams cad mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang stong pa dang / bdag med pa la sogs par chos dang gang zag la bdag med pa'i ngo bo nyid ji lta ba bzhin du thugs su chud pa'i phyir sangs rgyas so //
translated: He is the Buddha because he has realized the nature of the selflessness of persons and things, namely, that all things are impermanent, painful, empty, and without self.

original: yang na padma kha phye ba bzhin du blo rgyas pas sangs rgyas sam /
analyzed: yang na padma kha phye ba bzhin du blo rgyas pas sangs rgyas sam /
translated: Or else, he is the Buddha because his mind is expanded like an opened lotus.

original: sangs rgyas pa'i phyir na sangs rgyas te /🔽'gro ba mi shes pa'i gnyid kyis rab tu log pa'i nang na /
analyzed: sangs rgyas pa'i phyir na sangs rgyas te / 'gro ba mi shes pa'i gnyid kyis rab tu log pa'i nang na /
translated: Or else, he is the Buddha because he has awakened,

original: skyes bu gnyid sangs pa bzhin du ji lta ba phyin ci ma log par yang dag pa'i ye shes shar ba brnyes pa'i phyir sangs rgyas zhes bya'o //
analyzed: skyes bu gnyid sangs pa bzhin du ji lta ba phyin ci ma log par yang dag pa'i ye shes shar ba brnyes pa'i phyir sangs rgyas zhes bya'o //
translated: for he is the one who has attained the light of perfect, unerring knowledge of things as they are, like a sleeping person who awakens.

original: yang na skye bo mi mkhas pa rtogs par mdzad pa'i phyir sangs rgyas te /
analyzed: yang na skye bo mi mkhas pa rtogs par mdzad pa'i phyir sangs rgyas te /
translated: Or else, he is the Buddha because he has awakened the ignorant,

original: ji ltar bdag nyid gzhan la rag las par so so rang gis rig pa'i chos kyi de kho na rtogs pa de bzhin du log pa'i lam du 'khyams pa'i sems dang ldan pa /
analyzed: ji ltar bdag nyid gzhan la rag las par so so rang gis rig pa'i chos kyi de kho na rtogs pa de bzhin du log pa'i lam du 'khyams pa'i sems dang ldan pa /
translated: Just as he himself, by his own power, realized the reality of the Dharma, in the same way, he causes others, who are like himself, to enter into the city of nirvana.🔽He is called the Buddha because he causes those who are like himself to enter the unsurpassed great city of liberation, those who are endowed with a mind that wanders on the wrong path,

original: 'khor ba 'brog dgon par skye ba dang / rga ba dang / na ba dang / 'chi ba la sogs par gces pa /
analyzed: 'khor ba 'brog dgon par skye ba dang / rga ba dang / na ba dang / 'chi ba la sogs par gces pa /
translated: who are dear to him in the wilderness of cyclic existence, which is filled with the dangers of birth, aging, sickness, death, and so on,

original: lta ba rnam pa sna tshogs kyi nags tshang tshing du nyon mongs pa'i sbrul gdug pa'i 'jigs pas gang bar phan tshun yongs su 'khyams pa gzhan dag kyang yang dag pa'i lam du btsud de /🔽thar pa'i grong khyer chen po bla na med par 'jug par mdzad pa'i phyir sangs rgyas zhes bya'o //
analyzed: lta ba rnam pa sna tshogs kyi nags tshang tshing du nyon mongs pa'i sbrul gdug pa'i 'jigs pas gang bar phan tshun yongs su 'khyams pa gzhan dag kyang yang dag pa'i lam du btsud de / thar pa'i grong khyer chen po bla na med par 'jug par mdzad pa'i phyir sangs rgyas zhes bya'o //
translated: and who wander about in mutual confusion in the thickets of the forest of various views, which are filled with the dangers of the poisonous snakes of the afflictions.

original: thugs rje'i bdag ces bya ba ni thugs rje'i rang bzhin te /
analyzed: thugs rje'i bdag ces bya ba ni thugs rje'i rang bzhin te /
translated: He is called the Lord of Compassion because his nature is compassion.

original: nyon mongs pa dang / las dang / sdug bsngal sel ba'i phyir thugs rje'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa dang / las dang / sdug bsngal sel ba'i phyir thugs rje'o //
translated: Compassion is the removal of the afflictions, karma, and suffering.

original: gang la thugs rje'i bdag nyid de //
analyzed: gang la thugs rje'i bdag nyid de //
translated: He is the Lord of Compassion

original: ngo bo nyid yod pa de ni thugs rje'i bdag nyid do //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid yod pa de ni thugs rje'i bdag nyid do //
translated: The reality of the Buddha is the nature of compassion.

original: de ni rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas yin la /
analyzed: de ni rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas yin la /
translated: He is the perfect Buddha.

original: thugs rje'i bdag nyid kyang yin pas rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas thugs rje'i bdag nyid de /
analyzed: thugs rje'i bdag nyid kyang yin pas rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas thugs rje'i bdag nyid de /
translated: And he is the nature of compassion. Therefore, the perfect Buddha is the nature of compassion.

original: de bas na sangs rgyas thugs rje'i bdag nyid de la'o //🔽rab btud s'a lu ljang pa yi //
analyzed: de bas na sangs rgyas thugs rje'i bdag nyid de la'o // rab btud s'a lu ljang pa yi //
translated: Therefore, the Buddha is the nature of compassion.🔽Having bowed to the Buddha, I will explain the treatise

original: zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: called “The Rice Seedling Sūtra.”

original: rab btud ces bya ba ni yang dag par mchod nas te /
analyzed: rab btud ces bya ba ni yang dag par mchod nas te /
translated: Having bowed to the Buddha means having made offerings to him.

original: 'dud pa dang / gus pa dang / gzhol bas phyag 'tshal te'o //
analyzed: 'dud pa dang / gus pa dang / gzhol bas phyag 'tshal te'o //
translated: Having bowed to him with respect and devotion, I will explain the treatise called “The Rice Seedling Sūtra.”

original: phyag 'tshal te ci zhig bya zhe na /
analyzed: phyag 'tshal te ci zhig bya zhe na /
translated: What will I do after bowing to him?

original: s'a lu ljang pa'i zhes mdo'i bshad sbyar bstan bcos //
analyzed: s'a lu ljang pa'i zhes mdo'i bshad sbyar bstan bcos //
translated: I will explain the treatise called “The Rice Seedling Sūtra.”

original: tshig le'ur byas pa bshad par bya //
analyzed: tshig le'ur byas pa bshad par bya //
translated: I will explain the treatise called “The Rice Seedling Sūtra.”

original: zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: In that treatise,

original: de la / yon tan mtha' yas @21b bsam mi khyab //
analyzed: de la / yon tan mtha' yas @21b bsam mi khyab //
translated: his qualities are infinite and inconceivable.

original: ces bya ba 'dis ni rang gi don phun sum tshogs pa bstan to //
analyzed: ces bya ba 'dis ni rang gi don phun sum tshogs pa bstan to //
translated: This shows the perfection of his own aim.

original: thugs rje'i bdag nyid ces bya ba 'dis ni /
analyzed: thugs rje'i bdag nyid ces bya ba 'dis ni /
translated: The nature of compassion

original: gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa brjod do //
analyzed: gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa brjod do //
translated: The fulfillment of the aims of others is stated.

original: rdzogs sangs rgyas zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas ni rtogs pa'i don yin pa'i phyir thams cad mkhyen pa nyid do //
analyzed: rdzogs sangs rgyas zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas ni rtogs pa'i don yin pa'i phyir thams cad mkhyen pa nyid do //
translated: The word perfect means omniscience, because buddha means to awaken.

original: yon tan mtha' yas bsam mi khyab //
analyzed: yon tan mtha' yas bsam mi khyab //
translated: The word infinite means inconceivable.

original: ces bya ba 'dis ni 'dod chags la sogs pa dang bral ba nyid do //🔽nyon mongs pa dang / nye ba'i nyon mongs pa yong tan ma yin pa rnams ni /
analyzed: ces bya ba 'dis ni 'dod chags la sogs pa dang bral ba nyid do // nyon mongs pa dang / nye ba'i nyon mongs pa yong tan ma yin pa rnams ni /
translated: This shows freedom from attachment and so on.🔽The word qualities means not faults,

original: yon tan dang mi mthun pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yon tan dang mi mthun pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because faults are incompatible with qualities.

original: de bas na thams cad mkhyen pa /
analyzed: de bas na thams cad mkhyen pa /
translated: Therefore, the word perfect means omniscient,

original: 'dod chags dang bral ba /
analyzed: 'dod chags dang bral ba /
translated: and the word buddha means free from attachment.

original: rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas de ltar bu la bcud de'o //
analyzed: rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas de ltar bu la bcud de'o //
translated: Thus, the perfect buddha is the one who is omniscient and free from attachment.

original: thugs rje'i bdag nyid ces bya ba ni /
analyzed: thugs rje'i bdag nyid ces bya ba ni /
translated: The word compassionate means

original: gang zhig thams cad mkhyen cing 'dod chags dang bral ba de ni slob dpon gyis dpe mkhyud dang bral bas gzhan dag la ji ltar rtogs pa'i chos ston te /
analyzed: gang zhig thams cad mkhyen cing 'dod chags dang bral ba de ni slob dpon gyis dpe mkhyud dang bral bas gzhan dag la ji ltar rtogs pa'i chos ston te /
translated: the one who, being omniscient and free from attachment, teaches the Dharma to others as he has realized it, without the stinginess of a bad teacher.

original: 'dis ni gzhan la phan par mdzad pa'i phyir gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa bstan to //
analyzed: 'dis ni gzhan la phan par mdzad pa'i phyir gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa bstan to //
translated: This shows the perfection of the benefit for others, because it is the means for benefiting others.

original: de ltar rang gi don dang gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa dang ldan pa rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas de la btud de'o //
analyzed: de ltar rang gi don dang gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa dang ldan pa rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas de la btud de'o //
translated: Having bowed to the perfect Buddha who is endowed with the perfection of benefit for self and others,🔽he says, “I will explain the treatise called the Essence of the Middle Way, which is an ornament for the middle way, composed by the master called Candrakīrti.”

original: de ltar na yang 'dod pa dang bcas pa'i tshig yin pa'i phyir 'dod pa dang bcas pas ci zhig 'dod ces dris pa dang / smras pa /
analyzed: de ltar na yang 'dod pa dang bcas pa'i tshig yin pa'i phyir 'dod pa dang bcas pas ci zhig 'dod ces dris pa dang / smras pa /
translated: Since this is a statement that is made with a desire, it is asked, “What is desired?”

original: bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: bshad par bya'o //
translated: He says, “It is to be explained.”

original: gang zhig bshad ;
analyzed: gang zhig bshad ;
translated: What is to be explained?

original: smras pa / s'a lu ljang pa'i mdo dang sbyar ba'i bstan bcos tshigs le'ur byas pa'o //
analyzed: smras pa / s'a lu ljang pa'i mdo dang sbyar ba'i bstan bcos tshigs le'ur byas pa'o //
translated: He says, “The treatise composed in stanzas that is an instruction connected to the Rice Seedling Sūtra.”

original: bstan bcos brlams pa la thog mar /
analyzed: bstan bcos brlams pa la thog mar /
translated: In a treatise that is composed,

original: 'brel ba dang / dgos pa dang / brjod pa dang / brjod par bya ba bzhi nges par brjod par bya ba ma yin nam //
analyzed: 'brel ba dang / dgos pa dang / brjod pa dang / brjod par bya ba bzhi nges par brjod par bya ba ma yin nam //
translated: are not four things—the connection, the purpose, the summary, and the explanation—definitely to be stated?

original: de 'di la med pas 'di'i rtsom pa ni mi rigs pa yin te /
analyzed: de 'di la med pas 'di'i rtsom pa ni mi rigs pa yin te /
translated: Since those are not present here, it is not reasonable to compose this.

original: 'brel pa la sogs pa dang bral ba'i phyir smyon pa'i tshigs bzhin no zhe'o //
analyzed: 'brel pa la sogs pa dang bral ba'i phyir smyon pa'i tshigs bzhin no zhe'o //
translated: because it is devoid of connection, etc., like the words of a madman.

original: brtsam par mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni chos so //
analyzed: brtsam par mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni chos so //
translated: One should not undertake it is the subject.

original: bstan bcos zhes bya ba chos can no //
analyzed: bstan bcos zhes bya ba chos can no //
translated: Treatise is the subject.

original: chos dang chos can spyi ni phyogs so //
analyzed: chos dang chos can spyi ni phyogs so //
translated: The general subject and predicate are the position.

original: brel ba la sogs pa dang bral ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni gtam tshigs so //🔽go bar byed pas na gtam tshigs te /
analyzed: brel ba la sogs pa dang bral ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni gtam tshigs so // go bar byed pas na gtam tshigs te /
translated: Because it is devoid of connection, etc. is the reason.🔽 It is a reason because it causes understanding of the meaning.

original: gtan tshigs kyis don ni go bar byed pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gtan tshigs kyis don ni go bar byed pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the meaning is understood by the reason.

original: gang gi phyir 'brel pa la sogs dang bral ba'i phyir brtsams par mi bya'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'brel pa la sogs dang bral ba'i phyir brtsams par mi bya'o //
translated: Because it is devoid of connection, etc., one should not undertake it.

original: smyon pa'i tshig bzhin no zhes bya ba'i ni dpe'o //
analyzed: smyon pa'i tshig bzhin no zhes bya ba'i ni dpe'o //
translated: Like the words of a madman is the example.

original: de skad du brgal ba la smras pa /
analyzed: de skad du brgal ba la smras pa /
translated: Thus, in response to that objection, it is said:

original: 'brel pa la sogs pa dang bral ba'i phyir @22a * //
analyzed: 'brel pa la sogs pa dang bral ba'i phyir @22a * //
translated: Because it is devoid of connection, etc.,

original: zhes gang smras pa'i gtan tshigs de ma grub par brjod pa'i phyir bshad pa 'di la 'brel pa la sogs pa bzhi yod pa nyid do //
analyzed: zhes gang smras pa'i gtan tshigs de ma grub par brjod pa'i phyir bshad pa 'di la 'brel pa la sogs pa bzhi yod pa nyid do //
translated: In order to show that the reason stated is not established, it is explained that this has the four: connection, etc.

original: de yang gang zhe na /
analyzed: de yang gang zhe na /
translated: What is that?🔽It is the treatise called the Exposition of the Verse Summary of the Precious

original: smras pa / s'a lu ljang pa'i mdo dang sbyar ba'i bstan bcos tshig le'ur byas pa bshad par bya ba yin pas 'di la 'brel pa yod pa nyid de /
analyzed: smras pa / s'a lu ljang pa'i mdo dang sbyar ba'i bstan bcos tshig le'ur byas pa bshad par bya ba yin pas 'di la 'brel pa yod pa nyid de /
translated: Lamp, which is to be explained. Therefore, it is indeed related to this.🔽The treatise called the Exposition of the Verse Summary of the Precious🔽Lamp is related to the Buddha because it is not concerned with the particular

original: s'a lu ljang pa'i mdo zhes bya ba ni mu stegs byed pa la sogs pa gzhan gyi gzhung lugs kyi khyad par dag la mi dmigs pa'i phyir bstan bcos 'di ni sangs rgyas dang 'brel pa'o //
analyzed: s'a lu ljang pa'i mdo zhes bya ba ni mu stegs byed pa la sogs pa gzhan gyi gzhung lugs kyi khyad par dag la mi dmigs pa'i phyir bstan bcos 'di ni sangs rgyas dang 'brel pa'o //
translated: doctrines of others, such as the tīrthikas.

original: de'i phyir gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid do //
analyzed: de'i phyir gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid do //
translated: Therefore, the meaning of the reason is not established.

original: 'brel pa yod pa dang dgos pa yang med na med pa yin no //
analyzed: 'brel pa yod pa dang dgos pa yang med na med pa yin no //
translated: If there is no relation, there is no purpose.

original: de'i phyir bshad pa /
analyzed: de'i phyir bshad pa /
translated: Therefore, it is said:

original: 'dir ni dgos pa ni /
analyzed: 'dir ni dgos pa ni /
translated: Here, the purpose is🔽.

original: rgyu dang rkyen gyi don khong du chud pa'i phyir dang / gang zag la bdag med pa dang / chos la bdag med pa dang / gzung ba dang / 'dzin pa med par rtogs pa'i phyir nyon mongs pa dang / shes bya'i sgrib pa dang bral nas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas thob pas 'di la dgos pa yod pa nyid do //
analyzed: rgyu dang rkyen gyi don khong du chud pa'i phyir dang / gang zag la bdag med pa dang / chos la bdag med pa dang / gzung ba dang / 'dzin pa med par rtogs pa'i phyir nyon mongs pa dang / shes bya'i sgrib pa dang bral nas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas thob pas 'di la dgos pa yod pa nyid do //
translated: Because it comprehends the meaning of cause and effect, and because it is free from the afflictive obstructions and the obstructions to omniscience by realizing the selflessness of persons, the selflessness of phenomena, and the nonexistence of apprehended objects and apprehending subjects, it attains unsurpassed, perfect, complete enlightenment. Therefore, it is meaningful.

original: de bas na dgos pa dang bcas pa'i phyir gso ba la sogs pa'i bstan bcos bzhin du brtsam par bya ba nyid do //
analyzed: de bas na dgos pa dang bcas pa'i phyir gso ba la sogs pa'i bstan bcos bzhin du brtsam par bya ba nyid do //
translated: Therefore, because it is meaningful, it should be undertaken, just like the treatises on medicine and so on.

original: gang dang gang don dang bcas pa de dang de ni brtsam par bya ba ste /
analyzed: gang dang gang don dang bcas pa de dang de ni brtsam par bya ba ste /
translated: Whatever is meaningful should be undertaken.

original: dper na gso ba la sogs pa'i bstan bcos lta bu yin pas dpe ma grub par bshad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dper na gso ba la sogs pa'i bstan bcos lta bu yin pas dpe ma grub par bshad par 'gyur ro //
translated: For example, it is like the treatises on medicine and so on. Therefore you have explained an unestablished example.

original: 'di'i brjod pas s'a lu ljang pa'i dpes nang dang phyi'i rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba mtshungs pa nye bar sbyar bas 'di brjod pas s'a lu ljang pa zhes bya ba yang yod pa nyid de /
analyzed: 'di'i brjod pas s'a lu ljang pa'i dpes nang dang phyi'i rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba mtshungs pa nye bar sbyar bas 'di brjod pas s'a lu ljang pa zhes bya ba yang yod pa nyid de /
translated: Since this is stated by the example of the green rice seedling, the internal and external dependent origination are similar. Since this is stated, the so-called green rice seedling exists.

original: de'i phyir yang don ma grub pa nyid do //
analyzed: de'i phyir yang don ma grub pa nyid do //
translated: Therefore, the meaning of the reason is not established.

original: brjod par bya ba zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: brjod par bya ba zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The so-called expressible

original: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i yan lag bcu gnyis rkyen dang bcas pa so sor go rims bzhin mtshan nyid rnam par 'jog par byed pas byed pa po la sogs pa dang / rgyu med pa dang mi mthun pa'i rgyu dang 'bral nas nyon mongs pa dang nye ba'i nyon mongs pa spangs pa'i phyir yang dag pa'i ye shes skyes te /
analyzed: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i yan lag bcu gnyis rkyen dang bcas pa so sor go rims bzhin mtshan nyid rnam par 'jog par byed pas byed pa po la sogs pa dang / rgyu med pa dang mi mthun pa'i rgyu dang 'bral nas nyon mongs pa dang nye ba'i nyon mongs pa spangs pa'i phyir yang dag pa'i ye shes skyes te /
translated: is the twelve factors of dependent origination together with their conditions, which are individually posited as characteristics in sequence. The correct wisdom arises by abandoning afflictions and secondary afflictions, having separated from the creator and so on, causelessness, and discordant causes.

original: bla na med pa'i chos sku thob pas 'di brjod par bya ba yang yod pa nyid de 'di'i phyir yang gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid do //
analyzed: bla na med pa'i chos sku thob pas 'di brjod par bya ba yang yod pa nyid de 'di'i phyir yang gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid do //
translated: Since the unsurpassed dharma body is attained, the so-called expressible exists. Therefore, the meaning of the reason is also not established.

original: de bas na gso ba la sogs pa'i bstan bcos bzhin du bstan bcos 'di 'brel pa la sogs pa dang ldan pa'i phyir brtsam par bya ba nyid do //
analyzed: de bas na gso ba la sogs pa'i bstan bcos bzhin du bstan bcos 'di 'brel pa la sogs pa dang ldan pa'i phyir brtsam par bya ba nyid do //
translated: Therefore, this treatise is worthy of composition because it is connected with the treatises on medicine, etc.

original: brtsam @22b par bya ba zhes bya ba ni chos so //
analyzed: brtsam @22b par bya ba zhes bya ba ni chos so //
translated: The expression “worthy of composition” is the probandum.

original: bstan bcos zhes bya ba ni chos can no //
analyzed: bstan bcos zhes bya ba ni chos can no //
translated: The expression “treatise” is the subject.

original: chos dang chos can spyi ni phyogs so //
analyzed: chos dang chos can spyi ni phyogs so //
translated: The probandum and the subject are the “topic.”

original: 'di na chos yod pas chos can te gdugs can bzhin no //
analyzed: 'di na chos yod pas chos can te gdugs can bzhin no //
translated: The subject is so called because the probandum is present in it, just as one speaks of a parasol-holder because the parasol is present in it.

original: gal te de lta na bstan bcos rtsom pa la phyag 'tshal bar byed pa don med de /
analyzed: gal te de lta na bstan bcos rtsom pa la phyag 'tshal bar byed pa don med de /
translated: If that is so, then it is pointless to pay homage to the teacher at the beginning of the treatise,🔽because the reason you have given, “because it has no purpose,” is inconclusive, like the treatise on the teeth of a crow.

original: dgos pa med pa'i phyir bya rog gi so brtag pa la sogs pa'i bstan bcos bzhin no zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs 'di ni don ma grub pa nyid bstan par smras pa /
analyzed: dgos pa med pa'i phyir bya rog gi so brtag pa la sogs pa'i bstan bcos bzhin no zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs 'di ni don ma grub pa nyid bstan par smras pa /
translated: We reply: You have not understood the meaning of our reason.

original: bstan bcos rtsom pa la ston pa la mchod pa byas so //
analyzed: bstan bcos rtsom pa la ston pa la mchod pa byas so //
translated: We pay homage to the teacher at the beginning of the treatise because he is the cause of the treatise and because he is the cause of respect for the treatise.

original: gal te ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: gal te ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: bstan bcos dang / de la gus pa skye ba'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: bstan bcos dang / de la gus pa skye ba'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because he is the cause of the treatise and because he is the cause of respect for the treatise.

original: chos nyan pa gus pa skye ba rnams nyan pa dang sems pa dang / bsgom pa dag la gus par 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: chos nyan pa gus pa skye ba rnams nyan pa dang sems pa dang / bsgom pa dag la gus par 'gyur gyi /
translated: Those who have generated respect for listening to the Dharma will have respect for listening, reflection, and meditation,

original: gus pa ma skyes pa rnams ni ma yin pas gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid do //
analyzed: gus pa ma skyes pa rnams ni ma yin pas gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid do //
translated: but those who have not generated respect will not. Therefore the meaning of the reason is not established.

original: yang na dam pa'i spyod pa'i srol bstan pa'i don du bstan bcos rtsom pa las ston pa la mchod pa byed do //
analyzed: yang na dam pa'i spyod pa'i srol bstan pa'i don du bstan bcos rtsom pa las ston pa la mchod pa byed do //
translated: Or, the homage is made to the Teacher in order to compose the treatise to demonstrate the tradition of the conduct of holy beings.

original: 'di ni skyes bu dam pa mkhas pa rnams kyi spyod pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di ni skyes bu dam pa mkhas pa rnams kyi spyod pa yin te /
translated: This is the conduct of holy beings and scholars.

original: nam zhig 'ga' zhig dgos pa rtsom pa la 'jug na dang por yid du 'ong ba'i lha la phyag 'tshal te /
analyzed: nam zhig 'ga' zhig dgos pa rtsom pa la 'jug na dang por yid du 'ong ba'i lha la phyag 'tshal te /
translated: When some engage in the composition of a treatise, at the outset they pay homage to a pleasing deity.

original: dgos pa khyad par dag la zhugs pa na 'dod pa'i don ring por mi thogs par 'grub pas de'i phyir bstan bcos byed pa 'di yang dam pa'i spyod pa'i srol de nyid kyi rjes su 'brang ba na bstan bcos rtsom pa la rang gi ston pa la yon
analyzed: dgos pa khyad par dag la zhugs pa na 'dod pa'i don ring por mi thogs par 'grub pas de'i phyir bstan bcos byed pa 'di yang dam pa'i spyod pa'i srol de nyid kyi rjes su 'brang ba na bstan bcos rtsom pa la rang gi ston pa la yon
translated: When they engage in special purposes, they accomplish their desired aims without delay. Therefore, when this treatise also follows that tradition of the conduct of holy beings, it pays homage to its own teacher at the outset of composing the treatise.

original: tan brjod pa sngon du 'gro ba'i phyag 'tshal ba byas nas /
analyzed: tan brjod pa sngon du 'gro ba'i phyag 'tshal ba byas nas /
translated: Having paid homage with a statement of the virtues of the teacher,

original: bstan bcos bshad par bya ba la zhugs pas 'di la dgos pa yod pa nyid do //
analyzed: bstan bcos bshad par bya ba la zhugs pas 'di la dgos pa yod pa nyid do //
translated: he begins the explanation of the treatise. Thus, it is not the case that this work has no purpose.

original: smras pa / bstan bcos rtsom pa ston pa la //
analyzed: smras pa / bstan bcos rtsom pa ston pa la //
translated: Objection: The homage at the beginning of a treatise

original: phyag 'tshal byed pa 'bras med min //
analyzed: phyag 'tshal byed pa 'bras med min //
translated: is not without result.

original: ston pa dang ni bstan bcos la //
analyzed: ston pa dang ni bstan bcos la //
translated: It is done out of respect for the teacher and the treatise,

original: gus bskyed rgyu phyir gzhan du min //
analyzed: gus bskyed rgyu phyir gzhan du min //
translated: not for any other reason.

original: de nas bstan bcos rtsom pas ston pa la mchod pa bya ba rnam par gnas pa nyid do //
analyzed: de nas bstan bcos rtsom pas ston pa la mchod pa bya ba rnam par gnas pa nyid do //
translated: Since the treatise is composed by the teacher, it is proper to pay homage to the teacher at the beginning of the treatise.

original: de'i phyir gzhan gyi bstan bcos kyi thog mar phyag 'tshal bar byed par dgos pa med do zhes gang smras /
analyzed: de'i phyir gzhan gyi bstan bcos kyi thog mar phyag 'tshal bar byed par dgos pa med do zhes gang smras /
translated: Therefore, it is not the case that paying homage at the beginning of another’s treatise is pointless.

original: gtan tshigs de ma grub pa nyid du bstan par smras pa /
analyzed: gtan tshigs de ma grub pa nyid du bstan par smras pa /
translated: In response to this, we say:

original: bstan bcos rtsom pa la phyag 'tshal bar byed pa ni /🔽gso ba la sogs pa'i bstan bcos bzhin du dgos pa dang bcas pa nyid do //
analyzed: bstan bcos rtsom pa la phyag 'tshal bar byed pa ni / gso ba la sogs pa'i bstan bcos bzhin du dgos pa dang bcas pa nyid do //
translated: The homage at the beginning of a treatise

original: bya rog gi so brtag pa lta bu min no //
analyzed: bya rog gi so brtag pa lta bu min no //
translated: is not pointless, like a treatise on the treatment of crows’ beaks.

original: rang gi ston pa la phyag byas te /
analyzed: rang gi ston pa la phyag byas te /
translated: Having paid homage to his teacher,🔽he will compose a treatise in verse

original: s'a lu ljang pa'i mdo dang sbyar ba'i bstan bcos tshig le'ur byas pa @23a * //🔽bshad par bya'o zhes smras na /
analyzed: s'a lu ljang pa'i mdo dang sbyar ba'i bstan bcos tshig le'ur byas pa @23a * // bshad par bya'o zhes smras na /
translated: that is connected with the Rice Seedling Sutra.

original: de yang gang zhig ce na /
analyzed: de yang gang zhig ce na /
translated: If someone were to ask, “What is that? ”🔽he would say, “The Sage, in the King’s

original: thub pa rgyal po'i khab kyi ni //
analyzed: thub pa rgyal po'i khab kyi ni //
translated: Capital, on the Vulture Peak Mountain,🔽at one time, together with a great

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //🔽rgyal po'i khab ni rgyal khab ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so // rgyal po'i khab ni rgyal khab ste /
translated: assembly of monks, taught this sutra. ”🔽The King’s Capital is the king’s country.

original: rgyal po'i pho brang zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: rgyal po'i pho brang zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It is a synonym for the king’s palace.

original: bya rgod ces pa'i ri bo la //
analyzed: bya rgod ces pa'i ri bo la //
translated: On the Vulture Peak Mountain.

original: zhes bya ba ni bya rgod phung po'i ri bo la'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni bya rgod phung po'i ri bo la'o //
translated: This is the Vulture Peak Mountain.

original: de nyid kyi phyir yang dag par sdud par byed pa'i mdo las /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir yang dag par sdud par byed pa'i mdo las /
translated: Therefore, in the Sutra of the Perfectly United,

original: 'di skad bdag gis thos pa zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: 'di skad bdag gis thos pa zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: it says, “Thus have I heard. ”

original: su las thos shes na /
analyzed: su las thos shes na /
translated: If someone were to ask, “From whom did he hear it? ”

original: de'i phyir smras pa /
analyzed: de'i phyir smras pa /
translated: therefore he says,

original: bcom ldan 'das las so //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das las so //
translated: “From the Bhagavat. ”

original: dus gcig na zhes bya ba ni dus gcig na'o //
analyzed: dus gcig na zhes bya ba ni dus gcig na'o //
translated: At one time means at one time.

original: bcom ldan 'das zhes bya ba ni bcom pa dang ldan pa'i phyir bcom ldan 'das so //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das zhes bya ba ni bcom pa dang ldan pa'i phyir bcom ldan 'das so //
translated: The Bhagavat is the Bhagavat because he is endowed with destruction.

original: ci zhig bcom pa dang ldan zhe na /
analyzed: ci zhig bcom pa dang ldan zhe na /
translated: What is destroyed?

original: de'i phyir smras pa /
analyzed: de'i phyir smras pa /
translated: Therefore it is said:

original: bdud bzhi'o // nyon mongs pa dang / phung po dang / lha'i bu dang / 'chi bdag gi bdud ces grags pa'o //
analyzed: bdud bzhi'o // nyon mongs pa dang / phung po dang / lha'i bu dang / 'chi bdag gi bdud ces grags pa'o //
translated: The four demons, the demon of affliction, the demon of the aggregates, the demon of the son of the gods, and the demon of death.

original: ji ltar bcom zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar bcom zhe na /
translated: How are they destroyed?

original: smras pa / gnyen po ye shes brnyes pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: smras pa / gnyen po ye shes brnyes pa'i phyir te /
translated: It is said: Because the wisdom of the antidote is attained.

original: mthong ba dang bsgom pa'i lam la 'jug pa'i tshul gyis dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi la sogs pa byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun bsgom pa'i rim gyis /
analyzed: mthong ba dang bsgom pa'i lam la 'jug pa'i tshul gyis dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi la sogs pa byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun bsgom pa'i rim gyis /
translated: Through the process of engaging the path of seeing and meditation, by the process of cultivating the thirty-seven factors of enlightenment such as the four establishments of mindfulness,

original: 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi sgom pa rnam par bsgom pa nyid kyis phung po'i de kho na nyid yongs su shes pas mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang ; stong pa dang / bdag med pa la sogs par phyin ci ma log pa'i ye shes dang ldan pa'i phyir gang zag dang chos la bdag med pa dang /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi sgom pa rnam par bsgom pa nyid kyis phung po'i de kho na nyid yongs su shes pas mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang ; stong pa dang / bdag med pa la sogs par phyin ci ma log pa'i ye shes dang ldan pa'i phyir gang zag dang chos la bdag med pa dang /
translated: through the cultivation of the meditation on the four noble truths, because of the complete knowledge of the reality of the aggregates, one possesses unmistaken wisdom with regard to impermanence, suffering, emptiness, selflessness, and so on. Therefore one possesses the wisdom of the selflessness of persons and phenomena.

original: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa med par rtog pa'i phyir dang / khams gsum pa 'di yang sems tsam kho na'o zhes bya bar rtogs pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa med par rtog pa'i phyir dang / khams gsum pa 'di yang sems tsam kho na'o zhes bya bar rtogs pa'i phyir /
translated: Because it is realized that there is no subject and object, and because it is realized that these three realms are only mind.

original: nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa dang bral ba'i sgo nas nyon mongs pa bcom mo //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa dang bral ba'i sgo nas nyon mongs pa bcom mo //
translated: The afflictions are destroyed by being free from the afflictive obstructions and the obstructions to omniscience.

original: rtag pa dang / bde ba dang / gtsang ba dang / bdag dang bcas par phyin ci log pa bzhi la sogs pa dang bral ba ste /
analyzed: rtag pa dang / bde ba dang / gtsang ba dang / bdag dang bcas par phyin ci log pa bzhi la sogs pa dang bral ba ste /
translated: It is free from the four errors of permanence, happiness, purity, and self.

original: chos kyi sku bla na med pa dang ldan nas mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa brnyes pa'i phyir phung po dang 'chi bdag gi bdud las rgyal lo //
analyzed: chos kyi sku bla na med pa dang ldan nas mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa brnyes pa'i phyir phung po dang 'chi bdag gi bdud las rgyal lo //
translated: It conquers the aggregates and the demon of death because it attains the unsurpassed Dharma body and attains nonabiding nirvana.

original: chos thams cad sgyu ma dang / smig rgyu dang / dri za'i grong khyer dang / sprul pa dang / gzugs brnyan dang / brag ca dang / mgal me'i 'khor lo dang / rmi lam lta bur shin tu thugs su chud pa'i phyir kun nas nyon mongs pa'i kun gzhi rnam par shes pa'i @23b bag chags kyi dri ma dang bral bas yang dag pa ma yin pa'i kun tu rtog pa yang dag par chad nas byams pa chen po la
analyzed: chos thams cad sgyu ma dang / smig rgyu dang / dri za'i grong khyer dang / sprul pa dang / gzugs brnyan dang / brag ca dang / mgal me'i 'khor lo dang / rmi lam lta bur shin tu thugs su chud pa'i phyir kun nas nyon mongs pa'i kun gzhi rnam par shes pa'i @23b bag chags kyi dri ma dang bral bas yang dag pa ma yin pa'i kun tu rtog pa yang dag par chad nas byams pa chen po la
translated: Because he fully comprehended that all phenomena are like illusions, mirages, cities of gandharvas, emanations, reflections, echoes, fire wheels, and dreams, he was free from the stains of habitual tendencies in the alaya consciousness of affliction. Having completely severed false imagination, he shot the arrow of great love

original: sogs pa'i mda' 'phangs pas chu srin gyi rgyal mtshan can sde dang bcas pa la bsnun pa'i phyir lha'i bu'i bdud pham par mdzad de /
analyzed: sogs pa'i mda' 'phangs pas chu srin gyi rgyal mtshan can sde dang bcas pa la bsnun pa'i phyir lha'i bu'i bdud pham par mdzad de /
translated: and so forth, striking the demon lord of the sea along with his army. Thus he conquered the demon of the sons of the gods.

original: de ltar bdud bzhi bcom pas na bcom ldan 'das so //
analyzed: de ltar bdud bzhi bcom pas na bcom ldan 'das so //
translated: Since he thus conquered the four demons, he is the Bhagavān.

original: yang smras pa /
analyzed: yang smras pa /
translated: Moreover, it is said:🔽Because he conquered the four demons,🔽Because he emerged from the three existences,

original: bdud bzhi'i dgra ni bcom phyir dang // srid pa gsum las byung ba dang // byung 'gyur 'byung ba 'byung mkhyen cing //
analyzed: bdud bzhi'i dgra ni bcom phyir dang // srid pa gsum las byung ba dang // byung 'gyur 'byung ba 'byung mkhyen cing //
translated: And because he knows what has emerged, what will emerge, and what is emerging,

original: srid par gnas 'di bcom ldan 'das //
analyzed: srid par gnas 'di bcom ldan 'das //
translated: This existence is destroyed by the Lord.

original: bcom ldan 'das de lta bu ni rgyal po'i khab /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das de lta bu ni rgyal po'i khab /
translated: The Lord is staying at Rājagṛha,

original: bya rgod phung po'i ri la bzhugs so //
analyzed: bya rgod phung po'i ri la bzhugs so //
translated: on the Vulture Peak Mountain.

original: ci'i phyir grong khyer de la rgyal po'i khab ces bya zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir grong khyer de la rgyal po'i khab ces bya zhe na /
translated: Why is that city called Rājagṛha?

original: smras pa / grong khyer de ni sngon rtsva mchog gi grong khyer zhes grags te /
analyzed: smras pa / grong khyer de ni sngon rtsva mchog gi grong khyer zhes grags te /
translated: It is said: That city was previously known as Kuśāgrapura.

original: gang gi tshe grong khyer de la mi ma yin pa 'khrugs pa rnams kyis yang dang yang me btang ba de'i tshe rgyal pos rtogs nas bka' btags pa /
analyzed: gang gi tshe grong khyer de la mi ma yin pa 'khrugs pa rnams kyis yang dang yang me btang ba de'i tshe rgyal pos rtogs nas bka' btags pa /
translated: When that city was repeatedly set on fire by agitated non-humans, the king, having understood, issued an order:🔽Sirs, citizens! From now on, whoever's house was first set on fire by the fire, he should go to the great Śītavana charnel ground, build a house there, and live.

original: shes ldan grong khyer ba dag / deng phyin chad gang gi khyim du sngar me shor ba des bsil ba'i tshal gyi dur khrod chen por song la khyim brtsigs te 'dug shig ces bsgo ba dang / de nas yang las kyi rkyen gyi dbang gis dang por rgyal po'i pho brang du me shor ro //
analyzed: shes ldan grong khyer ba dag / deng phyin chad gang gi khyim du sngar me shor ba des bsil ba'i tshal gyi dur khrod chen por song la khyim brtsigs te 'dug shig ces bsgo ba dang / de nas yang las kyi rkyen gyi dbang gis dang por rgyal po'i pho brang du me shor ro //
translated: Then, due to the power of the condition of karma, first the king's palace caught fire.

original: de nas rgyal pos blon po rnams la bos te bsgo ba /
analyzed: de nas rgyal pos blon po rnams la bos te bsgo ba /
translated: Then the king called the ministers and ordered them:

original: shes ldan blon po dag shes par gyis shig /'di ltar nga nyid kyis de khrims su bcas pa las nga nyid 'da' bar byed pa gang yin pa de ni nga la ma legs shing tshul ma yin pas shes ldan blon po dag deng la bsil ba'i tshal gyi
analyzed: shes ldan blon po dag shes par gyis shig /'di ltar nga nyid kyis de khrims su bcas pa las nga nyid 'da' bar byed pa gang yin pa de ni nga la ma legs shing tshul ma yin pas shes ldan blon po dag deng la bsil ba'i tshal gyi
translated: “Sirs, ministers, know this: since I myself have established this law, it is not good for me to transgress it. Therefore, sirs, ministers, go to the great cemetery of the Śītavana charnel ground

original: dur khrod chen po'i nang du rgyal po'i pho brang brtsigs shig dang der song nas 'dug par bya'o //
analyzed: dur khrod chen po'i nang du rgyal po'i pho brang brtsigs shig dang der song nas 'dug par bya'o //
translated: and build a royal palace there. I will go and stay there.”

original: de nas rgyal po'i tshig tsam gyis thams cad kyis de bzhin du byas so //
analyzed: de nas rgyal po'i tshig tsam gyis thams cad kyis de bzhin du byas so //
translated: Then, by the mere word of the king, they all did just that.

original: de la thog mar ni rgyal pos der phyin te gnas btab /
analyzed: de la thog mar ni rgyal pos der phyin te gnas btab /
translated: First the king went there and settled.

original: de nas ni gzhan dag gis btab pas rgyal po'i khab ces ming chags so //
analyzed: de nas ni gzhan dag gis btab pas rgyal po'i khab ces ming chags so //
translated: Then others also settled there, so it became known as Rājagṛha.

original: de la rgyal po'i khab grong khyer chen po'i shar lho'i mtshams na /
analyzed: de la rgyal po'i khab grong khyer chen po'i shar lho'i mtshams na /
translated: To the southeast of the great city of Rājagṛha,

original: bya rgod phung po zhes bya ba'i ri yod de /
analyzed: bya rgod phung po zhes bya ba'i ri yod de /
translated: there is a mountain called Vulture Peak.

original: ri gang gi spyi bo bya rgod kyi mgo 'dra ba de la bya rgod phung po'i ri zhes bya'o //
analyzed: ri gang gi spyi bo bya rgod kyi mgo 'dra ba de la bya rgod phung po'i ri zhes bya'o //
translated: The mountain that has a peak like the head of a vulture is called Vulture Peak.

original: yang na bdud sdig can gyis bya rgod kyi sha tshugs su mngon par sprul te bcom ldan 'das kyi chos gos dbrog par bya bar brtsams pa las bcom ldan 'das kyi byin gyi rlabs kyis ma nus nas de nyid du bor te chos @24a * //
analyzed: yang na bdud sdig can gyis bya rgod kyi sha tshugs su mngon par sprul te bcom ldan 'das kyi chos gos dbrog par bya bar brtsams pa las bcom ldan 'das kyi byin gyi rlabs kyis ma nus nas de nyid du bor te chos @24a * //
translated: Or else, the evil Mara, having manifested himself in the form of a vulture, began to carry off the robe of the Lord. But, by the power of the Lord, he was unable to do so. He dropped it right there.

original: gos de deng sang du yang rdor gyur nas bzhi rim byas te chos gos lta bur 'dug go //
analyzed: gos de deng sang du yang rdor gyur nas bzhi rim byas te chos gos lta bur 'dug go //
translated: That robe, having become stone, is arranged in four layers, and is there like a robe to this day.

original: de nye bar mtshon pa'i ri ni bya rgod phung po zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de nye bar mtshon pa'i ri ni bya rgod phung po zhes bya ste /
translated: The mountain that is indicated by that is called Vulture Peak.

original: thub pa bya rgod phung po'i ri de la bzhugs so //
analyzed: thub pa bya rgod phung po'i ri de la bzhugs so //

original: gang dag la zhe na /
analyzed: gang dag la zhe na /

analyzed: chos mthong nas sangs rgyas mthong ngo zhes bya ba ni /

analyzed: smras zhes bya ba ni brjod pa'o //

analyzed: gang la smras shen /

original: 'di lta ste ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis 'du byed /
analyzed: 'di lta ste ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis 'du byed /
translated: It is thus: with ignorance as condition, volitional formations;

original: 'du byed kyi rkyen gyis rnam par shes pa /
analyzed: 'du byed kyi rkyen gyis rnam par shes pa /
translated: with volitional formations as condition, consciousness;

original: rnam par shes pa'i rkyen gyis ming dang gzugs /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i rkyen gyis ming dang gzugs /
translated: with consciousness as condition, name-and-form;

original: ming dang gzugs kyi rkyen gyis skye mched drug /
analyzed: ming dang gzugs kyi rkyen gyis skye mched drug /
translated: with name-and-form as condition, the six sense bases;

original: skye mched drug gi rkyen gyis reg pa /🔽reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba /
analyzed: skye mched drug gi rkyen gyis reg pa / reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba /
translated: with the six sense bases as condition, contact;🔽with contact as condition, feeling;

original: tshor ba'i rkyen gyis sred pa /
analyzed: tshor ba'i rkyen gyis sred pa /
translated: with feeling as condition, craving;

original: sred pa'i rkyen gyis len pa /
analyzed: sred pa'i rkyen gyis len pa /
translated: with craving as condition, clinging;

original: len pa'i rkyen gyis srid pa /🔽srid pa'i rkyen gyis skye ba /
analyzed: len pa'i rkyen gyis srid pa / srid pa'i rkyen gyis skye ba /
translated: with clinging as condition, existence;🔽with existence as condition, birth;

original: skye ba'i rkyen gyis rga shi /
analyzed: skye ba'i rkyen gyis rga shi /
translated: with birth as condition, old age, death,

original: rga shi'i rkyen gyis mya ngan dang / smre sngags 'don pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / yid mi bde ba dang / 'khrug pa rnams 'byung ste /
analyzed: rga shi'i rkyen gyis mya ngan dang / smre sngags 'don pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / yid mi bde ba dang / 'khrug pa rnams 'byung ste /
translated: Due to the condition of old age and death, grief, lamentation, suffering, unhappiness, and agitation arise.🔽Thus, this entire great mass of suffering comes into being.

original: de ltar sdug bsngal gyi phung po chen po 'di 'ba' zhig 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba 'di ni bcom ldan 'das kyi rten cing 'brel pa'o zhes gsungs so //🔽de la rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba zhes bya ba ni rgyu dang bcas /
analyzed: de ltar sdug bsngal gyi phung po chen po 'di 'ba' zhig 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba 'di ni bcom ldan 'das kyi rten cing 'brel pa'o zhes gsungs so // de la rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba zhes bya ba ni rgyu dang bcas /
translated: This is the Lord’s teaching on dependent origination.

original: rkyen dang bcas pa la bya'i /
analyzed: rkyen dang bcas pa la bya'i /
translated: Here, dependent origination means that which arises in dependence on causes and conditions.🔽It does not mean that which arises without causes and conditions.

original: rgyu med pa dang / rkyen med pa la ma yin pas de'i phyir rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rgyu med pa dang / rkyen med pa la ma yin pas de'i phyir rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it is called dependent origination.

original: yang ma rig pa la sogs pa srid pa'i yan lag 'di rnams 'byung ba'i go rims ni ji ltar rtogs par bya /
analyzed: yang ma rig pa la sogs pa srid pa'i yan lag 'di rnams 'byung ba'i go rims ni ji ltar rtogs par bya /
translated: How should one understand the order of the arising of these members of existence, beginning with ignorance?

original: mtshan nyid ni gang /
analyzed: mtshan nyid ni gang /
translated: What are their characteristics?

original: las ni ci /
analyzed: las ni ci /
translated: What are their functions?

original: gang zhig ni yin zhe na /
analyzed: gang zhig ni yin zhe na /
translated: What are they?

original: smras pa / de la rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba ni gnyis kyi phyir 'byung bar rtogs par bya ste /
analyzed: smras pa / de la rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba ni gnyis kyi phyir 'byung bar rtogs par bya ste /
translated: Objection: Dependent origination should be understood as twofold.

original: gnyis gang zhe na /
analyzed: gnyis gang zhe na /
translated: What are the two?

original: smras pa / rgyu dang 'brel pa dang / rkyen dang 'brel ba'o //
analyzed: smras pa / rgyu dang 'brel pa dang / rkyen dang 'brel ba'o //
translated: Response: The connection with causes and the connection with conditions.

original: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba de yang phyi nang gi tha dad pa'i phyir rnam pa gnyis su rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba de yang phyi nang gi tha dad pa'i phyir rnam pa gnyis su rnam par gzhag go //
translated: Moreover, that dependent origination is presented as twofold because of the difference between internal and external.

original: ji lta zhe na /🔽smras @26a * //
analyzed: ji lta zhe na / smras @26a * //
translated: How is that?

original: pa ; sa bon las myu gu skye ba nas 'bras bu skye ba'i bar te /
analyzed: pa ; sa bon las myu gu skye ba nas 'bras bu skye ba'i bar te /
translated: Response: From the seed arises the sprout, and so on up to the arising of the fruit.

original: sa bon yod na myu gu skye ba dang 'bras bu skye ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sa bon yod na myu gu skye ba dang 'bras bu skye ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because when the seed exists, the sprout arises and the fruit arises.

original: sa bon med na myu gu mi skye ba nas /
analyzed: sa bon med na myu gu mi skye ba nas /
translated: When the seed does not exist, the sprout does not arise,

original: 'bras bu mi skye ba'i bar ro //🔽sa bon kyang 'di snyam du bdag gis myu gu mngon par bsgrubs so snyam du mi sems so ;
analyzed: 'bras bu mi skye ba'i bar ro // sa bon kyang 'di snyam du bdag gis myu gu mngon par bsgrubs so snyam du mi sems so ;
translated: and so on up to the fruit does not arise.🔽The seed also does not think, “I produce the sprout.”

original: / myu gu yang 'di snyam du bdag ni sa bon gyis mngon par bsgrubs so snyam du mi sems pa nas /
analyzed: / myu gu yang 'di snyam du bdag ni sa bon gyis mngon par bsgrubs so snyam du mi sems pa nas /
translated: The sprout also does not think, “I am produced by the seed,” and so on up to

original: me tog kyang 'di snyam du 'bras bu mngon par bsgrubs so snyam du mngon par mi sems so //🔽'bras bu yang 'di snyam du bdag gi myu gu me tog gis mngon par bsgrubs so snyam du mi sems pa'i bar ro //
analyzed: me tog kyang 'di snyam du 'bras bu mngon par bsgrubs so snyam du mngon par mi sems so // 'bras bu yang 'di snyam du bdag gi myu gu me tog gis mngon par bsgrubs so snyam du mi sems pa'i bar ro //
translated: The flower also does not think, “I will accomplish the fruit.”🔽The fruit also does not think, “I am accomplished by the flower from the sprout.”

original: 'on kyang sa bon yod na myu gu nas 'bras bu'i bar du skye bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'on kyang sa bon yod na myu gu nas 'bras bu'i bar du skye bar 'gyur te /
translated: However, when there is a seed, the sprout arises, and so on up to: when there is a flower, the fruit arises.

original: de ltar phyi'i rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba rkyen dang 'brel par blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar phyi'i rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba rkyen dang 'brel par blta bar bya'o //
translated: Thus, external dependent arising should be seen in terms of the connection with conditions.

original: phyi rol gyi rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba rkyen dang 'brel par ji ltar blta zhe na /
analyzed: phyi rol gyi rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba rkyen dang 'brel par ji ltar blta zhe na /
translated: How should external dependent arising be seen in terms of the connection with conditions?

original: smras pa / khams drug 'dus pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: smras pa / khams drug 'dus pa'i phyir te /
translated: It is said: because of the combination of the six elements.

original: khams drug po dag gang zhe na /
analyzed: khams drug po dag gang zhe na /
translated: What are the six elements?

original: 'di lta ste sa la sogs pa dang / dus rnams te /
analyzed: 'di lta ste sa la sogs pa dang / dus rnams te /
translated: They are earth, water, fire, wind, space, and time.

original: de ltar phyi rol gyi rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba rkyen dang 'brel par blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar phyi rol gyi rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba rkyen dang 'brel par blta bar bya'o //
translated: Thus, external dependent arising should be seen in terms of the connection with conditions.

original: sa bon sa la sogs pa la ci zhig phan par byed nas rgyu'i rkyen du 'dod ce na /
analyzed: sa bon sa la sogs pa la ci zhig phan par byed nas rgyu'i rkyen du 'dod ce na /
translated: What benefit does the seed provide to the earth, etc., that it is considered to be a causal condition?

original: sa la sogs pa ni 'dzin pa la sogs pa dang / rlan pa dang / dro ba dang / 'bu ba dang / mi sgrib pa dang / 'gyur ba'i bya ba go rims bzhin du byed do //
analyzed: sa la sogs pa ni 'dzin pa la sogs pa dang / rlan pa dang / dro ba dang / 'bu ba dang / mi sgrib pa dang / 'gyur ba'i bya ba go rims bzhin du byed do //
translated: The earth, etc., act as a support, etc., as a moistener, a heater, a separator, a non-obstructor, and a transformer, respectively.

original: de dag med na mi 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: de dag med na mi 'gyur gyi /
translated: If they did not exist, the sprout would not arise.

original: nam ma tshang ba med pa na /
analyzed: nam ma tshang ba med pa na /
translated: But when they are complete,

original: thams cad 'dus pa de las der 'gyur ro //
analyzed: thams cad 'dus pa de las der 'gyur ro //
translated: the sprout arises from the combination of all of them.

original: sa la sogs pa yang 'di snyam du bdag cag gis sa bon 'dzin pa la sogs pa bya'o snyam du mi sems so //
analyzed: sa la sogs pa yang 'di snyam du bdag cag gis sa bon 'dzin pa la sogs pa bya'o snyam du mi sems so //
translated: The earth, etc., do not think, “We act as a support, etc., for the seed.”

original: sa bon yang 'di snyam du bdag la ni rkyen 'di rnams kyis 'dzin pa la sogs pa'i bya bas phan btags so snyam du mi sems so //
analyzed: sa bon yang 'di snyam du bdag la ni rkyen 'di rnams kyis 'dzin pa la sogs pa'i bya bas phan btags so snyam du mi sems so //
translated: The seed also does not think, “I am benefited by the action of these conditions.”

original: 'on kyang sal sogs pa yod na sa bon la myu gu la sogs pa 'byung bar 'gyur la /
analyzed: 'on kyang sal sogs pa yod na sa bon la myu gu la sogs pa 'byung bar 'gyur la /
translated: Nevertheless, when the earth, etc., exist, the sprout, etc., arise from the seed.

original: med na mi 'gyur /
analyzed: med na mi 'gyur /
translated: If they do not exist, they do not arise.

original: de nyid kyi phyir mdo mdzad pas gsungs pa /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir mdo mdzad pas gsungs pa /
translated: Therefore, the author of the sutra states:

original: yan lag bcu gnyis ma rig sogs //
analyzed: yan lag bcu gnyis ma rig sogs //
translated: The twelve members are ignorance, etc.

original: 'chi ba la thug go rims bzhin //🔽zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: 'chi ba la thug go rims bzhin // zhes bya ba la /
translated: Up to death, in the proper order.

original: srid pa'i yan lag gang dag la ma rig pa la sogs pa 'chi la thug pa yod pa de dag ni ma rig pa la sogs pa 'chi ba la thug pa rnams so //
analyzed: srid pa'i yan lag gang dag la ma rig pa la sogs pa 'chi la thug pa yod pa de dag ni ma rig pa la sogs pa 'chi ba la thug pa rnams so //
translated: The members of existence which have ignorance, etc. up to death are those which have ignorance, etc. up to death.

original: de lta bas na sdug @26b bsngal gyi phung po 'ba' zhig 'byung bar 'gyur zhes bya ba de lta bas na zhes bya ba ni ma rig pa la sogs pa rim gyis 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: de lta bas na sdug @26b bsngal gyi phung po 'ba' zhig 'byung bar 'gyur zhes bya ba de lta bas na zhes bya ba ni ma rig pa la sogs pa rim gyis 'byung ba'o //
translated: Therefore, the mass of suffering alone arises. Therefore means that ignorance, etc. arise in sequence.

original: sdug bsngal gyi phung po zhes bya ba ni sdug bsngal gyi tshogs so //
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi phung po zhes bya ba ni sdug bsngal gyi tshogs so //
translated: The mass of suffering means the collection of suffering.

original: 'ba' zhig ces bya ba ni bdag dang bdag gi dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: 'ba' zhig ces bya ba ni bdag dang bdag gi dang bral ba'o //
translated: Alone means devoid of self and what belongs to self.

original: 'byung bar 'gyur zhes bya ba ni skye bar 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: 'byung bar 'gyur zhes bya ba ni skye bar 'gyur ba'o //
translated: Arises means is produced.

original: chos lam yan lag brgyad pa dang // 'bras bu mya ngan 'das pa'o //🔽zhes smras te /
analyzed: chos lam yan lag brgyad pa dang // 'bras bu mya ngan 'das pa'o // zhes smras te /
translated: The Dharma is the eightfold path, and the result is nirvana.

original: chos ni rang gi mtshan nyid 'dzin pa'i phyir chos so //
analyzed: chos ni rang gi mtshan nyid 'dzin pa'i phyir chos so //
translated: The Dharma is so called because it holds its own characteristics.

original: lam yan lag brgyad pa zhes bya ba ni log pa'i lta ba dang / log pa'i rtog pa dang // log pa'i ngag dang / log pa'i las kyi mtha' dang / log pa'i 'tsho ba dang / log pa'i rtsol ba dang / log pa'i dran pa dang /🔽log pa'i ting nge 'dzin to //
analyzed: lam yan lag brgyad pa zhes bya ba ni log pa'i lta ba dang / log pa'i rtog pa dang // log pa'i ngag dang / log pa'i las kyi mtha' dang / log pa'i 'tsho ba dang / log pa'i rtsol ba dang / log pa'i dran pa dang / log pa'i ting nge 'dzin to //
translated: The so-called eightfold wrong path is: wrong view, wrong thought, wrong speech, wrong action, wrong livelihood, wrong effort, wrong mindfulness, and wrong concentration.

original: de la log pa'i lta ba zhes bya ba ni log pa'i lta ba ste /
analyzed: de la log pa'i lta ba zhes bya ba ni log pa'i lta ba ste /
translated: Wrong view is the wrong view.

original: lta ba lnga'o //
analyzed: lta ba lnga'o //
translated: It is the five views.

original: 'jig tshogs dang / mtha' dang / lta ba dang / tshul khrims dang log pa zhes bya pa'o //
analyzed: 'jig tshogs dang / mtha' dang / lta ba dang / tshul khrims dang log pa zhes bya pa'o //
translated: The view of the transitory collection, extreme views, false views, the view of esteeming morality and asceticism, and wrong views.

original: 'di thams cad kyang log par thos pa dang bsam pa la sogs pa zhugs pa ste /
analyzed: 'di thams cad kyang log par thos pa dang bsam pa la sogs pa zhugs pa ste /
translated: All of these are engaged in by means of wrong learning, reflection, etc.

original: de bas na lta ba ngan pa'i phyir log pa'i lam spyad pas mi 'dod pa'i rnam par smin pa mngon par bsgrub pa'i phyir dang / rgyu dang / las dang / 'bras bu la skur pa 'debs pa dang / sgro 'dogs pa'i rnam par bzhugs pa'i phyir log par lta ba dag ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: de bas na lta ba ngan pa'i phyir log pa'i lam spyad pas mi 'dod pa'i rnam par smin pa mngon par bsgrub pa'i phyir dang / rgyu dang / las dang / 'bras bu la skur pa 'debs pa dang / sgro 'dogs pa'i rnam par bzhugs pa'i phyir log par lta ba dag ces bya ba'o //
translated: Therefore, because of bad views, one practices a wrong path, and because of the manifestation of undesirable results, one denies cause, effect, and action, and one’s views are distorted.

original: de dang mi mthun pa'i phyir yang dag pa'i lta ba lam gyi yan lag nyid du rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: de dang mi mthun pa'i phyir yang dag pa'i lta ba lam gyi yan lag nyid du rnam par gzhag go //
translated: Because it is the opposite of that, right view is established as a branch of the path.

original: tshul bzhin la gnas pa'i yang dag pa'i thos pa dang / bsam pa la sogs pa'i dad pa sngon du 'gro bas rgyu dang / 'bras bu dang ; bden pa dang / dkon mchog dang / las dang / 'bras bu la sogs pa yod par lta ba ni yang dag pa'i lta ba ste /
analyzed: tshul bzhin la gnas pa'i yang dag pa'i thos pa dang / bsam pa la sogs pa'i dad pa sngon du 'gro bas rgyu dang / 'bras bu dang ; bden pa dang / dkon mchog dang / las dang / 'bras bu la sogs pa yod par lta ba ni yang dag pa'i lta ba ste /
translated: Right view is the view that cause and effect, the truths, the jewels, action, and result, and so on exist, preceded by faith in proper reliance on hearing, contemplation, and so on.

original: yang dag pa'i lam la nye bar sbyor ba las 'dod pa'i 'bras bu mngon par bsgrub pa'i phyir dang / mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / stong pa dang / bdag med pa la sogs pa'i rnam par 'jug pa'i phyir yang dag pa'i lta ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i lam la nye bar sbyor ba las 'dod pa'i 'bras bu mngon par bsgrub pa'i phyir dang / mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / stong pa dang / bdag med pa la sogs pa'i rnam par 'jug pa'i phyir yang dag pa'i lta ba zhes bya'o //
translated: It is called right view because it is applied to the true path, because it is the basis for the attainment of the fruit of the path, and because it is the entryway to impermanence, suffering, emptiness, selflessness, and so on.

original: de la log pa'i rtog pa zhes bya ba ni rtog pa log pa'o //
analyzed: de la log pa'i rtog pa zhes bya ba ni rtog pa log pa'o //
translated: Here, wrong view is a distorted conception.

original: rtog pa zhes bya ba ni spyod yul dang / yul dang / dmigs pa zhes bya ba ni tha tshig go //
analyzed: rtog pa zhes bya ba ni spyod yul dang / yul dang / dmigs pa zhes bya ba ni tha tshig go //
translated: Conception is a term for the domain, the object, and the objective support.

original: spyod yul zhes bya ba ni yul drug po gzugs dang sgra la @27a * //
analyzed: spyod yul zhes bya ba ni yul drug po gzugs dang sgra la @27a * //
translated: The domain is the six objects, such as form, sound, and so on.

original: sogs pa'o // log pa zhes bya ba ni phyin ci log ste /
analyzed: sogs pa'o // log pa zhes bya ba ni phyin ci log ste /
translated: Distorted means inverted.

original: rtag pa dang / bde ba dang / gtsang ba dang / bdag gi rnam pa la sogs par dmigs pas 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug rgyas par 'gyur ba'i phyir log par rtog pa'o //
analyzed: rtag pa dang / bde ba dang / gtsang ba dang / bdag gi rnam pa la sogs par dmigs pas 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug rgyas par 'gyur ba'i phyir log par rtog pa'o //
translated: It is a wrong conception because it is the basis for the increase of attachment, hatred, and delusion, since it is the apprehension of the aspects of permanence, happiness, purity, and self.

original: de las bzlog pa ni yang dag pa'i rtog pa'o //
analyzed: de las bzlog pa ni yang dag pa'i rtog pa'o //
translated: The opposite of that is right thought.

original: yang dag pa zhes bya ba ni phyin ci ma log pa'o //
analyzed: yang dag pa zhes bya ba ni phyin ci ma log pa'o //
translated: Right is non-erroneous.

original: rtog pa zhes bya ba ni bya ba dang / sems pa ste /
analyzed: rtog pa zhes bya ba ni bya ba dang / sems pa ste /
translated: Thought is activity and intention.

original: 'di dang 'di bya'o zhes thog mar sems la bzhag nas lus dang / ngag dang / yid kyi spyod pa dge ba ma chags pa dang / zhe sdang med pa dang / gti mug med pa'i ngo bo mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang /
analyzed: 'di dang 'di bya'o zhes thog mar sems la bzhag nas lus dang / ngag dang / yid kyi spyod pa dge ba ma chags pa dang / zhe sdang med pa dang / gti mug med pa'i ngo bo mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang /
translated: That which is the application of proper mental attention to virtuous conduct of body, speech, and mind, which is the nature of non-attachment, non-hatred, and non-delusion, to impermanence, suffering,

original: stong pa dang / bdag med pa la sogs par tshul bzhin yid la byed pa'i sbyor ba gang yin pa ni yang dag pa'i lam gyi yan lag ces bya'o //
analyzed: stong pa dang / bdag med pa la sogs par tshul bzhin yid la byed pa'i sbyor ba gang yin pa ni yang dag pa'i lam gyi yan lag ces bya'o //
translated: emptiness, selflessness, etc., after first placing it in the mind as “this and this should be done,” is called the right path factor.

original: log pa'i ngag ces bya ba ni ngag ngan pa ste /
analyzed: log pa'i ngag ces bya ba ni ngag ngan pa ste /
translated: Wrong speech is bad speech.

original: bdag dang gzhan bslu ba'i rnam par zhugs pa'i ngag gang yin pa de ni log pa'i ngag go //
analyzed: bdag dang gzhan bslu ba'i rnam par zhugs pa'i ngag gang yin pa de ni log pa'i ngag go //
translated: That speech which is engaged in the form of deceiving oneself and others is wrong speech.

original: 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug dang / nga rgyal la sogs pa dang 'brel ba'i phyir bdag la bstod pa dang / gzhan la smod pa'i ngo bor zhugs pa dang / ngag gi nyes pa rnam pa bzhi dang 'dres pa dang /
analyzed: 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug dang / nga rgyal la sogs pa dang 'brel ba'i phyir bdag la bstod pa dang / gzhan la smod pa'i ngo bor zhugs pa dang / ngag gi nyes pa rnam pa bzhi dang 'dres pa dang /
translated: It is called “false speech” because it is associated with desire, hatred, ignorance, pride, and so on; because it is engaged in praising oneself and disparaging others; because it is mixed with the four faults of speech;

original: yang dag pa dang / bden pa dang / de kho na nyid dang / chos thams cad spong bar byed pa dang / rgyal po dang / chom rkun dang / bud med dang / khyim pa dang / skye bo'i gtam gyi ngo bo dang / gsog dang don med pa mang po ni 'phags pa'i skye bo thams cad kyis smad pa'i phyir log pa'i ngag ces bya'o //
analyzed: yang dag pa dang / bden pa dang / de kho na nyid dang / chos thams cad spong bar byed pa dang / rgyal po dang / chom rkun dang / bud med dang / khyim pa dang / skye bo'i gtam gyi ngo bo dang / gsog dang don med pa mang po ni 'phags pa'i skye bo thams cad kyis smad pa'i phyir log pa'i ngag ces bya'o //
translated: and because it abandons the real, the true, reality, and all dharmas; because it is the talk of kings, thieves, women, householders, and ordinary people; and because it is much ado about nothing, despised by all the noble ones.

original: de dag mi mthun pa'i phyir bdag dang gzhan la mi slu ba'i rnam pa can ma chags pa dang / zhe sdang med pa dang / gti mug med pa la sogs pa'i ngo bo ngag gi nyes pa rnam pa bzhi dang bral ba'i phyir bden pa dang yang dag pa dang de kho na nyid kyi rjes su 'brang ba bden pa bzhi'i rjes su mthun par byed pa dge ba'i chos thams cad sdud
analyzed: de dag mi mthun pa'i phyir bdag dang gzhan la mi slu ba'i rnam pa can ma chags pa dang / zhe sdang med pa dang / gti mug med pa la sogs pa'i ngo bo ngag gi nyes pa rnam pa bzhi dang bral ba'i phyir bden pa dang yang dag pa dang de kho na nyid kyi rjes su 'brang ba bden pa bzhi'i rjes su mthun par byed pa dge ba'i chos thams cad sdud
translated: Since they are not in disagreement, they are the form of non-deception with regard to self and other, and since they are the nature of non-attachment, non-aversion, non-ignorance, and so on, they are free from the four faults of speech.

original: pa / phan pa dang yongs su bcad pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi phyir bdag la bstod pa dang / gzhan la smod pa spang ba /
analyzed: pa / phan pa dang yongs su bcad pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi phyir bdag la bstod pa dang / gzhan la smod pa spang ba /
translated: Since they are the form of benefit and complete discernment, they are free from praising oneself and disparaging others.

original: mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / stong pa dang / bdag med pa la sogs pa'i rnam par zhugs pa'i phyir @27b 'phags pa'i skye bo thams cad mi slu bar byed pa ni yang dag pa'i lam gyi rjes su 'jug pa'i phyir yang dag pa'i ngag ces bya'o //
analyzed: mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / stong pa dang / bdag med pa la sogs pa'i rnam par zhugs pa'i phyir @27b 'phags pa'i skye bo thams cad mi slu bar byed pa ni yang dag pa'i lam gyi rjes su 'jug pa'i phyir yang dag pa'i ngag ces bya'o //
translated: Since they are engaged in the aspects of impermanence, suffering, emptiness, selflessness, and so on, they are non-deceptive to all noble beings. Since they follow the correct path, they are called right speech.

original: log pa'i las kyi mtha' zhes bya ba ni phyin ci log gi las byed pa'o //
analyzed: log pa'i las kyi mtha' zhes bya ba ni phyin ci log gi las byed pa'o //
translated: Wrong action is action that is perverse.

original: las zhes bya ba ni lus dang / ngag dang yid kyi nyes par spyod pa'i sa bon 'debs pa'i phyir dang / rnam par smin pa mi bzad pa'i 'bras bu mngon par sgrub pa'i rang bzhin mi dge ba'i las kyi mtha' byed pa'i phyir tsha sgo la sogs pa'i skyon dang 'dres pa'i zhing ngan pa la sa bon ngan pa btab pa bzhin /
analyzed: las zhes bya ba ni lus dang / ngag dang yid kyi nyes par spyod pa'i sa bon 'debs pa'i phyir dang / rnam par smin pa mi bzad pa'i 'bras bu mngon par sgrub pa'i rang bzhin mi dge ba'i las kyi mtha' byed pa'i phyir tsha sgo la sogs pa'i skyon dang 'dres pa'i zhing ngan pa la sa bon ngan pa btab pa bzhin /
translated: Action is the planting of the seed of the bad conduct of body, speech, and mind, and the nature of the accomplishment of the fruit of unbearable maturation. It is like planting a bad seed in a bad field that is mixed with salt and so on.

original: mi 'dod pa'i rnam par smin pa mngon par bsgrub pa'i phyir smad par bya ba'i las kyi mtha' ni log pa'i las kyi mtha' zhes bya'o //
analyzed: mi 'dod pa'i rnam par smin pa mngon par bsgrub pa'i phyir smad par bya ba'i las kyi mtha' ni log pa'i las kyi mtha' zhes bya'o //
translated: Because of the accomplishment of an undesirable maturation, action is censured. Wrong action is action that is censured.

original: las la dga' ba dang / gnyid la dga' ba dang / smra ba la dga' ba la sogs pa'i rang bzhin ni log pa'i las zhes bya ste /
analyzed: las la dga' ba dang / gnyid la dga' ba dang / smra ba la dga' ba la sogs pa'i rang bzhin ni log pa'i las zhes bya ste /
translated: The nature of delight in action, delight in sleep, delight in talk, and so on, is called wrong action.

original: bdag dang gzhan la reg pa lam yin pa sdug bsngal bar gnas pa'i rten gyi ngo bo'o //
analyzed: bdag dang gzhan la reg pa lam yin pa sdug bsngal bar gnas pa'i rten gyi ngo bo'o //
translated: It is the basis for the suffering of contact with what is unpleasant and separation from what is pleasant.

original: de dang mi mthun pa'i phyir yang dag pa'i las kyi mtha'o //🔽phyin ci ma log pa'i las byed pa'i phyir lus dan /
analyzed: de dang mi mthun pa'i phyir yang dag pa'i las kyi mtha'o // phyin ci ma log pa'i las byed pa'i phyir lus dan /
translated: It is right action because it is the opposite of that.🔽It is right livelihood because it is the seed of good conduct of body, speech, and mind, because it is the field of good conduct, and because it is the field for the maturation of good conduct.🔽It is right effort because it is the seed of right mindfulness, because it is the seed of right concentration, and because it is the seed of right view.

original: ngag dang / yid kyis legs par spyad pa'i sa bon 'debs pa'i phyir dang / zhing gshin pa dang 'dra ba'i legs par byas pa'i las kyi zhing 'dod pa'i rnam par smin pa mngon par sgrub pa'i rnam par zhugs pa'i phyir dang / mi rtag pa dang /
analyzed: ngag dang / yid kyis legs par spyad pa'i sa bon 'debs pa'i phyir dang / zhing gshin pa dang 'dra ba'i legs par byas pa'i las kyi zhing 'dod pa'i rnam par smin pa mngon par sgrub pa'i rnam par zhugs pa'i phyir dang / mi rtag pa dang /
translated: It is right mindfulness because it is the seed of right concentration, because it is the seed of right view, and because it is the seed of right liberation.🔽It is right concentration because it is the seed of right view, because it is the seed of right knowledge, and because it is the seed of right liberation.🔽It is right knowledge because it is the seed of right liberation, because it is the seed of the destruction of the residues of the defilements, and because it is the seed of the destruction of the residues of action.

original: sdug bsngal ba dang / stong pa dang / bdag med pa la sogs pa'i ngo bor zhugs pa'i phyir dang / yang dag pa'i las kyi mtha' byed pa'i phyir yang dag pa'i las kyi mtha' ste /
analyzed: sdug bsngal ba dang / stong pa dang / bdag med pa la sogs pa'i ngo bor zhugs pa'i phyir dang / yang dag pa'i las kyi mtha' byed pa'i phyir yang dag pa'i las kyi mtha' ste /
translated: It is right liberation because it is the seed of the destruction of the residues of action, because it is the seed of the destruction of the residues of the defilements, and because it is the seed of the destruction of the residues of action and defilements.

original: yang dag pa'i lam gyi rjes su 'brang ba'i phyir yang dag pa'i lam zhes bya'o //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i lam gyi rjes su 'brang ba'i phyir yang dag pa'i lam zhes bya'o //
translated: It is the right path because it is the path to liberation.

original: log pa'i 'tsho ba zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: log pa'i 'tsho ba zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Wrong livelihood is

original: phyin ci log gi 'tsho ba ste /
analyzed: phyin ci log gi 'tsho ba ste /
translated: a livelihood that is perverse.

original: ngan g-yo dang / kha gsag dang / thob pas 'jal ba dang / gzhogs slong gis 'jug cing mi phongs pa'i lus dang / ngag gi la sogs pa'i nye bar 'tsho bas skyes pa dang bud med la sogs pa'i mtshan ston pa dang / 'phong dang /
analyzed: ngan g-yo dang / kha gsag dang / thob pas 'jal ba dang / gzhogs slong gis 'jug cing mi phongs pa'i lus dang / ngag gi la sogs pa'i nye bar 'tsho bas skyes pa dang bud med la sogs pa'i mtshan ston pa dang / 'phong dang /
translated: It is a livelihood that is based on deceit, flattery, intimation, extortion, and hinting, and on revealing oneself as a worthy recipient through advertising one's own virtues.

original: rta dang / snyan ngag dang / gso ba'i dpyad dang / grangs dang / khyim pa'i dpyad dang / gzhon nu'i dpyad dang / rgya mtsho mtshan gyi dpyad dang / ltas shes pa la sogs pa ste /🔽bdag dang gzhan slu ba'i ngo bor zhugs pa'i phyir tshul @28a * //
analyzed: rta dang / snyan ngag dang / gso ba'i dpyad dang / grangs dang / khyim pa'i dpyad dang / gzhon nu'i dpyad dang / rgya mtsho mtshan gyi dpyad dang / ltas shes pa la sogs pa ste / bdag dang gzhan slu ba'i ngo bor zhugs pa'i phyir tshul @28a * //
translated: It is the teaching of astrology, palmistry, and the signs of pregnancy, and the teaching of archery, poetry, medicine, mathematics, the arts of love, and the interpretation of dreams, omens, and other portents.🔽It is a livelihood that is based on the pursuit of gain through such means, and that is entered into for the sake of clothing, food, and other perquisites.

original: des chos gos dang bsod snyoms la sogs pa sgrub pa'i rjes su 'jug pas gnas par byed pa ni log pa'i 'tsho ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: des chos gos dang bsod snyoms la sogs pa sgrub pa'i rjes su 'jug pas gnas par byed pa ni log pa'i 'tsho ba zhes bya'o //
translated: It is called wrong livelihood because it is based on a form of deception that is directed at oneself and others.

original: de dang mi mthun pa'i phyir yang dag pa'i 'tsho ba ni lam gyi yan lag ces bya'o //
analyzed: de dang mi mthun pa'i phyir yang dag pa'i 'tsho ba ni lam gyi yan lag ces bya'o //
translated: Right livelihood is a member of the path because it is not like that.

original: yang dag pa ni rig pa dang ma bral ba'i lus dang / ngag dang yid 'jug pas chos gos la sogs pa bsgrub pa ste /
analyzed: yang dag pa ni rig pa dang ma bral ba'i lus dang / ngag dang yid 'jug pas chos gos la sogs pa bsgrub pa ste /
translated: Right livelihood is the pursuit of robes, etc. by means of the engagement of body, speech, and mind that is not divorced from knowledge.

original: tshul des kun tu 'tsho ba ni yang dag pa'i 'tsho ba'i rjes su 'brang ba'i phyir dang / bdag dang gzhan mi slu ba'i ngo bo'i rnam pa'i phyir 'phags pa'i lam gyi rjes su 'jug pas yang dag pa'i 'tsho ba ni lam gyi yan lag nyid du rnam par gzhag go ;🔽/ log pa'i rtsol ba zhes bya ba ni rtsol ba ni rtsol ba'o //
analyzed: tshul des kun tu 'tsho ba ni yang dag pa'i 'tsho ba'i rjes su 'brang ba'i phyir dang / bdag dang gzhan mi slu ba'i ngo bo'i rnam pa'i phyir 'phags pa'i lam gyi rjes su 'jug pas yang dag pa'i 'tsho ba ni lam gyi yan lag nyid du rnam par gzhag go ; / log pa'i rtsol ba zhes bya ba ni rtsol ba ni rtsol ba'o //
translated: It is established as a member of the path because it is the pursuit of the path of the noble ones, since it is the pursuit of right livelihood, and because it is the form of non-deception of self and other.🔽Wrong striving is striving that is distorted.

original: log pa'i zhes bya ba ni phyin ci log pa ste /
analyzed: log pa'i zhes bya ba ni phyin ci log pa ste /
translated: Distorted means inverted.

original: lus dang / ngag dang / yid kyi rab tu spyod pa mi bden pa rnams kyis bdag dang gzhan la gnod pa byed pa dang / g-yul la sogs pa shom pa dang / pho nya la sogs par 'gro ba dang / spyod pa dang / dbral ba dang /🔽'jog pa dang / 'degs pa dang / sel ba dang / mi sel ba dang / sbyor ba'i tshul gyis skyed pa dang / zhing dang / rig pa dang / tshong dang / rgyal srid la sogs pa bdag dang pha rol la gnod par byed pa'i lus dang /🔽ngag dang / yid kyis 'jug pa rnam pa sna tshogs la rtsom pa dang bya ba dang / brtson pa ni log pa'i rtsol ba zhes bya'o //
