original: gang lus dang ngag dang yid kyi spyod pa gcig tu dge ba bdag dang gzhan la phan 'dogs par zhugs pa dag gis 'phags pa'i lam gyi rjes su 'brang ba de ni yang dag par rtsol ba'i phyir yang dag par rtsol ba ste de ni lam gyi yan
analyzed: gang lus dang ngag dang yid kyi spyod pa gcig tu dge ba bdag dang gzhan la phan 'dogs par zhugs pa dag gis 'phags pa'i lam gyi rjes su 'brang ba de ni yang dag par rtsol ba'i phyir yang dag par rtsol ba ste de ni lam gyi yan
translated: The right effort is the effort to follow the path of the noble ones, by means of the practice of body, speech and mind which is exclusively virtuous and engaged in benefiting oneself and others.

original: lag nyid du brjod do //
analyzed: lag nyid du brjod do //
translated: It is called the limb of the path.

original: log pa'i dran pa zhes bya ba ni smad par bya ba dran pa ste /
analyzed: log pa'i dran pa zhes bya ba ni smad par bya ba dran pa ste /
translated: Wrong mindfulness is mindfulness of what is contemptible.

original: log pa'i dran pa'o //
analyzed: log pa'i dran pa'o //
translated: It is wrong mindfulness.

original: dran pa ni dran pa'o //🔽'di ni log pa yang yin la /
analyzed: dran pa ni dran pa'o // 'di ni log pa yang yin la /
translated: Mindfulness is mindfulness.

original: dran pa yang yin pas log pa'i dran pa'o //
analyzed: dran pa yang yin pas log pa'i dran pa'o //
translated: It is wrong and it is mindfulness, thus it is wrong mindfulness.

original: dus gsum gyi yul la sngon dgod pa dang / dga' ba nyams su myong ba'i gzugs dang / sgra dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg pa la sogs pa rjes su dran zhing rjes su brjod pa dang / de la yang lhag par chags pa @28b dang ;
analyzed: dus gsum gyi yul la sngon dgod pa dang / dga' ba nyams su myong ba'i gzugs dang / sgra dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg pa la sogs pa rjes su dran zhing rjes su brjod pa dang / de la yang lhag par chags pa @28b dang ;
translated: It is the recollection and evocation of the objects of the three times, such as the forms, sounds, smells, tastes, and touches that one has previously enjoyed and delighted in, and it is the excessive attachment to them.

original: rjes su chags pa dang / khong khro ba la sogs pa kun tu ldang ba'i phyir bdag dang gzhan gnod par byed pa'i phyir dang / mi 'dod pa'i rnam par smin pa dang 'brel pa'i phyir log pa'i mtshan ma yid la byed pa ni log pa'i dran pa'o //
analyzed: rjes su chags pa dang / khong khro ba la sogs pa kun tu ldang ba'i phyir bdag dang gzhan gnod par byed pa'i phyir dang / mi 'dod pa'i rnam par smin pa dang 'brel pa'i phyir log pa'i mtshan ma yid la byed pa ni log pa'i dran pa'o //
translated: Wrong mindfulness is the attention to wrong signs, because it is the cause of the arising of attachment, hatred, etc., because it injures oneself and others, and because it is connected with undesirable results.

original: de dang mi mthun pa'i phyir yang dag pa'i dran pa ni lam gyi yan lag nyid du brjod do //
analyzed: de dang mi mthun pa'i phyir yang dag pa'i dran pa ni lam gyi yan lag nyid du brjod do //
translated: Right mindfulness is called a member of the path because it is the opposite of that.

original: yon tan rjes su dran pa sngon du btang nas sangs rgyas dang / chos dang / dge 'dun dang / tshul khrims dang / gtong ba dang / lha la sogs pa rjes su dran pa ni yang dag pa'i dran pa ste /
analyzed: yon tan rjes su dran pa sngon du btang nas sangs rgyas dang / chos dang / dge 'dun dang / tshul khrims dang / gtong ba dang / lha la sogs pa rjes su dran pa ni yang dag pa'i dran pa ste /
translated: Right mindfulness is the mindfulness of the Buddha, Dharma, Saṅgha, morality, renunciation, and deities, preceded by the recollection of good qualities.

original: lam gyi yan lag nyid du brjod do //
analyzed: lam gyi yan lag nyid du brjod do //
translated: It is called a member of the path because it is the opposite of that.

original: ting nge 'dzin gyi bya ba la /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin gyi bya ba la /
translated: The function of concentration is as follows:

original: ting nge 'dzin ni ting nge 'dzin te /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin ni ting nge 'dzin te /
translated: Concentration is the concentration of mind.

original: kun nas mnyam par 'jog cing 'dzin pa'i phyir ting nge 'dzin to //
analyzed: kun nas mnyam par 'jog cing 'dzin pa'i phyir ting nge 'dzin to //
translated: It is concentration because it concentrates and holds the mind in equipoise.

original: 'di ni log pa yang yin la /
analyzed: 'di ni log pa yang yin la /
translated: It is wrong because it is the cause of the arising of attachment, hatred, etc.🔽It is concentration because it is the opposite of that.

original: ting nge 'dzin yang yin pas log pa'i ting nge 'dzin to //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin yang yin pas log pa'i ting nge 'dzin to //
translated: It is also concentration, thus it is wrong concentration.

original: log pa zhes bya ba ni phyin ci log ste dbang phyug dang rang bzhin dang / dus dang / gtso bo dang / nang gi bdag la sogs pa med pa de dag la dmigs ba sngon du btang ba'i sems 'phro ba gang yin pa'o //🔽yang na gzugs la sogs pa dang phyi rol gyi dngos po mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / stong pa dang / bdag med pa la sogs pa'i rnam pa dag la rtag pa dang / bde ba dang / gtsang ba dang / bdag tu lta ba la sogs pa la lhag par chags nas /
analyzed: log pa zhes bya ba ni phyin ci log ste dbang phyug dang rang bzhin dang / dus dang / gtso bo dang / nang gi bdag la sogs pa med pa de dag la dmigs ba sngon du btang ba'i sems 'phro ba gang yin pa'o // yang na gzugs la sogs pa dang phyi rol gyi dngos po mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / stong pa dang / bdag med pa la sogs pa'i rnam pa dag la rtag pa dang / bde ba dang / gtsang ba dang / bdag tu lta ba la sogs pa la lhag par chags nas /
translated: Wrong means inverted. It is the scattering of the mind preceded by the apprehension of those things that do not exist, such as a divine creator, intrinsic nature, time, primal substance, internal self, etc.

original: de dag la dmigs pa sngon du btang ba'i sems 'phro ba gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: de dag la dmigs pa sngon du btang ba'i sems 'phro ba gang yin pa ste /
translated: Or else, it is the scattering of the mind preceded by the apprehension of those things that are impermanent, painful, empty, insubstantial, etc., in the aspect of permanence, pleasure, purity, substantiality, etc., with regard to form, etc., and external things.🔽That is, it is the settling of the mind preceded by attachment.

original: chags pa dang bcas pa sngon du btang ba'i sems gnas pa gang yin pa de ni log pa'i ting nge 'dzin zhes bya'o //
analyzed: chags pa dang bcas pa sngon du btang ba'i sems gnas pa gang yin pa de ni log pa'i ting nge 'dzin zhes bya'o //
translated: That is called wrong concentration.

original: de dang 'gal bar sems gnas pa ni yang dag pa'i ting nge 'dzin zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de dang 'gal bar sems gnas pa ni yang dag pa'i ting nge 'dzin zhes bya ste /
translated: The opposite of that is right concentration.

original: phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched bdag dang bdag gi stong pa rnams la mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / stong pa dang / bdag med pa'i rnam pa la sogs pa sngon du btang ba'i sems gnas pa ste /
analyzed: phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched bdag dang bdag gi stong pa rnams la mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / stong pa dang / bdag med pa'i rnam pa la sogs pa sngon du btang ba'i sems gnas pa ste /
translated: The concentration of the aggregates, elements, and sense bases, which are empty of self and what belongs to a self, is preceded by the aspects of impermanence, suffering, emptiness, and no-self.

original: sems rtse gcig pa nyid ni yang dag pa'i ting nge 'dzin zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sems rtse gcig pa nyid ni yang dag pa'i ting nge 'dzin zhes bya'o //
translated: One-pointedness of mind is called right concentration.

original: chos thams cad mnyam pa nyid du bsgrub pa'i phyir ting nge 'dzin to //
analyzed: chos thams cad mnyam pa nyid du bsgrub pa'i phyir ting nge 'dzin to //
translated: It is concentration because it establishes all phenomena as equality.

original: sems rtse gcig pa nyid dang / dmigs pa gcig pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
analyzed: sems rtse gcig pa nyid dang / dmigs pa gcig pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
translated: It is synonymous with one-pointedness of mind and single object.

original: yang dag pa'i ting nge 'dzin de ni lam gyi yan lag nyid du brjod do //🔽de ltar gang @29a * //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i ting nge 'dzin de ni lam gyi yan lag nyid du brjod do // de ltar gang @29a * //
translated: This right concentration is said to be a branch of the path.

original: gis rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba mthong ba des chos mthong ngo //
analyzed: gis rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba mthong ba des chos mthong ngo //
translated: Thus, whoever sees dependent origination sees the Dharma.

original: yang smras pa /
analyzed: yang smras pa /
translated: Again it is said:

original: lta sogs yan lag brgyad kyi stegs //
analyzed: lta sogs yan lag brgyad kyi stegs //
translated: The bridge of the eight branches, such as right view,

original: rgyu ni bcu gnyis sngon 'gro ba //🔽gang mthong rnam dag bdag nyid des //
analyzed: rgyu ni bcu gnyis sngon 'gro ba // gang mthong rnam dag bdag nyid des //
translated: The cause is the twelvefold set of factors.

original: chos kyi de nyid mthong bar 'gyur //
analyzed: chos kyi de nyid mthong bar 'gyur //
translated: By seeing that, one sees the reality of phenomena.

original: 'bras bu zhes bya ba ni dge sbyong tshul gyi 'bras bu'o //
analyzed: 'bras bu zhes bya ba ni dge sbyong tshul gyi 'bras bu'o //
translated: The result is the result of the way of virtuous endeavor.

original: de thob pa ni mngon sum du byed pa ste /
analyzed: de thob pa ni mngon sum du byed pa ste /
translated: Its attainment is its actualization.

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa thams cad kyi kun gzhi rnam par shes pa sa bon bag chags kyi dri ma dang bral ba'i phyir gnas gyur pa dang ldan pa /
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa thams cad kyi kun gzhi rnam par shes pa sa bon bag chags kyi dri ma dang bral ba'i phyir gnas gyur pa dang ldan pa /
translated: It is endowed with the transformation of the basis, because it is free from the stains of the seeds of all the afflictions in the container consciousness.

original: yid kyi yul yon tan gyi nor bu bsam gyis mi khyab cing gzhal du med pas brgyan pa /
analyzed: yid kyi yul yon tan gyi nor bu bsam gyis mi khyab cing gzhal du med pas brgyan pa /
translated: It is adorned with the inconceivable and immeasurable jewels of the objects of the mind.

original: rang gi gzhan la rag ma las pa'i bdag nyid can so so rang gis rig pa sems can thams cad kyi don rgyun mi 'chad par lhun gyis grub par mdzad pa'i bdag nyid spros pa thams cad dang bral ba /
analyzed: rang gi gzhan la rag ma las pa'i bdag nyid can so so rang gis rig pa sems can thams cad kyi don rgyun mi 'chad par lhun gyis grub par mdzad pa'i bdag nyid spros pa thams cad dang bral ba /
translated: It is of the nature of self-existence, which is not dependent on another, and is the self-awareness that spontaneously and effortlessly accomplishes the aims of all sentient beings, and is free from all conceptual elaborations.

original: zhi gnas dang lhag mthong zung du 'brel par ldan pa'i chos thams cad kyi de kho na nyid thugs su chud pa'i phyir nyon mongs pa dang / shes bya'i sgrib pa'i nags tshang tshing gi rtsa ba rnam par bsregs pa'i ngo bo nyid bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i 'bras bu mi slob pa'i ye shes ni 'bras bu'i chos zhes bya'o /
analyzed: zhi gnas dang lhag mthong zung du 'brel par ldan pa'i chos thams cad kyi de kho na nyid thugs su chud pa'i phyir nyon mongs pa dang / shes bya'i sgrib pa'i nags tshang tshing gi rtsa ba rnam par bsregs pa'i ngo bo nyid bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i 'bras bu mi slob pa'i ye shes ni 'bras bu'i chos zhes bya'o /
translated: The result is the uncontaminated wisdom of the stage of no learning, the essence of the burning away of the thickets of the afflictions and the obscurations to knowledge.

original: // / s'a lu ljang pa'i rgya cher bshad pa /
analyzed: // / s'a lu ljang pa'i rgya cher bshad pa /
translated: The Extensive Explanation of the Rice Seedling Sutra

original: bam po gnyis pa /
analyzed: bam po gnyis pa /
translated: The second part is the extensive explanation of the result.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa'o zhes bya ba ni phung po'i lhag ma dang bcas pa dang / phung po lhag ma med pa'i ngo bo nyid mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa zhes brjod pa /
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa'o zhes bya ba ni phung po'i lhag ma dang bcas pa dang / phung po lhag ma med pa'i ngo bo nyid mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa zhes brjod pa /
translated: Nirvana is the essence of the nondwelling nirvana, which is called “with remainder” and “without remainder.”

original: rga ba med pa /
analyzed: rga ba med pa /
translated: It is ageless,

original: 'chi ba med pa /🔽gdung ba med pa /🔽brtan pa / zhi ba /
analyzed: 'chi ba med pa / gdung ba med pa / brtan pa / zhi ba /
translated: deathless,🔽and free from sorrow.🔽It is stable, peaceful,

original: rtag pa / mi 'phrogs pa /
analyzed: rtag pa / mi 'phrogs pa /
translated: permanent, and unassailable.

original: mi zad pa'i bdag nyid thog ma dang / bar dang / tha ma dang bral ba /
analyzed: mi zad pa'i bdag nyid thog ma dang / bar dang / tha ma dang bral ba /
translated: He is inexhaustible, free from beginning, middle, and end.

original: gnyis med pa'i khams gsum dang bral ba /
analyzed: gnyis med pa'i khams gsum dang bral ba /
translated: He is nondual, free from the three realms.

original: lus dang / ngag dang / yid kyi las yang dag par 'das pa /
analyzed: lus dang / ngag dang / yid kyi las yang dag par 'das pa /
translated: He is beyond the activities of body, speech, and mind.

original: nor bu rin po che'i rgyal po'i gzugs sna tshogs pa dang 'dra bar yon tan nor bu'i 'od zer rnam pa sna tshogs kyis 'gro ba'i don rgyun mi 'chad par mdzad pa /
analyzed: nor bu rin po che'i rgyal po'i gzugs sna tshogs pa dang 'dra bar yon tan nor bu'i 'od zer rnam pa sna tshogs kyis 'gro ba'i don rgyun mi 'chad par mdzad pa /
translated: Like the king of precious gems, he benefits beings without interruption through the various rays of the jewels of his qualities.

original: zhi ba chos kyi rang bzhin gyi skur gyur pa ni mya ngan las 'das par bzhed do //
analyzed: zhi ba chos kyi rang bzhin gyi skur gyur pa ni mya ngan las 'das par bzhed do //
translated: He is the peaceful body of the nature of phenomena, and he is accepted as nirvana.

original: de ltar thams cad thugs chud phyir //
analyzed: de ltar thams cad thugs chud phyir //
translated: Thus, because he fully understands everything,

original: chos skyes sangs rgyas zhes bya ste //
analyzed: chos skyes sangs rgyas zhes bya ste //
translated: he is called the Buddha, born from the Dharma.

original: de ltar de bzhin du kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba'i bdag nyid chos kun gyi chos de kho na nyid ji ltar gnas pa bzhin du thugs su @29b chud pa'i phyir sangs rgyas zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar de bzhin du kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba'i bdag nyid chos kun gyi chos de kho na nyid ji ltar gnas pa bzhin du thugs su @29b chud pa'i phyir sangs rgyas zhes bya'o //
translated: Thus, because he fully understands the reality of all phenomena, which is the nature of both affliction and purification, just as it is, he is called the Buddha, born from the Dharma.

original: chos skyes zhes bya ba ni chos dag las skyes pas na chos skyes te /
analyzed: chos skyes zhes bya ba ni chos dag las skyes pas na chos skyes te /
translated: Dharma-born means born from the Dharma.

original: chos kyis bskyed pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //🔽de skad ces bya 'phags mthong bas //
analyzed: chos kyis bskyed pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go // de skad ces bya 'phags mthong bas //
translated: It means generated by the Dharma.

original: gang gis mthong ba des mthong ngo //
analyzed: gang gis mthong ba des mthong ngo //
translated: The one who sees thus sees the noble one.🔽The one who sees thus sees the Buddha.

original: de skad ces bya ba ni sangs rgyas zhes de skad ces bya ba'i phyir bcom ldan 'das de lta bu'o //
analyzed: de skad ces bya ba ni sangs rgyas zhes de skad ces bya ba'i phyir bcom ldan 'das de lta bu'o //
translated: The one who sees thus sees the Blessed One, because he is called the Buddha.

original: 'phags mthong bas zhes bya ba ni ye shes kyi mig gis te /
analyzed: 'phags mthong bas zhes bya ba ni ye shes kyi mig gis te /
translated: The noble one is seen by the eye of wisdom.

original: 'phags zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'o //
analyzed: 'phags zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'o //
translated: The noble one is supramundane.

original: mthong ba zhes bya ba ni mig gis so //🔽gang gis mthong ba zhes bya ba ni sus rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba dang / chos la de ltar mthong ba des chos skyes te /
analyzed: mthong ba zhes bya ba ni mig gis so // gang gis mthong ba zhes bya ba ni sus rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba dang / chos la de ltar mthong ba des chos skyes te /
translated: The eye is seeing.🔽The one who sees thus sees the Dharma-born one.

original: chos kyis bskyed pas sangs rgyas mthong ngo zhes bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: chos kyis bskyed pas sangs rgyas mthong ngo zhes bshad pa yin no //
translated: The one who sees thus sees the Buddha, because he is generated by the Dharma.

original: de la 'dir rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba ji lta bur gsungs she na /
analyzed: de la 'dir rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba ji lta bur gsungs she na /
translated: Here, how is dependent origination taught?

original: sus rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba 'di zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //🔽gang zhig srog la sogs bral ba //
analyzed: sus rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba 'di zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o // gang zhig srog la sogs bral ba //
translated: Whoever sees this dependent origination as devoid of life, etc.🔽Whoever sees this dependent origination as devoid of life, etc.

original: zhes bya ba ni gang gis rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba 'di rtag tu srog la sogs pa dang bral ba ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni gang gis rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba 'di rtag tu srog la sogs pa dang bral ba ste /

original: srog dang bral bar ro mthong ba ni rig pa dang / rjes su dpag pa dag gis spyod pa dang / 'jal ba dang / rtog pa dang / nye bar rtog pa'o //🔽rtag tu srog med pa zhes bya ba ni srog med pa'o //🔽kun tu 'tsho ba gcer bu pa dag 'di ltar rtog ste ;
analyzed: srog dang bral bar ro mthong ba ni rig pa dang / rjes su dpag pa dag gis spyod pa dang / 'jal ba dang / rtog pa dang / nye bar rtog pa'o // rtag tu srog med pa zhes bya ba ni srog med pa'o // kun tu 'tsho ba gcer bu pa dag 'di ltar rtog ste ;
translated: Whoever sees this dependent origination as devoid of life, etc.🔽Whoever sees this dependent origination as devoid of life, etc.🔽Whoever sees this dependent origination as devoid of life, etc.🔽Whoever sees this dependent origination as devoid of life, etc.

original: nang dang phyi rol gyi dngos po 'di thams cad ni srog dang bcas shing dbang po dang ldan no //🔽dbang po dang ldan pa de bas na sa gsum po 'di thams cad srog chags phra mo rnams kyis gang ngo zhe'o //
analyzed: nang dang phyi rol gyi dngos po 'di thams cad ni srog dang bcas shing dbang po dang ldan no // dbang po dang ldan pa de bas na sa gsum po 'di thams cad srog chags phra mo rnams kyis gang ngo zhe'o //

original: de nyid kyi phyir srog chags thams cad ni srog chags za ste /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir srog chags thams cad ni srog chags za ste /
translated: Whoever sees this dependent origination as devoid of life, etc.🔽Whoever sees this dependent origination as devoid

original: srog chags gang dag srog chags mi za ba'i srog chags de dag ni thar pa thob bo zhes zer ro //
analyzed: srog chags gang dag srog chags mi za ba'i srog chags de dag ni thar pa thob bo zhes zer ro //
translated: Those creatures who do not eat creatures attain liberation.

original: de bas na de dgag pa'i phyir srog med pa dang / srog dang bral ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: de bas na de dgag pa'i phyir srog med pa dang / srog dang bral ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: Therefore, in order to refute that, it is said that they are “without life” and “devoid of life,” and so on.

original: srog med pa zhes bya ba ni srog med pa ste /
analyzed: srog med pa zhes bya ba ni srog med pa ste /
translated: “Without life” means without life.

original: srog dang bral ba zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: srog dang bral ba zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It means “devoid of life.”

original: rgyu dang rkyen las skye ba'i chos can gyi phyir te /
analyzed: rgyu dang rkyen las skye ba'i chos can gyi phyir te /
translated: Because they are phenomena that arise from causes and conditions.

original: rgyu ni sa bon la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: rgyu ni sa bon la sogs pa'o //
translated: The cause is the seed, etc.

original: rkyen ni sa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: rkyen ni sa la sogs pa ste /
translated: The conditions are the earth, etc.

original: de dag kyang phan tshun gcig la gcig rtog pa dang / yongs su rtog pa dang / rnam par rtog pa dang bral ba'i phyir rtsva dang shing dang rtsig pa dang chos 'dra ba g-yo ba med pa bya ba med pa'o //🔽de bas na srog la @30a * //
analyzed: de dag kyang phan tshun gcig la gcig rtog pa dang / yongs su rtog pa dang / rnam par rtog pa dang bral ba'i phyir rtsva dang shing dang rtsig pa dang chos 'dra ba g-yo ba med pa bya ba med pa'o // de bas na srog la @30a * //
translated: And those are also like grass, trees, walls, and fences, without movement and without action, because they are free from mutual conceptualization, complete conceptualization, and discrimination.

original: sogs pa dang bral ba'i phyir srog med pa'o //
analyzed: sogs pa dang bral ba'i phyir srog med pa'o //
translated: Therefore, because they are free from life, etc., they are “without life.”

original: phan tshun rgyu rkyen 'brel pa las skye zhing gcig la gcig kyang sems pa med la /
analyzed: phan tshun rgyu rkyen 'brel pa las skye zhing gcig la gcig kyang sems pa med la /
translated: They arise in mutual dependence, and they are not conscious of each other.

original: bya ba dang las kyang snang ste /
analyzed: bya ba dang las kyang snang ste /
translated: Yet, action and its results are seen.

original: rgyu dang rkyen gyis rgyun 'di ni thog ma med pa nas zhugs pa yin no //
analyzed: rgyu dang rkyen gyis rgyun 'di ni thog ma med pa nas zhugs pa yin no //
translated: This continuum has been operating since beginningless time, due to causes and conditions.

original: ji ltar kun tu 'tsho ba gcer bu pa dag shing rnams ni sems dang bcas pa yin te /
analyzed: ji ltar kun tu 'tsho ba gcer bu pa dag shing rnams ni sems dang bcas pa yin te /
translated: It is not like the way the Ājīvikas imagine that trees are conscious,

original: g-yo ba'i phyir dang / nyal ba'i phyir dang / bcad na skye ba'i phyir ro zhes tha snyad 'dogs pa lta bu ni ma yin te /
analyzed: g-yo ba'i phyir dang / nyal ba'i phyir dang / bcad na skye ba'i phyir ro zhes tha snyad 'dogs pa lta bu ni ma yin te /
translated: because they move, because they sleep, and because they grow when pruned.

original: phyi rol gyi dngos po rnams ni nyi ma dang zla ba'i reg pa'i dbang gis zhum pa dang / rgyas par rjes su dpag gi / de dag la nyal ba dang ldang ba lta ga la yod /
analyzed: phyi rol gyi dngos po rnams ni nyi ma dang zla ba'i reg pa'i dbang gis zhum pa dang / rgyas par rjes su dpag gi / de dag la nyal ba dang ldang ba lta ga la yod /
translated: We infer that external things shrink and grow due to the influence of the contact of the sun and the moon. How can they sleep and wake?

original: rlung gis bskyod pa'i dbang gis shing gi yal ga la sogs pa 'gul bar rjes su dpag pas de dag la 'gro ba dang 'ong ba ga la dmigs te /
analyzed: rlung gis bskyod pa'i dbang gis shing gi yal ga la sogs pa 'gul bar rjes su dpag pas de dag la 'gro ba dang 'ong ba ga la dmigs te /
translated: We infer that the branches of trees and so on move due to the influence of the wind. How can we observe that they come and go?

original: don ma grub pa nyid do //
analyzed: don ma grub pa nyid do //
translated: This is an unestablished reason.

original: bcad na skye'o zhes bya ba 'di ni don ma grub pa nyid du bstan pa'i phyir smras pa /
analyzed: bcad na skye'o zhes bya ba 'di ni don ma grub pa nyid du bstan pa'i phyir smras pa /
translated: The statement “If it is cut, it grows again” is made to show that the meaning of the opponent’s thesis is not established.

original: gal te de dag yang sems dang bcas pa zhig yin na /🔽ci'i phyir gcod pa'i gnas skabs na gang gis na srog gcod pa la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal myong bar mi 'gyur la /
analyzed: gal te de dag yang sems dang bcas pa zhig yin na / ci'i phyir gcod pa'i gnas skabs na gang gis na srog gcod pa la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal myong bar mi 'gyur la /
translated: If those parts have mind,🔽why do they not experience the pain of being cut when the body is cut?

original: mi dga' ba la sogs pa'i spyod pa'am /
analyzed: mi dga' ba la sogs pa'i spyod pa'am /
translated: They do not engage in any activity such as crying out in distress,

original: gsol ba 'debs pa la sogs pa'am /
analyzed: gsol ba 'debs pa la sogs pa'am /
translated: or supplicating others,

original: de nas gzhan du 'gro ba cung zad mi byed /
analyzed: de nas gzhan du 'gro ba cung zad mi byed /
translated: or moving elsewhere.

original: bcad na skye ba'i phyir sems dang bcas par khas len na gang dag bcad na mi skye bas de dag bzlog pa'i phyir sems med pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bcad na skye ba'i phyir sems dang bcas par khas len na gang dag bcad na mi skye bas de dag bzlog pa'i phyir sems med pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: If you accept that they have mind because they grow again when cut, then those that do not grow again when cut would be mindless.

original: sems dang bcas pa rnams kyi yan lag dang nying lag la sogs pa bcad na mi skye ba'i chos can yin pa'i phyir sems med pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur du 'ong bas de'i phyir de'i gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid do //
analyzed: sems dang bcas pa rnams kyi yan lag dang nying lag la sogs pa bcad na mi skye ba'i chos can yin pa'i phyir sems med pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur du 'ong bas de'i phyir de'i gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid do //
translated: because if the limbs and minor limbs of those with minds were cut off, it would follow that they would become mindless, since they would be devoid of mind. Therefore, the meaning of the reason is not established.

original: de lta bas na srog med pa dang / srog dang bral ba zhes bya ba 'di rnam par gnas so //
analyzed: de lta bas na srog med pa dang / srog dang bral ba zhes bya ba 'di rnam par gnas so //
translated: Thus, “without life” and “devoid of life” are well established.

original: ji lta bu nyid dang / ma nor ba zhes bya ba ni rgyu med pa dang mi mthun pa'i rgyu dang bral ba'i phyir ma nor ba'o //
analyzed: ji lta bu nyid dang / ma nor ba zhes bya ba ni rgyu med pa dang mi mthun pa'i rgyu dang bral ba'i phyir ma nor ba'o //
translated: “Suchness” and “non-erroneousness” are non-erroneous because they are free from causelessness and discordant causes.

original: ma skyes pa zhes bya ba ni bskyed par bya ba dang / skyed pa dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma skyes pa zhes bya ba ni bskyed par bya ba dang / skyed pa dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
translated: “Non-arisen” means free from that which is to be produced and that which produces.

original: ma byung ba zhes bya ba ni rtag pa dang chad pa dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma byung ba zhes bya ba ni rtag pa dang chad pa dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
translated: “Non-originated” means free from eternalism and nihilism.

original: ma byas pa zhes bya ba ni byed pa po dang bral ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: ma byas pa zhes bya ba ni byed pa po dang bral ba'i phyir te /
translated: “Uncreated” means free from an agent.

original: nang gi byed pa'i skyes bu dang dbang phyug la sogs pa 'jug pa'i 'du byed dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nang gi byed pa'i skyes bu dang dbang phyug la sogs pa 'jug pa'i 'du byed dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because the inner agent, the puruṣa, Īśvara, and so on, are devoid of the formative forces that impel them.

original: @30b thogs pa med pa zhes bya ba ni sgrib pa med pa'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: @30b thogs pa med pa zhes bya ba ni sgrib pa med pa'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is said to be unimpeded because it is the nature of non-obstruction.

original: dmigs pa med pa zhes bya ba ni dmigs par bya ba dang dmigs pa dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dmigs pa med pa zhes bya ba ni dmigs par bya ba dang dmigs pa dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It is said to be non-apprehensible because it is devoid of the apprehended object and the apprehending subject.

original: rnam par zhi ba'i rang bzhin zhes bya ba ni las dang nyon mongs pa dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par zhi ba'i rang bzhin zhes bya ba ni las dang nyon mongs pa dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It is said to be the nature of complete peace because it is devoid of karma and moral defilement.

original: gcig tu zhi ba'i rang bzhin spros pa thams cad dang bral ba /
analyzed: gcig tu zhi ba'i rang bzhin spros pa thams cad dang bral ba /
translated: It is the nature of complete peace, free from all conceptual elaboration,

original: rtog pa'i dra ba thams cad dral ba /
analyzed: rtog pa'i dra ba thams cad dral ba /
translated: free from the net of all conceptual differentiation,

original: rtag tu gnas pa /
analyzed: rtag tu gnas pa /
translated: always abiding,

original: mi 'jigs pa /
analyzed: mi 'jigs pa /
translated: fearless,

original: skye ba dang 'jig pa dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: skye ba dang 'jig pa dang bral ba'o //
translated: and free from arising and cessation.

original: gang gis tshul 'di 'dra bar chos la yang mthong ba ste /🔽nyer zhi la thug bcas par ni //
analyzed: gang gis tshul 'di 'dra bar chos la yang mthong ba ste / nyer zhi la thug bcas par ni //
translated: Whoever sees the Dharma in this way

original: zhes smos te /
analyzed: zhes smos te /
translated: is said to be close to complete peace.

original: nyer zhi la thug ces bya ba ni nye bar zhi ba tha mar bstan pa'i phyir nye bar zhi ba la thug pa'o //
analyzed: nyer zhi la thug ces bya ba ni nye bar zhi ba tha mar bstan pa'i phyir nye bar zhi ba la thug pa'o //
translated: “Up to the pacification” means up to the pacification of the ultimate teaching of pacification.

original: gang gis chos la yang tshul 'di 'dra bar brtag pa dang / srog med pa la sogs pa'i rang bzhin du mthong ba ni /
analyzed: gang gis chos la yang tshul 'di 'dra bar brtag pa dang / srog med pa la sogs pa'i rang bzhin du mthong ba ni /
translated: He who thus investigates the Dharma and sees its nature as devoid of life, etc.,

original: rten 'brel chos dang sangs rgyas dag / dri ma med pa'i blos mthong ba ste /
analyzed: rten 'brel chos dang sangs rgyas dag / dri ma med pa'i blos mthong ba ste /
translated: sees the Dharma and the Buddha with an immaculate mind.

original: des ni bla na med pa'i chos kyi skur sangs rgyas mthong ngo zhes bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs so //
analyzed: des ni bla na med pa'i chos kyi skur sangs rgyas mthong ngo zhes bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs so //
translated: The Blessed One has said that he sees the Buddha in the unexcelled Dharma Body.

original: des zhes bya ba ni gang gis mthong ba'o //
analyzed: des zhes bya ba ni gang gis mthong ba'o //
translated: “He” refers to the one who sees.

original: 'phags pa'i chos mngon par rtogs te zhes bya ba ni gang dag sdig pa'i chos rnams la pha rol du ring ba de dag ni 'phags pa'o //
analyzed: 'phags pa'i chos mngon par rtogs te zhes bya ba ni gang dag sdig pa'i chos rnams la pha rol du ring ba de dag ni 'phags pa'o //
translated: “Realizes the Dharma of the Noble Ones” means that they are Noble Ones who are far from sinful dharmas.

original: de dag gi chos ni 'phags pa'i chos te /
analyzed: de dag gi chos ni 'phags pa'i chos te /
translated: Their Dharma is the Dharma of the Noble Ones.

original: yang dag pa'i lta ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i lta ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: It is right view, etc.

original: mngon par rtogs te zhes bya ba ni mngon du phyogs par rtse gcig tu byas pa'i phyir dang / mngon sum du byas pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: mngon par rtogs te zhes bya ba ni mngon du phyogs par rtse gcig tu byas pa'i phyir dang / mngon sum du byas pa'i phyir te /
translated: Realizing means that one has become one-pointedly directed toward the realization, and has realized it.

original: ting nge 'dzin thob pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin thob pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It means that one has attained meditative concentration.

original: yang dag pa'i ye shes dang ldan pas zhes bya ba ni yang dag pa'i phyin ci ma log par chos thams cad bdag med pa'i de kho na nyid rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i ye shes dang ldan pas zhes bya ba ni yang dag pa'i phyin ci ma log par chos thams cad bdag med pa'i de kho na nyid rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Possessing perfect knowledge means that one has realized the reality of the selflessness of all things, which is perfect, unmistaken, and unerring.

original: bla na med pa'i zhes bya ba ni 'di'i gong na chos khyad par can cung zad tsam yang med de /
analyzed: bla na med pa'i zhes bya ba ni 'di'i gong na chos khyad par can cung zad tsam yang med de /
translated: Unsurpassed means that there is nothing whatsoever that is superior to it.

original: de bas na de ni bla na med pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na de ni bla na med pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it is called unsurpassed.

original: chos kyi sku zhes bya ba ni chos sku nyid chos kyi sku ste /
analyzed: chos kyi sku zhes bya ba ni chos sku nyid chos kyi sku ste /
translated: Dharmakaya means that the very Dharma body is the Dharma body.

original: mchig bu bzhin no //
analyzed: mchig bu bzhin no //
translated: Like a son of a king.

original: sangs rgyas zhes bya ba ni chos thugs su chud pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sangs rgyas zhes bya ba ni chos thugs su chud pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Buddha means that one has realized the Dharma.

original: de ltar na sus rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba mthong ba des chos bla na med pa'i byang chub byed pa mi slob pa'i ngo bo nyid mthong ngo //
analyzed: de ltar na sus rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba mthong ba des chos bla na med pa'i byang chub byed pa mi slob pa'i ngo bo nyid mthong ngo //
translated: Thus, whoever sees dependent origination sees the unsurpassed enlightenment of the Dharma, the nature of the non-learner.

original: sus 'phags pa'i ye shes kyi spyod yul gyi chos de /
analyzed: sus 'phags pa'i ye shes kyi spyod yul gyi chos de /
translated: Whoever sees the Dharma, the domain of the wisdom of the noble ones,

original: de lta bu rang gi ji lta ba bzhin mngon par rtogs pas chos las skyes pa /
analyzed: de lta bu rang gi ji lta ba bzhin mngon par rtogs pas chos las skyes pa /
translated: is born from the Dharma,

original: @31a * // chos kyi sprul pa /
analyzed: @31a * // chos kyi sprul pa /
translated: is an emanation of the Dharma,

original: chos gzigs pa /
analyzed: chos gzigs pa /
translated: sees the Dharma,🔽sees the Buddha.

original: sangs rgyas mthong ngo zhes bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs so //
analyzed: sangs rgyas mthong ngo zhes bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs so //
translated: Thus it is said by the Blessed One.

original: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i mtshan nyid kyi dbye ba rnam par gzhag par bya ba'i phyir /🔽rten 'brel zhes pa'i mtshan nyid ni //
analyzed: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i mtshan nyid kyi dbye ba rnam par gzhag par bya ba'i phyir / rten 'brel zhes pa'i mtshan nyid ni //
translated: In order to present the classification of the characteristics of dependent origination,

original: zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: it is said:🔽The characteristic of dependent origination🔽is the arising of things from the cause of this and that.

original: ci'i phyir rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba zhes bya zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba zhes bya zhe na /
translated: Why is it called dependent origination?

original: de'i phyir smras pa /🔽rgyu bcas la sogs tshigs dang ldan //
analyzed: de'i phyir smras pa / rgyu bcas la sogs tshigs dang ldan //
translated: Therefore it is said:🔽Possessing cause and so forth, and possessing conditions.

original: rgyu dang bcas rkyen dang bcas pa la bya'i /
analyzed: rgyu dang bcas rkyen dang bcas pa la bya'i /
translated: It should be understood as possessing cause and possessing conditions.

original: rgyu med rkyen med pa la ma yin te /
analyzed: rgyu med rkyen med pa la ma yin te /
translated: It is not causeless and not without conditions.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i mtshan nyid mdor bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i mtshan nyid mdor bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Bhagavān briefly taught the characteristics of dependent origination:

original: rkyen 'di nyid kyi 'bras bu'o //
analyzed: rkyen 'di nyid kyi 'bras bu'o //
translated: “This condition is the effect of that condition.”

original: de nyid kyi phyir smras pa /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir smras pa /
translated: Therefore, it is said:

original: sangs rgyas byung rung ma byung rung //
analyzed: sangs rgyas byung rung ma byung rung //
translated: “Whether Buddhas arise or not,

original: chos nyid 'di ni gnas pa yin //
analyzed: chos nyid 'di ni gnas pa yin //
translated: this dharmatā remains.”

original: gang gi phyir rgyu dang rkyen dag gis rgyun mi 'chad cing /
analyzed: gang gi phyir rgyu dang rkyen dag gis rgyun mi 'chad cing /
translated: Because the continuum is uninterrupted by causes and conditions,

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu rgyun ma chad par gcig nas gcig tu 'jug gi /
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu rgyun ma chad par gcig nas gcig tu 'jug gi /
translated: the continuum of cause and effect passes from one to another.

original: 'di la rgyu med pa'am /
analyzed: 'di la rgyu med pa'am /
translated: Here, there is no cause,

original: mi mthun pa'i rgyu'am /🔽'jug par byed pa'am /🔽ldog par byed pa 'ga' yang med pa de nyid kyi phyir de bzhin gshegs pa rnams byung yang rung /
analyzed: mi mthun pa'i rgyu'am / 'jug par byed pa'am / ldog par byed pa 'ga' yang med pa de nyid kyi phyir de bzhin gshegs pa rnams byung yang rung /
translated: no incompatible cause,🔽no instigator,🔽or anything that stops it.

original: ma byung yang rung /
analyzed: ma byung yang rung /
translated: For that very reason, whether the Tathāgatas arise or not,

original: chos nyid dang / chos gnas pa nyid dang / chos nges par 'gyur ba 'di ni ye 'dug pa'o zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: chos nyid dang / chos gnas pa nyid dang / chos nges par 'gyur ba 'di ni ye 'dug pa'o zhes gsungs so //
translated: this dharmatā, the abiding of dharmas, the fixed sequence of dharmas, has always existed.

original: gal te rkyen dang bral ba'i rgyu gcig pu nyid kyis dngos po rnams skye zhing gnas pa'o //
analyzed: gal te rkyen dang bral ba'i rgyu gcig pu nyid kyis dngos po rnams skye zhing gnas pa'o //
translated: If things were to arise and endure due to a single cause that is not a condition,🔽if a condition were able to generate something without depending on a cause, then it would be logical to say that it endures or does not endure.

original: gal te rkyen kyang rgyu la mi ltos par 'ga' zhig skyed nus par gyur na ni gnas pa dang mi gnas pa zhes bya ba'i de brjod pa'i rigs na 'di dag skye ba 'bras bu 'byung ba yang rgyu med par ma yin /
analyzed: gal te rkyen kyang rgyu la mi ltos par 'ga' zhig skyed nus par gyur na ni gnas pa dang mi gnas pa zhes bya ba'i de brjod pa'i rigs na 'di dag skye ba 'bras bu 'byung ba yang rgyu med par ma yin /
translated: Since their arising and the occurrence of their effects are not causeless,

original: rkyen med par ma yin pas de bzhin gshegs pa rnams byung yang rung ma byung yang rung /
analyzed: rkyen med par ma yin pas de bzhin gshegs pa rnams byung yang rung ma byung yang rung /
translated: and they are not without conditions, whether the tathāgatas appear or not,

original: chos nyid dang chos gnas pa nyid 'di ni ye nas 'jug pa ste /
analyzed: chos nyid dang chos gnas pa nyid 'di ni ye nas 'jug pa ste /
translated: this reality and the nature of phenomena have always been engaged.

original: 'di lta ste rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i chos rkyen 'di nyid kyi 'bras bu'o zhes bcom ldan 'das kyis rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba mdor bka' stsal to //
analyzed: 'di lta ste rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i chos rkyen 'di nyid kyi 'bras bu'o zhes bcom ldan 'das kyis rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba mdor bka' stsal to //
translated: Thus, the Bhagavān briefly taught dependent origination in the sūtras, saying, “This is the result of this very condition of dependent origination.”

original: chos nyid ni 'dir rgyu dang rkyen gyi chos nyid gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: chos nyid ni 'dir rgyu dang rkyen gyi chos nyid gang yin pa'o //
translated: Here, the reality of phenomena is the reality of causes and conditions.

original: chos gnas pa zhes bya ba ni chud mi za ba'i chos nyid do //
analyzed: chos gnas pa zhes bya ba ni chud mi za ba'i chos nyid do //
translated: The term “enduring reality” means the reality of non-wastage.

original: chos nges par gyur pa nyid ces bya ba ni rkyen nyid 'di pa'i go rims nges pa ste /
analyzed: chos nges par gyur pa nyid ces bya ba ni rkyen nyid 'di pa'i go rims nges pa ste /
translated: The term “definite reality” means the definite order of conditions.

original: rgyu dang rkyen rim pa bzhin pa'o //🔽rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba mthun pa zhes bya ba ni rgyu med par rkyen rnams mi 'jug la /
analyzed: rgyu dang rkyen rim pa bzhin pa'o // rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba mthun pa zhes bya ba ni rgyu med par rkyen rnams mi 'jug la /
translated: It is the order of causes and conditions.🔽The term “compatibility of dependent origination” means that conditions do not function without a cause, and that a cause does not function without conditions.

original: @31b rkyen rnams med par yang rgyu 'jug pa med pa nyid kyi phan tshun tshogs na 'jug par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: @31b rkyen rnams med par yang rgyu 'jug pa med pa nyid kyi phan tshun tshogs na 'jug par 'gyur ro //
translated: When they are mutually combined, they function.

original: gzhan ma yin pa de bzhin nyid ces bya ba ni gzhan nyid dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan ma yin pa de bzhin nyid ces bya ba ni gzhan nyid dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The term “non-difference reality” means that it is free from difference.

original: yang dag pa nyid ces bya ba ni slu bar mi byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yang dag pa nyid ces bya ba ni slu bar mi byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The term “reality” means that it does not deceive.

original: bden pa kho na zhes bya ba ni bden pa dang mthun pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bden pa kho na zhes bya ba ni bden pa dang mthun pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The term “truth” means that it is in accord with truth.

original: de kho na nyid ces bya ba ni don dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de kho na nyid ces bya ba ni don dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The term “suchness” means that it is endowed with meaning.

original: ma nor ba nyid ces bya ba ni phyin ci log rnam pa bzhi dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma nor ba nyid ces bya ba ni phyin ci log rnam pa bzhi dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
translated: “Non-erroneous” means being free from the four errors.

original: phyin ci ma log pa nyid ces bya ba ni rjes su mthun pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phyin ci ma log pa nyid ces bya ba ni rjes su mthun pa'i phyir ro //
translated: “Non-inverted” means being in accordance with reality.

original: 'di ltar yang rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba 'di zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni rgyu dang rkyen rnam pa gnyis yin pas rgyu rkyen gnyis kyi phyir rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i go rims khas blang bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar yang rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba 'di zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni rgyu dang rkyen rnam pa gnyis yin pas rgyu rkyen gnyis kyi phyir rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i go rims khas blang bar bya'o //
translated: Thus, this dependent origination is the two kinds of causes and conditions, so the order of dependent origination should be accepted for the sake of the two causes and conditions.

original: gnyis gang zhe na /
analyzed: gnyis gang zhe na /
translated: What are the two?

original: gsungs pa / rgyu dang 'brel pa dang / rkyen dang 'brel pa'i phyir de yang phyi dang nang gi bye brag gis rnam pa bzhir khas blang dgos pas /
analyzed: gsungs pa / rgyu dang 'brel pa dang / rkyen dang 'brel pa'i phyir de yang phyi dang nang gi bye brag gis rnam pa bzhir khas blang dgos pas /
translated: It is said: Because of the connection with causes and the connection with conditions, it should be accepted that there are four kinds, distinguished as internal and external.🔽Therefore, it is said:

original: phyi dang de bzhin nang gi ni //
analyzed: phyi dang de bzhin nang gi ni //
translated: The internal and the external

original: rgyu dang rkyen ni rnam gnyis te //🔽zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: rgyu dang rkyen ni rnam gnyis te //🔽zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: are the two kinds of causes and conditions.

original: de ltar nang dang phyi rol gyi bye brag gis tha dad pa'i rgyu dang rkyen rnams kyi mtshan nyid kyi dbye ba ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: de ltar nang dang phyi rol gyi bye brag gis tha dad pa'i rgyu dang rkyen rnams kyi mtshan nyid kyi dbye ba ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: Thus, what is the classification of the characteristics of causes and conditions that are differentiated by internal and external distinctions?

original: phyi rol rgyu ni sa bon sogs //
analyzed: phyi rol rgyu ni sa bon sogs //
translated: External causes are seeds, etc.

original: zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: This is stated.

original: de la phyi rol gyi rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba rgyu dang bcas pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la phyi rol gyi rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba rgyu dang bcas pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is external dependent origination with its causes?

original: zhes brjod nas 'di lta ste /🔽sa bon las myu gu /
analyzed: zhes brjod nas 'di lta ste / sa bon las myu gu /
translated: Having stated this, it is said:🔽From a seed, a sprout;

original: myu gu las 'dab ma /🔽'dab ma las sdong bu /🔽sdong bu las sbu gu /
analyzed: myu gu las 'dab ma / 'dab ma las sdong bu / sdong bu las sbu gu /
translated: from a sprout, a leaf;🔽from a leaf, a stem;🔽from a stem, a hollow stalk;

original: sbu gu las snying po //
analyzed: sbu gu las snying po //
translated: from a hollow stalk, a pistil;

original: snying po las me tog / me tog las 'bras bu zhes bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: snying po las me tog / me tog las 'bras bu zhes bya ba gsungs so //
translated: from a pistil, a flower; from a flower, a fruit.

original: rkyen ni rnam pa drug tu bstan //
analyzed: rkyen ni rnam pa drug tu bstan //
translated: Conditions are taught to be of six kinds.

original: zhes bya ba ni skabs yin pa'i phyir phyi rol gyi rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i zhes bya bar sbyar te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni skabs yin pa'i phyir phyi rol gyi rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i zhes bya bar sbyar te /
translated: This is the context, so external dependent origination is supplied.

original: rnam pa drug ces bya ba ni sa la sogs pa rnam pa drug go //
analyzed: rnam pa drug ces bya ba ni sa la sogs pa rnam pa drug go //
translated: Six kinds refers to the six kinds such as earth.

original: de nyid kyi phyir smras pa /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir smras pa /
translated: For this very reason, it is said:

original: sa bon myu gu sdong bu sogs //
analyzed: sa bon myu gu sdong bu sogs //
translated: Seed, sprout, stem, and so on.🔽

original: ji ltar 'bras bu 'jug par brjod //
analyzed: ji ltar 'bras bu 'jug par brjod //
translated: How is it that the effect is said to be engaged in the seed, sprout, and so on?

original: sa bon yod na myu gu dang sdong bu la sogs pa 'bras bu la thug pa rnams 'byung gi sa bon med na myu gu dang sdong bu la sogs pa 'bras bu la thug pa rnams 'byung ba med do //
analyzed: sa bon yod na myu gu dang sdong bu la sogs pa 'bras bu la thug pa rnams 'byung gi sa bon med na myu gu dang sdong bu la sogs pa 'bras bu la thug pa rnams 'byung ba med do //
translated: When the seed exists, the sprout, trunk, and so on, up to the fruit, arise. When the seed does not exist, the sprout, trunk, and so on, up to the fruit, do not arise.

original: de las sa bon yang 'di snyam du bdag gis myu gu la sogs pa mngon par bsgrubs so snyam du mi sems so //
analyzed: de las sa bon yang 'di snyam du bdag gis myu gu la sogs pa mngon par bsgrubs so snyam du mi sems so //
translated: Moreover, the seed does not think, “I will produce the sprout and so on.”

original: myu gu la sogs pa yang 'di snyam du bdag ni sa bon la sogs pas mngon par bsgrubs so snyam du mi @32a * //🔽sems so // me tog kyang 'di snyam du bdag gis 'bras bu mngon par bsgrubs so snyam du mi sems pa'i bar du ste /
analyzed: myu gu la sogs pa yang 'di snyam du bdag ni sa bon la sogs pas mngon par bsgrubs so snyam du mi @32a * // sems so // me tog kyang 'di snyam du bdag gis 'bras bu mngon par bsgrubs so snyam du mi sems pa'i bar du ste /
translated: The sprout and so on also do not think, “I am produced by the seed and so on.”🔽The flower also does not think, “I will produce the fruit.”

original: 'bras bu yang 'di snyam du bdag ni me tog gis mngon par bsgrubs so snyam du mi sems mod /
analyzed: 'bras bu yang 'di snyam du bdag ni me tog gis mngon par bsgrubs so snyam du mi sems mod /
translated: The fruit also does not think, “I am produced by the flower.”

original: 'on kyang sa bon yod na myu gu la sogs pa nas 'bras bu la sogs par 'byung bar 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: 'on kyang sa bon yod na myu gu la sogs pa nas 'bras bu la sogs par 'byung bar 'gyur gyi /
translated: But if the seed exists, the sprout and so on, up to the fruit, will occur.

original: med na mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: med na mi 'gyur te /
translated: If it does not exist, they will not occur.

original: de ltar phyi rol gyi rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba rgyu dang 'brel par blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar phyi rol gyi rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba rgyu dang 'brel par blta bar bya'o //
translated: Thus, external dependent origination should be seen in terms of its relation to causes.

original: rkyen ni sa la sogs pa ste //
analyzed: rkyen ni sa la sogs pa ste //
translated: Conditions are earth and so on,

original: dus la thug pa go rims bzhin //🔽de nyid kyi phyi rol gyi rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba rkyen dang 'brel pa ji ltar blta zhe na zhes bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: dus la thug pa go rims bzhin // de nyid kyi phyi rol gyi rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba rkyen dang 'brel pa ji ltar blta zhe na zhes bya ba gsungs so //
translated: in sequence, up to time.🔽How should external dependent origination be seen in terms of its relation to conditions?🔽How many kinds of external dependent origination should be seen in terms of its relation to conditions?

original: phyi rol gyi rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba rkyen dang 'brel pa rnam pa dur blta bar bya zhe na gsungs pa /
analyzed: phyi rol gyi rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba rkyen dang 'brel pa rnam pa dur blta bar bya zhe na gsungs pa /
translated: It is said:

original: khams drug 'dus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: khams drug 'dus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because of the combination of the six elements.

original: drug po gang dag ce na /
analyzed: drug po gang dag ce na /
translated: What are the six?

original: sa dang / chu dang / me dang / rlung dang / nam mkha' dang / dus rnams go rims bzhin 'dus pa las phyi rol gyi rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba zhes bya ba'i rkyen nyid du go rims bzhin te /
analyzed: sa dang / chu dang / me dang / rlung dang / nam mkha' dang / dus rnams go rims bzhin 'dus pa las phyi rol gyi rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba zhes bya ba'i rkyen nyid du go rims bzhin te /
translated: earth, water, fire, wind, space, and time, in that order, are the conditions of external dependent origination.

original: go rims ji lta ba bzhin du shes par bya'o //
analyzed: go rims ji lta ba bzhin du shes par bya'o //
translated: They should be understood in that order.

original: rgyu dang rkyen 'di rnams las gang gi las gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: rgyu dang rkyen 'di rnams las gang gi las gang yin zhe na /
translated: What is the function of each of these causes and conditions?

original: de'i phyir smras pa /
analyzed: de'i phyir smras pa /
translated: Therefore it is said:🔽The functions of the elements are support, cohesion,

original: rten dang rlan dang smin pa dang // 'bru 'phel dang ni go 'byed dang // 'gyur ba dag ni de rnams kyis //
analyzed: rten dang rlan dang smin pa dang // 'bru 'phel dang ni go 'byed dang // 'gyur ba dag ni de rnams kyis //
translated: ripening, growth, providing space, and change.

original: bya ba ji bzhin 'jug pa'o //🔽de la sa'i khams ni sa bon rten pa'i bya ba byed do zhes bya ba ni sa bon myu gu bskyed par mngon du phyogs par rten pas sra ba nyid ces bya'o //
analyzed: bya ba ji bzhin 'jug pa'o // de la sa'i khams ni sa bon rten pa'i bya ba byed do zhes bya ba ni sa bon myu gu bskyed par mngon du phyogs par rten pas sra ba nyid ces bya'o //
translated: They function in accordance with their individual natures.🔽The earth element functions as the support of the seed.🔽The earth element is called solidity because it supports the seed that is about to produce the sprout.🔽The water element functions to moisten.

original: chu'i khams ni rlan par byed do zhes bya ba ni mnyan par byed do zhes bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: chu'i khams ni rlan par byed do zhes bya ba ni mnyan par byed do zhes bshad pa yin no //

translated: The wind element causes the seed to grow, because it causes the seed to increase.🔽The wind element causes the

original: dus ni sa bon 'gyur ba'i bya ba byed do zhes bya ba ni dus kyang rnam pa thams cad yongs su bsgrubs pas dus ji lta ba bzhin du 'gyur bar byed pa na sa bon 'gyur ba'i bya ba byed do zhes bya'o //🔽thams cad kyang ma tshang ba med na 'byung gi /
analyzed: dus ni sa bon 'gyur ba'i bya ba byed do zhes bya ba ni dus kyang rnam pa thams cad yongs su bsgrubs pas dus ji lta ba bzhin du 'gyur bar byed pa na sa bon 'gyur ba'i bya ba byed do zhes bya'o // thams cad kyang ma tshang ba med na 'byung gi /
translated: Time is the agent of the transformation of the seed, because it is time that causes the seed to transform in accordance with its nature, when all the conditions are present.

original: ma tshang na 'byung ba med do //
analyzed: ma tshang na 'byung ba med do //
translated: But if all the conditions are not present, it does not.

original: de nyid kyi phyir smras pa ;
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir smras pa ;
translated: That is why it is said:

original: rkyen rnams tshogs pa med na ni //
analyzed: rkyen rnams tshogs pa med na ni //
translated: When the assemblage of conditions is absent,

original: sa bon yod kyang myug sogs med //
analyzed: sa bon yod kyang myug sogs med //
translated: the sprout does not arise, even though the seed is present.

original: sa bon med pa nyid yin na //
analyzed: sa bon med pa nyid yin na //
translated: If the seed itself is absent,

original: rkyen rnams yod kyang de dang 'dra //
analyzed: rkyen rnams yod kyang de dang 'dra //
translated: the sprout does not arise, even though the conditions are present.

original: de nyid kyi phyir gsungs pa /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir gsungs pa /
translated: That is why it is said:

original: thams cad 'dus la sa bon 'gags pa na de las mngon par 'grub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: thams cad 'dus la sa bon 'gags pa na de las mngon par 'grub par 'gyur ro //
translated: When the assemblage of all the conditions is present, the seed ceases and the sprout is produced.

original: rgyu dang de bzhin rkyen rnams ni //
analyzed: rgyu dang de bzhin rkyen rnams ni //
translated: Causes and conditions

original: ngar 'dzin la sogs bral ba ste //
analyzed: ngar 'dzin la sogs bral ba ste //
translated: are devoid of the conception of “I” and so on.

original: rgyu dang rkyen ni tshogs pa las //
analyzed: rgyu dang rkyen ni tshogs pa las //
translated: From the assemblage of causes and conditions,

original: las kyi 'bras bu chud za med //
analyzed: las kyi 'bras bu chud za med //
translated: the result of action is not lost.

original: de la sa'i khams kyang 'di snyam du bdag gis sdug pa'i bya ba bya'o snyam du mi sems so //
analyzed: de la sa'i khams kyang 'di snyam du bdag gis sdug pa'i bya ba bya'o snyam du mi sems so //
translated: The earth element does not think, “I will perform the function of hardness.”

original: de bzhin du chu dang / me dang / rlung dang / nam mkha' dang / dus rnams kyang 'di snyam du mi sems te /
analyzed: de bzhin du chu dang / me dang / rlung dang / nam mkha' dang / dus rnams kyang 'di snyam du mi sems te /
translated: Likewise, the water, fire, wind, space, and time elements do not think, “I will perform the function of cohesion, heat, expansion, non-obstruction, and differentiation, respectively.”

original: ngar 'dzin pa dang / nga yir 'dzin pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ngar 'dzin pa dang / nga yir 'dzin pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there is no grasping of “I” and “mine.”

original: las kyi 'bras bur gdags pa chud za ba yang med de /
analyzed: las kyi 'bras bur gdags pa chud za ba yang med de /
translated: And the designation of the result of action does not disappear.

original: thams cad du rgyu dang rkyen rnams ma tshang ba med pa las zhes bya ba khong du chud par bya'o //
analyzed: thams cad du rgyu dang rkyen rnams ma tshang ba med pa las zhes bya ba khong du chud par bya'o //
translated: It should be understood that in all cases, the result arises from the non-exhaustion of the causes and conditions.

original: myu gu de yang zhes bya ba ni sa bon gyi rgyu can gyi myu gu la sogs pa de skyes pa na /
analyzed: myu gu de yang zhes bya ba ni sa bon gyi rgyu can gyi myu gu la sogs pa de skyes pa na /
translated: “And that sprout” means that when the sprout, which is the cause of the seed, arises,

original: bdag las ma yin gzhan las min //
analyzed: bdag las ma yin gzhan las min //
translated: It does not arise from itself, nor from another,

original: gnyis dang byed po dus las min //
analyzed: gnyis dang byed po dus las min //
translated: Nor from both, nor from a creator, nor without a cause.

original: de bzhin dbang phyug sogs byas min //
analyzed: de bzhin dbang phyug sogs byas min //
translated: Likewise, it is not created by Īśvara and so on.

original: rang bzhin las min rgyu med min //🔽zhes smos so //
analyzed: rang bzhin las min rgyu med min //🔽zhes smos so //
translated: It does not arise from its own nature, nor without a cause.

original: bdag las zhes bya ba ni dngos po rnams rgyu dang rkyen dag med par bdag nyid las skye ba'o //
analyzed: bdag las zhes bya ba ni dngos po rnams rgyu dang rkyen dag med par bdag nyid las skye ba'o //
translated: “From self” means that things arise from themselves without causes and conditions.

original: ngo bo nyid du smra ba rnams 'di ltar rtog ces grag ste /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid du smra ba rnams 'di ltar rtog ces grag ste /
translated: The proponents of intrinsic nature imagine things in this way, it is said.

original: dngos po rnams kyi ngo bo nyid //
analyzed: dngos po rnams kyi ngo bo nyid //
translated: The intrinsic nature of things

original: 'di ni dus rtag gnas pa ste //
analyzed: 'di ni dus rtag gnas pa ste //
translated: always exists.

original: 'di la 'ga' yang skye ba med //
analyzed: 'di la 'ga' yang skye ba med //
translated: Nothing arises here.

original: 'ga' yang 'gag par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'ga' yang 'gag par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Nothing ceases.🔽Who created the vivid colors of a peacock’s tail?

original: rma bya'i 'dab ma bkra ba dang // padma la sogs rab dmar dang // tsher ma rno la sogs pa gang //
analyzed: rma bya'i 'dab ma bkra ba dang // padma la sogs rab dmar dang // tsher ma rno la sogs pa gang //
translated: Who created the deep red of a lotus and so on?🔽Who created the sharpness of thorns and so on?

original: su zhig gis ni sngon byas smros //
analyzed: su zhig gis ni sngon byas smros //
translated: Tell me, who created these?

original: de bas na de'i gzhung lugs dgag pa'i phyir smras pa /
analyzed: de bas na de'i gzhung lugs dgag pa'i phyir smras pa /
translated: Therefore, to refute their theory, we say:

original: dngos po rnams rang las skye bar rung ba ma yin te /
analyzed: dngos po rnams rang las skye bar rung ba ma yin te /
translated: It is not tenable that things arise from themselves.

original: snga nyid nas gnas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: snga nyid nas gnas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they already exist.

original: skye ba dang ldan par khas len na ni rgyu dang rkyen nyid khas blangs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: skye ba dang ldan par khas len na ni rgyu dang rkyen nyid khas blangs par 'gyur ro //
translated: If you accept that they arise, then you accept that they have causes and conditions.

original: de bas na @33a * //
analyzed: de bas na @33a * //
translated: Therefore,

original: dngos po rnams rang gi ngo bo las skye bar rung ba ma yin te /
analyzed: dngos po rnams rang gi ngo bo las skye bar rung ba ma yin te /
translated: Things are not suitable to arise from their own entities.

original: skye ba dang ldan pa'i phyir bum pa la sogs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: skye ba dang ldan pa'i phyir bum pa la sogs pa bzhin no //
translated: Because they possess arising, like a pot, and so on.

original: gang gi ltar na dngos po rnams rtag tu gnas pa de'i ltar na skye ba dang / bya ba dang / las dang / gnas pa dang / 'jig pa yang mi rung ba zhig na /
analyzed: gang gi ltar na dngos po rnams rtag tu gnas pa de'i ltar na skye ba dang / bya ba dang / las dang / gnas pa dang / 'jig pa yang mi rung ba zhig na /
translated: According to those for whom things always endure, arising, action, activity, enduring, and disintegrating are not suitable.

original: skye ba dang / bya ba dang / las dang / gnas pa dang / 'jig pa yang mngon sum du snang ngo //
analyzed: skye ba dang / bya ba dang / las dang / gnas pa dang / 'jig pa yang mngon sum du snang ngo //
translated: However, arising, action, activity, enduring, and disintegrating are directly perceptible.

original: de bas na nyes pa 'dir thal bar 'gyur du 'ong bas bdag las min zhes smos te /
analyzed: de bas na nyes pa 'dir thal bar 'gyur du 'ong bas bdag las min zhes smos te /
translated: Therefore, because this fault would ensue, it is said, “not from itself.”

original: dngos po rnams rang las skye na rtag tu skye bar thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dngos po rnams rang las skye na rtag tu skye bar thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: If things arose from themselves, the consequence would be that they would always arise.

original: nam mkha' lta bur cung zad kyang gang du yang nam yang skye ba'am 'gag par mi 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: nam mkha' lta bur cung zad kyang gang du yang nam yang skye ba'am 'gag par mi 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: Like space, they would never arise or cease anywhere at all.

original: smras pa / mngon sum dang 'gal ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: smras pa / mngon sum dang 'gal ba'i phyir te /
translated: It is said, “Because it contradicts direct perception.”

original: 'di ltar dngos po rnams rgyu dang rkyen las skye bar ni snang ngo //
analyzed: 'di ltar dngos po rnams rgyu dang rkyen las skye bar ni snang ngo //
translated: In this way, things are seen to arise from causes and conditions.

original: de ltar na re zhig dngos po rnams rang gi ngo bo las ma skye'o //
analyzed: de ltar na re zhig dngos po rnams rang gi ngo bo las ma skye'o //
translated: Thus, things do not arise from their own nature.

original: gzhan las zhes bya ba ni bdag las so //
analyzed: gzhan las zhes bya ba ni bdag las so //
translated: “From another” means from a self.

original: gzhan skyed par byed pa dang / 'jig par byed pa'i bdag yod do zhes grag ste /
analyzed: gzhan skyed par byed pa dang / 'jig par byed pa'i bdag yod do zhes grag ste /
translated: It is said that a self exists that produces and destroys other things.

original: phyi dang nang gi dngos po thams cad ni bdag gi yon tan yin la /
analyzed: phyi dang nang gi dngos po thams cad ni bdag gi yon tan yin la /
translated: All external and internal things are the qualities of the self.

original: bdag ni nang gi byed pa'i skyes bur yod de /
analyzed: bdag ni nang gi byed pa'i skyes bur yod de /
translated: The self exists as an inner operative agent.

original: de yod na 'gro ba dang / 'od pa dang / g-yo ba dang / rtog pa dang / sel ba dang / rlom sems dang / bya ba dang ; las dang / de nyid dang gzhan nyid du yang 'jug go //
analyzed: de yod na 'gro ba dang / 'od pa dang / g-yo ba dang / rtog pa dang / sel ba dang / rlom sems dang / bya ba dang ; las dang / de nyid dang gzhan nyid du yang 'jug go //
translated: When it exists, there is movement, vision, action, thought, desire, pride, activity, and karma, and there is engagement in sameness and difference.

original: mig la sogs pa ni bdag gi yon tan yin te /
analyzed: mig la sogs pa ni bdag gi yon tan yin te /
translated: The eye and so on are the qualities of the self.

original: gzhan gyi don yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gzhan gyi don yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Because they are for the sake of another.

original: mal cha la sogs pa'i yan lag bzhin no zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: mal cha la sogs pa'i yan lag bzhin no zhes bya ba la /
translated: Like the parts of a bed and so on.

original: gzhan zhes bya ba'i sgras ni bdag gi yin par brjod do //
analyzed: gzhan zhes bya ba'i sgras ni bdag gi yin par brjod do //
translated: The word “another” refers to the self.

original: mig la sogs pa ni de'i yon tan yin pas de'i don ni gzhan gyi don te /
analyzed: mig la sogs pa ni de'i yon tan yin pas de'i don ni gzhan gyi don te /
translated: The eyes, etc. are its qualities, so its purpose is the purpose of another.

original: dper na mal cha la sogs pa gzhan du nye bar sbyor ba la gzhan gyi don zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na mal cha la sogs pa gzhan du nye bar sbyor ba la gzhan gyi don zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
translated: For example, a bed, etc. is called the purpose of another when it is applied to another.

original: gzhan gyi don yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs 'di ni mal cha'i dpe dang mi sbyor te /
analyzed: gzhan gyi don yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs 'di ni mal cha'i dpe dang mi sbyor te /
translated: This reason, “because it is the purpose of another,” is not applied to the example of the bed.

original: 'dus pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dus pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is a collection.

original: bdag ni 'dus pa ma yin pa'i rang gi ngo bo yin na /
analyzed: bdag ni 'dus pa ma yin pa'i rang gi ngo bo yin na /
translated: If the self is a non-collected intrinsic reality,

original: ji ltar na bdag 'dus pa ma yin zhing bdag lus med pa la mal cha la sogs pa'i yan lag 'dus pa'i rang gi ngo bos phan 'dogs par rung /
analyzed: ji ltar na bdag 'dus pa ma yin zhing bdag lus med pa la mal cha la sogs pa'i yan lag 'dus pa'i rang gi ngo bos phan 'dogs par rung /
translated: how could the non-collected self, the disembodied self, be benefited by the intrinsic reality of the collection of the parts of a bed, etc.?

original: de bas na gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa de /
analyzed: de bas na gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa de /
translated: Therefore, the meaning of the reason is unestablished.

original: 'dus pa ma yin pa gzhan gyi don sgrub par byed pas mal cha'i dbye bas mal cha'i dpe 'dus @33b pa gzhan gyi don kho na bsgrubs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dus pa ma yin pa gzhan gyi don sgrub par byed pas mal cha'i dbye bas mal cha'i dpe 'dus @33b pa gzhan gyi don kho na bsgrubs pa yin no //
translated: The example of the bed, which is a division of the bed, proves only the purpose of another, which is a collection.

original: bdag 'dus pa yin pas rgyu dang rkyen las skye ba thob pa la nga dang nga'i zhes rlom pa'i rnam pa 'jug pa'i phyir sems kho na la bdag ces bya'i /🔽'di la nang gi byed pa'i skyes bu rus sbal gyi spu'i rang bzhin dang 'dra ba rigs pa dang rjes su dpag pa dang bral ba ni 'ga' yang mad do zhes bstan pa'i phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis phyi dang nang gi dngos po ni gzhan las skye ba
analyzed: bdag 'dus pa yin pas rgyu dang rkyen las skye ba thob pa la nga dang nga'i zhes rlom pa'i rnam pa 'jug pa'i phyir sems kho na la bdag ces bya'i / 'di la nang gi byed pa'i skyes bu rus sbal gyi spu'i rang bzhin dang 'dra ba rigs pa dang rjes su dpag pa dang bral ba ni 'ga' yang mad do zhes bstan pa'i phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis phyi dang nang gi dngos po ni gzhan las skye ba
translated: Since the self is a collection, the aspect of the conceit “I” and “mine” occurs in relation to that which is obtained from causes and conditions. Therefore, only mind is called “self.”

original: rung ba ma yin pa gsungs so //
analyzed: rung ba ma yin pa gsungs so //
translated: The Bhagavān said that it is not tenable for internal things to arise from self or other because he wanted to teach that there is no creator being that is the inner agent, which is like the horn of a rabbit, that is devoid of reasoning and inference.

original: gal te de ltar dngos po rnams bdag las kyang skye bar mi 'gyur /
analyzed: gal te de ltar dngos po rnams bdag las kyang skye bar mi 'gyur /
translated: If things do not arise from self,

original: gzhan las kyang ma yin /
analyzed: gzhan las kyang ma yin /
translated: nor from other,🔽then it follows that things arise from both.

original: 'o na dngos po rnam pa gnyis las skye bar 'gyur ro snyam na de'i phyir de'i gzhung lugs dgag pa'i phyir smras pa /
analyzed: 'o na dngos po rnam pa gnyis las skye bar 'gyur ro snyam na de'i phyir de'i gzhung lugs dgag pa'i phyir smras pa /
translated: To refute that view, he said:

original: gnyis dang byed po dus las min //🔽zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: gnyis dang byed po dus las min // zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Not from both, nor from a creator, nor from time.

original: bdag dang gzhan las ma yin no //
analyzed: bdag dang gzhan las ma yin no //
translated: Things do not arise from self or other.

original: gzhan dag ni bdag dang gzhan 'brel pa las /
analyzed: gzhan dag ni bdag dang gzhan 'brel pa las /
translated: The others are related to self and other.🔽

original: dngos po rnams skye bar rtogs te /
analyzed: dngos po rnams skye bar rtogs te /
translated: Others understand that things arise from the relationship between self and other.

original: de'i phyir gnyis nyid du brjod pa de lta na'ang /
analyzed: de'i phyir gnyis nyid du brjod pa de lta na'ang /
translated: Therefore, although it is said that things arise from the two,

original: bdag las ma dmigs pa'i phyir dang / gzhan las min pa'i phyir gnyis las min zhes smos te /
analyzed: bdag las ma dmigs pa'i phyir dang / gzhan las min pa'i phyir gnyis las min zhes smos te /
translated: since self is not observed and since other is not, it is said that things do not arise from both.

original: rgyu dang rkyen ma gtogs pa bdag dang gzhan med do zhes bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs so //🔽gal te gnyis phrad kyang skye ba dang 'jig par mi 'dod na 'o na byed po gzhan dbang gis skye ba dang 'jig par 'gyur ro zhes kha cig zer te mu stegs byed gzhan dag byed pa po zhes bya ba thog ma'i byed pa po rtag pa rgyun
analyzed: rgyu dang rkyen ma gtogs pa bdag dang gzhan med do zhes bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs so // gal te gnyis phrad kyang skye ba dang 'jig par mi 'dod na 'o na byed po gzhan dbang gis skye ba dang 'jig par 'gyur ro zhes kha cig zer te mu stegs byed gzhan dag byed pa po zhes bya ba thog ma'i byed pa po rtag pa rgyun
translated: The Bhagavān has said that apart from causes and conditions, there is neither self nor other.🔽If you do not assert that things arise and are destroyed through the contact of the two, then some say that things arise and are destroyed through the power of another creator.

original: mi chad pa khyab pa'i bdag 'ga' zhig yod de /
analyzed: mi chad pa khyab pa'i bdag 'ga' zhig yod de /
translated: Other tīrthikas imagine that there is a permanent, continuous, and pervasive self called “the creator” that is the original creator.

original: des phyi dang nang 'di thams cad skyed cing 'jig par byed do zhes rtogs so //
analyzed: des phyi dang nang 'di thams cad skyed cing 'jig par byed do zhes rtogs so //
translated: It creates and destroys all of this, the external and internal world.

original: de bas na de'i gzhung lugs dgag pa'i phyir smras pa /
analyzed: de bas na de'i gzhung lugs dgag pa'i phyir smras pa /
translated: Therefore, in order to refute their theory, it is said:

original: dngos po rnams skye ba dang / gnas pa dang / 'jig pa nyid ni byed pa po la rig las pa ma yin no //
analyzed: dngos po rnams skye ba dang / gnas pa dang / 'jig pa nyid ni byed pa po la rig las pa ma yin no //
translated: The arising, enduring, and disintegrating of things is not dependent on an agent.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: What is it, then?

original: rgyu dang rkyen 'brel pa las dngos po rnams 'jug par snang ngo //
analyzed: rgyu dang rkyen 'brel pa las dngos po rnams 'jug par snang ngo //
translated: Things are seen to engage in activity due to the connection of causes and conditions.

original: byed pa po ni nam mkha' bzhin 'gyur ba med pa'i phyir de la rag ma las te /
analyzed: byed pa po ni nam mkha' bzhin 'gyur ba med pa'i phyir de la rag ma las te /
