analyzed: de ni 'dod dang mthong ba med // rigs pa smra rnams rgyu dang ni //
translated: It is not desire or seeing.🔽The proponents of reasoning assert that

original: rgyu mthun 'dra ba nyid du 'dod //🔽rtag las 'bras bu rtag rigs te //
analyzed: rgyu mthun 'dra ba nyid du 'dod // rtag las 'bras bu rtag rigs te //
translated: it is a cause and a similar outcome.🔽It is logical that a permanent effect arises from a permanent cause,

original: mi rtag las kyang mi rtag nyid //
analyzed: mi rtag las kyang mi rtag nyid //
translated: and that an impermanent effect arises from an impermanent cause.

original: s'a lu'i sa bon las 'bras bu //
analyzed: s'a lu'i sa bon las 'bras bu //
translated: From a rice seed, a rice sprout

original: las kyi myu gu skye ba mthong //
analyzed: las kyi myu gu skye ba mthong //
translated: is seen to arise.

original: de bzhin dbang phyug che rtag ni //
analyzed: de bzhin dbang phyug che rtag ni //
translated: In the same way, from the permanent, great Īśvara

original: dngos po @35b rnams ni rtag tu 'byung //
analyzed: dngos po @35b rnams ni rtag tu 'byung //
translated: things always arise.🔽If you assert that Īśvara burns everything

original: ji ltar me yis thams cad sreg / de bzhin gal te dbang phyug 'dod //
analyzed: ji ltar me yis thams cad sreg / de bzhin gal te dbang phyug 'dod //
translated: as fire does,

original: me yi rgyu ni me gzhan la //
analyzed: me yi rgyu ni me gzhan la //
translated: then fire would have another fire as its cause,

original: dbang phyug la ni rgyu yod min //🔽rim gyis 'jug pas me rgyun las //
analyzed: dbang phyug la ni rgyu yod min // rim gyis 'jug pas me rgyun las //
translated: but Īśvara has no cause.🔽If you assert that everything is burned

original: thams cad sreg pa yang 'dod na //
analyzed: thams cad sreg pa yang 'dod na //
translated: by the fire that arises from the fire’s continuum,

original: dbang phyug la ni 'gyur med pas //
analyzed: dbang phyug la ni 'gyur med pas //
translated: then because Īśvara is changeless,

original: me dang 'dra bar rung ma yin //
analyzed: me dang 'dra bar rung ma yin //
translated: he is not suitable to be like fire.

original: de ltar na dbang phyug byed pa po nyid du khas len pa la nyes pa mang du yod pas /
analyzed: de ltar na dbang phyug byed pa po nyid du khas len pa la nyes pa mang du yod pas /
translated: Thus, because there are many faults in the assertion that Īśvara is the agent,

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis dngos po rnams skye ba dbang phyug gis byas par mi rung ngo zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis dngos po rnams skye ba dbang phyug gis byas par mi rung ngo zhes gsungs so //
translated: The Bhagavān has said that the creation of things by Īśvara is not tenable.

original: gzhan dag ni thams cad dus kyis bsgyur bar 'dod do //
analyzed: gzhan dag ni thams cad dus kyis bsgyur bar 'dod do //
translated: Others assert that everything is transformed by time.

original: de dag ni 'di skad smras te /
analyzed: de dag ni 'di skad smras te /
translated: They say this:

original: dngos rnams skye zhing gnas pa ni //
analyzed: dngos rnams skye zhing gnas pa ni //
translated: The arising and enduring of things

original: dus kyis sgyur bar byed pa ste //
analyzed: dus kyis sgyur bar byed pa ste //
translated: is transformed by time.

original: dngos rnams skye dang gnas pa yang //
analyzed: dngos rnams skye dang gnas pa yang //
translated: The arising and enduring of things

original: dus kyis sgyur bar byed pa nyid //
analyzed: dus kyis sgyur bar byed pa nyid //
translated: is transformed by time.

original: de la 'di skad brjod de /
analyzed: de la 'di skad brjod de /
translated: In response to this, it is said:

original: 'di la dus zhes bya ba ci yin /
analyzed: 'di la dus zhes bya ba ci yin /
translated: What is this so-called time?

original: rtag pa'am / mi rtag pa'am /🔽pho'am / mo'am /
analyzed: rtag pa'am / mi rtag pa'am / pho'am / mo'am /
translated: Is it permanent or impermanent?

original: ma ning gi rang bzhin nam /
analyzed: ma ning gi rang bzhin nam /
translated: Is it male, female, or neuter?

original: lha'am / sha za'am /
analyzed: lha'am / sha za'am /
translated: Is it a god, a flesh-eater,

original: lus can nam /
analyzed: lus can nam /
translated: a corporeal being,

original: lus can ma yin pa'am /🔽bya ba dang bcas pa'am /🔽bya ba med pa dang ldan pa zhig / gal te de rtag bya ba las //
analyzed: lus can ma yin pa'am / bya ba dang bcas pa'am / bya ba med pa dang ldan pa zhig / gal te de rtag bya ba las //
translated: or a non-corporeal being?🔽Is it endowed with activity or devoid of activity?

original: de la rag las rung ma yin //
analyzed: de la rag las rung ma yin //
translated: If it is permanent, it cannot depend on activity.

original: cig car skye bar 'gyur de yang //
analyzed: cig car skye bar 'gyur de yang //
translated: Simultaneous arising is also unacceptable

original: 'gal ba'i phyir ni mi 'dod do //
analyzed: 'gal ba'i phyir ni mi 'dod do //
translated: because it is contradictory.

original: mi rtag nyid na dus min gyi //
analyzed: mi rtag nyid na dus min gyi //
translated: If it is impermanent, then it is not

original: rgyu dang rkyen ni 'brel phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu dang rkyen ni 'brel phyir ro //
translated: because of the connection of causes and conditions.

original: gal te skyes pa bud med dang // ma ning sogs yin ci smra 'gal //
analyzed: gal te skyes pa bud med dang // ma ning sogs yin ci smra 'gal //
translated: If it is a man, a woman, a neuter, etc., what is said is contradictory.

original: lus can lus med bya ba sogs //
analyzed: lus can lus med bya ba sogs //
translated: If it is embodied or disembodied, etc.,

original: yin na phan tshun 'gal ba nyid //
analyzed: yin na phan tshun 'gal ba nyid //
translated: then there is mutual contradiction.

original: rtag pa nyid na mi 'gyur phyir //
analyzed: rtag pa nyid na mi 'gyur phyir //
translated: If it is permanent, then it is not

original: bya dang las ni 'gal bar 'gyur //
analyzed: bya dang las ni 'gal bar 'gyur //
translated: because of the contradiction of action and agent.

original: de ltar na dus su smra ba rnams dus kyi dbang gis dngos po rnams skye ba dang / gnas pa dang / 'jig par khas len pa yang rung ba ma yin pas de yang bzang po ma yin pa nyid do //
analyzed: de ltar na dus su smra ba rnams dus kyi dbang gis dngos po rnams skye ba dang / gnas pa dang / 'jig par khas len pa yang rung ba ma yin pas de yang bzang po ma yin pa nyid do //
translated: Thus, it is not right for the proponents of time to accept that things arise, endure, and are destroyed by the power of time. Therefore, that is not good.

original: nyi ma dang / zla ba dang / skar ma dang / dus tshigs dang / lo la sogs pa dang / phyi nang gi dngos po rnams song ba dang / 'gro bar 'gyur ba'i ngo bo'i phyir dus zhes bya bas de'i phyir dngos po rnams skye ba dang /
analyzed: nyi ma dang / zla ba dang / skar ma dang / dus tshigs dang / lo la sogs pa dang / phyi nang gi dngos po rnams song ba dang / 'gro bar 'gyur ba'i ngo bo'i phyir dus zhes bya bas de'i phyir dngos po rnams skye ba dang /
translated: Because the sun, moon, stars, seasons, years, and so on, and internal and external things have the nature of going and will go, they are called time. Therefore, the arising, enduring, and being destroyed of things

original: gnas pa dang / 'jig pa ni /
analyzed: gnas pa dang / 'jig pa ni /
translated: is not tenable.

original: dus kyis ba sgyur bar mi rung ngo //
analyzed: dus kyis ba sgyur bar mi rung ngo //
translated: It is not suitable to change it through time.

original: gzhan yang rang bzhin du smra ba dag ni nang dang phyi rol gyi dngos po thams cad rang bzhin las 'byung bar 'dod de /
analyzed: gzhan yang rang bzhin du smra ba dag ni nang dang phyi rol gyi dngos po thams cad rang bzhin las 'byung bar 'dod de /
translated: Moreover, the proponents of intrinsic nature assert that all inner and outer things arise from intrinsic nature.

original: dngos po rnams kyi rang bzhin kho nar zad kyi /🔽dngos po 'ga'i skyed par byed pa'am /🔽'jig @36a * //
analyzed: dngos po rnams kyi rang bzhin kho nar zad kyi / dngos po 'ga'i skyed par byed pa'am / 'jig @36a * //
translated: They say that the intrinsic nature of things is exhausted🔽and that there is no cause whatsoever that produces some things

original: bar byed pa'i rgyu ni 'ga' yang med de /
analyzed: bar byed pa'i rgyu ni 'ga' yang med de /
translated: or causes them to🔽cease.

original: sra ba dang / gsher ba dang / dro ba dang / yang ba nyid dang / 'jam pa dang / rno ba'i rang bzhin nyid dang / mngar ba dang / skyur ba dang / lan tshva dang / kha ba dang / sems can ma yin pa'i dbye ba nyid de /
analyzed: sra ba dang / gsher ba dang / dro ba dang / yang ba nyid dang / 'jam pa dang / rno ba'i rang bzhin nyid dang / mngar ba dang / skyur ba dang / lan tshva dang / kha ba dang / sems can ma yin pa'i dbye ba nyid de /
translated: The intrinsic natures of solidity, fluidity, heat, and motility; smoothness, roughness, sharpness, and dullness; sweetness, sourness, saltiness, and bitterness; and the categories of non-sentient beings🔽are the five: gods, humans,🔽demigods, animals, and ghosts.

original: lnga mi dud 'gro la sogs dang // rgyal po bram ze rigs ngan sogs //
analyzed: lnga mi dud 'gro la sogs dang // rgyal po bram ze rigs ngan sogs //
translated: Kings, brahmins, and low castes,🔽and so on,🔽are the result of good and bad actions

original: legs par byas dang nyes byas dang // bde sdug rtag tu gnas pa nyid //
analyzed: legs par byas dang nyes byas dang // bde sdug rtag tu gnas pa nyid //
translated: and the experience of happiness and suffering.

original: de ltar rang bzhin yid gnyis kyis /
analyzed: de ltar rang bzhin yid gnyis kyis /
translated: Thus, through the intrinsic nature of doubt,

original: sems 'khrul pa de la 'di skad ces brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: sems 'khrul pa de la 'di skad ces brjod par bya ste /
translated: To the deluded mind, one should say the following:

original: rang bzhin la ni 'gyur mthong bas //
analyzed: rang bzhin la ni 'gyur mthong bas //
translated: Since the nature is seen to change,

original: mngon sum la sogs 'gal phyir ro //🔽gang la 'gyur ba yod pa de //
analyzed: mngon sum la sogs 'gal phyir ro // gang la 'gyur ba yod pa de //
translated: it is contradictory to direct perception and so forth.🔽How could that which has change

original: 'gyur ba med pa ji ltar 'gyur //
analyzed: 'gyur ba med pa ji ltar 'gyur //
translated: not be changed?

original: gsal ba du ma tha dad la //
analyzed: gsal ba du ma tha dad la //
translated: Since the many manifestations are different,

original: skye ba dang ni 'jig pa snang //
analyzed: skye ba dang ni 'jig pa snang //
translated: arising and ceasing appear.

original: skye dang 'jig dang 'brel na ni //
analyzed: skye dang 'jig dang 'brel na ni //
translated: If it were connected with arising and ceasing,

original: mi 'gyur bar ni ji ltar 'gyur //
analyzed: mi 'gyur bar ni ji ltar 'gyur //
translated: how could it be unchanging?

original: rang bzhin 'gyur ba med pa'i phyir //
analyzed: rang bzhin 'gyur ba med pa'i phyir //
translated: Since the nature is unchanging,

original: skyes bu la sogs don med na ;🔽/ rigs dang rgyal po zhing sogs la //
analyzed: skyes bu la sogs don med na ; / rigs dang rgyal po zhing sogs la //
translated: if the person and so forth are not meaningful,🔽the results of their caste, king, field, and so forth

original: de dag gi yang 'bras bu snang //
analyzed: de dag gi yang 'bras bu snang //
translated: are also seen.

original: rang bzhin 'gyur na ni /
analyzed: rang bzhin 'gyur na ni /
translated: If the nature changes,

original: rtag par smras pa nyams par 'gyur //🔽de lta bas na rgyu rkyen du //
analyzed: rtag par smras pa nyams par 'gyur // de lta bas na rgyu rkyen du //
translated: the assertion of permanence would be undermined.🔽Therefore, this path of those

original: smra ba rnams kyi lam 'di rigs //
analyzed: smra ba rnams kyi lam 'di rigs //
translated: who speak of causes and conditions is reasonable.

original: de ltar na rang bzhin du smra ba yang phan tshun 'gal ba nyid pas dngos po rnams kyi skye ba dang / gnas pa dang / 'jig pa ni rang bzhin las 'byung bar mi rung ngo zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de ltar na rang bzhin du smra ba yang phan tshun 'gal ba nyid pas dngos po rnams kyi skye ba dang / gnas pa dang / 'jig pa ni rang bzhin las 'byung bar mi rung ngo zhes gsungs so //
translated: Thus, because the proponents of intrinsic nature are mutually contradictory, it is said that the arising, enduring, and disintegrating of things cannot occur from intrinsic nature.

original: 'o na dngos po rnams kyi skye ba dang / gnas pa dang / 'jig pa rgyu med pa can du 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'o na dngos po rnams kyi skye ba dang / gnas pa dang / 'jig pa rgyu med pa can du 'gyur te /
translated: Well, then, the arising, enduring, and disintegrating of things would be causeless.

original: gzhan rgyu med pa can du smra ba rnams rgyu med pa kho nar dngos po rnams skye ba dang 'gag par rtog go //
analyzed: gzhan rgyu med pa can du smra ba rnams rgyu med pa kho nar dngos po rnams skye ba dang 'gag par rtog go //
translated: Because the proponents of causelessness conceive that things arise and cease without any cause at all.

original: rgyu med par smra bar khas len na rgyu nges pa med pa'i phyir byas pa chud za ba dang / ma byas pa dang phrad pa dang thug pa med par yang 'gyur la /
analyzed: rgyu med par smra bar khas len na rgyu nges pa med pa'i phyir byas pa chud za ba dang / ma byas pa dang phrad pa dang thug pa med par yang 'gyur la /
translated: If one accepts the doctrine of causelessness, then because there would be no definite cause, there would be the loss of what has been done and the meeting with what has not been done, and there would be no end.

original: legs par byas pa dang / nyes par byas pa la sogs pa dang / pha dang / bu dang / bram ze dang / rgyal rigs dang / rje'u rigs dang / dmangs rigs dang ; khyi sha can la sogs pa dang / gtsang ba dang mi gtsang ba dang /
analyzed: legs par byas pa dang / nyes par byas pa la sogs pa dang / pha dang / bu dang / bram ze dang / rgyal rigs dang / rje'u rigs dang / dmangs rigs dang ; khyi sha can la sogs pa dang / gtsang ba dang mi gtsang ba dang /
translated: and good and bad actions, and so on, and father, son, brahmin, warrior, merchant, laborer, outcaste, and so on, and pure and impure,

original: bgrod par bya ba dang / bgrod par bya ba ma yin pa dang / bza' ba dang / mi bza' ba dang / lha dang / sha za la sogs pa dang / sbyin pa dang / dul ba dang / yang dag par sdom pa dang /
analyzed: bgrod par bya ba dang / bgrod par bya ba ma yin pa dang / bza' ba dang / mi bza' ba dang / lha dang / sha za la sogs pa dang / sbyin pa dang / dul ba dang / yang dag par sdom pa dang /
translated: and what is to be traversed and what is not to be traversed, and what is to be eaten and what is not to be eaten, and gods, piśācas, and so on, and giving, taming, restraint,

original: bzlas brjod dang / @36b dka' thub dang / smyung ba dang / nges pa dang / mchod sbyin shes pa dang / mi shes pa la sogs pa'i rgyu nges pa med pa'i phyir phan tshun bye brag nges par rnam par gzhag par yang mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bzlas brjod dang / @36b dka' thub dang / smyung ba dang / nges pa dang / mchod sbyin shes pa dang / mi shes pa la sogs pa'i rgyu nges pa med pa'i phyir phan tshun bye brag nges par rnam par gzhag par yang mi 'gyur ro //
translated: recitation, asceticism, fasting, certainty, knowing sacrifice, and not knowing sacrifice, and so on, because the cause is not ascertained, they would not be established as mutually distinct.

original: de bas na nyes pa der thal bar 'gyur du 'ong bas rgyu med par smra ba yang 'jig rten la sogs pa dang 'gal ba'i phyir ma grub pa nyid do //
analyzed: de bas na nyes pa der thal bar 'gyur du 'ong bas rgyu med par smra ba yang 'jig rten la sogs pa dang 'gal ba'i phyir ma grub pa nyid do //
translated: Therefore, since the consequence of that fault would ensue, the assertion of causelessness is also unestablished, because it contradicts the world and so on.

original: gang gzhan gtso bo dang / rdul phra rab la sogs pa dang / rgyu med pa dang mi mthun pa'i rgyur smra bas smra ba la sogs pa de dag kyang 'di nyid kyis dgag par bya'o //
analyzed: gang gzhan gtso bo dang / rdul phra rab la sogs pa dang / rgyu med pa dang mi mthun pa'i rgyur smra bas smra ba la sogs pa de dag kyang 'di nyid kyis dgag par bya'o //
translated: Also, those who assert other causes, such as the primal substance, subtle atoms, and so on, and those who assert causelessness and incompatible causes should be refuted by this very same method.🔽Therefore it is said:

original: de'i phyir / bdag las ma yin gzhan las min //
analyzed: de'i phyir / bdag las ma yin gzhan las min //
translated: Not from self, not from other,

original: gnyis dang byed po dus kyis min ;
analyzed: gnyis dang byed po dus kyis min ;
translated: not from both, not from a creator, not from time,

original: / de bzhin dbang phyug sogs byas min //
analyzed: / de bzhin dbang phyug sogs byas min //
translated: not from a supreme being, and so on,

original: rang bzhin las min rgyu med min //
analyzed: rang bzhin las min rgyu med min //
translated: not from self-nature, not without cause.

original: zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes gsungs so //
translated: It is said:

original: rgyu dang rkyen gyis 'jug pa yang //
analyzed: rgyu dang rkyen gyis 'jug pa yang //
translated: The engagement of causes and conditions

original: thog ma med pa'i dus can snang //
analyzed: thog ma med pa'i dus can snang //
translated: appears to have no beginning.

original: zhes bya ba ni thog ma med pa'i dus nas spros pa'i bag chags kyi sa bon rgyun mi 'chad par chu bo'i rgyun 'bab pa bzhin rjes su 'jug pas /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni thog ma med pa'i dus nas spros pa'i bag chags kyi sa bon rgyun mi 'chad par chu bo'i rgyun 'bab pa bzhin rjes su 'jug pas /
translated: Since beginningless time, the seeds of the latent tendencies of proliferation have continuously followed, like the flow of a river.

original: rgyu dang rkyen gyis 'jug pa yang //
analyzed: rgyu dang rkyen gyis 'jug pa yang //
translated: and by causes and conditions,

original: thog ma med pa'i dus can snang //
analyzed: thog ma med pa'i dus can snang //
translated: they appear to have no beginning.

original: zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: Thus it is said.

original: de nyid kyi phyir mdo las /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir mdo las /
translated: Therefore, in the sutra,

original: 'on kyang / sa dang / chu dang / me dang / rlung dang / nam mkha' dang / dus kyi khams rnams 'dus nas sa bon 'gags pa na myu gu mngon par 'gyur ro zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: 'on kyang / sa dang / chu dang / me dang / rlung dang / nam mkha' dang / dus kyi khams rnams 'dus nas sa bon 'gags pa na myu gu mngon par 'gyur ro zhes gsungs te /
translated: it is said, “However, when the seed ceases, the sprout appears, through the combination of the elements of earth, water, fire, wind, space, and time.”

original: 'on kyang zhes bya ba ni med pa las byung ba dang / bdag dang / gzhan dang / gnyis ka dang / dbang phyug la sogs pa dang bral ba'i sa bon dang sa la sogs pa'i tshogs pa nyid las myu gu la sogs pa skye bar 'gyur ro zhes bya'o //🔽rgyu lnga dag gis phyi rol gyi //
analyzed: 'on kyang zhes bya ba ni med pa las byung ba dang / bdag dang / gzhan dang / gnyis ka dang / dbang phyug la sogs pa dang bral ba'i sa bon dang sa la sogs pa'i tshogs pa nyid las myu gu la sogs pa skye bar 'gyur ro zhes bya'o // rgyu lnga dag gis phyi rol gyi //
translated: “ However” means that the sprout arises from the combination of the seed and earth, etc., free from arising from self, other, both, or without cause, or by God, etc.🔽External dependent origination

original: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba bzhed //
analyzed: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba bzhed //
translated: is accepted as having five causes.

original: ces bya ba la /
analyzed: ces bya ba la /
translated: Here,

original: rgyu lnga dag gis zhes bya ba ni rgyu lnga po dag gis so //
analyzed: rgyu lnga dag gis zhes bya ba ni rgyu lnga po dag gis so //
translated: “by five causes” means by five causes.

original: phyi rol gyi zhes bya ba ni sa bon la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: phyi rol gyi zhes bya ba ni sa bon la sogs pa'o //
translated: “ External” means seed, etc.

original: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba zhes bya ba ni rten cing 'brel par ro //
analyzed: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba zhes bya ba ni rten cing 'brel par ro //
translated: Dependent origination is the arising of things in dependence on causes.

original: rtag par ma yin chad par min //🔽'pho bar ma yin rgyu chung las //🔽'bras bu chen po 'grub pa dang // 'dra ba'i rjes su 'gro phyir yang //
analyzed: rtag par ma yin chad par min // 'pho bar ma yin rgyu chung las // 'bras bu chen po 'grub pa dang // 'dra ba'i rjes su 'gro phyir yang //
translated: It is not eternalism, nor is it annihilationism.🔽It is not transference, and a great result is produced from a small cause.

original: zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: And because of the conformity of the result to the cause.

original: rtag par ma yin zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: rtag par ma yin zhes bya ba ni /
translated: It is not eternalism because

original: gang gi phyir sa bon yang gzhan nyid la myu gu yang gzhan nyid de /🔽myu gu gang yin pa de nyid kyang sa bon ma yin la /
analyzed: gang gi phyir sa bon yang gzhan nyid la myu gu yang gzhan nyid de / myu gu gang yin pa de nyid kyang sa bon ma yin la /
translated: the seed is one thing and the sprout is another.🔽The sprout is not the seed itself,

original: sa bon nyid kyang myu gu @37a * //🔽ma yin la /🔽sa bon ma 'gags na yang myu gu mi 'byung la /
analyzed: sa bon nyid kyang myu gu @37a * // ma yin la / sa bon ma 'gags na yang myu gu mi 'byung la /
translated: nor is the seed itself the sprout.🔽The sprout does not arise when the seed has not ceased,

original: 'gags na yang ma yin gyi /🔽'on kyang sa bon yang 'gags la /
analyzed: 'gags na yang ma yin gyi / 'on kyang sa bon yang 'gags la /
translated: nor does it arise when the seed has ceased.

original: myu gu yang skye ste /
analyzed: myu gu yang skye ste /
translated: However, the seed ceases and the sprout arises.

original: de'i phyir rtag par ma yin no //🔽chad par min zhes bya ba ni sa bon sngar 'gags pa las kyang myu gu mi skye la /
analyzed: de'i phyir rtag par ma yin no // chad par min zhes bya ba ni sa bon sngar 'gags pa las kyang myu gu mi skye la /
translated: Therefore, it is not eternalism.🔽It is not annihilationism because the sprout does not arise from a seed that has previously ceased.

original: ma 'gags pa las kyang ma yin gyi /
analyzed: ma 'gags pa las kyang ma yin gyi /
translated: Nor does it arise from a seed that has not ceased.

original: 'on kyang sa bon yang 'gags la /
analyzed: 'on kyang sa bon yang 'gags la /
translated: But the seed ceases,

original: de nyid kyi tshe myu gu yang 'byung bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de nyid kyi tshe myu gu yang 'byung bar 'gyur te /
translated: and at that very time the sprout arises.

original: de bas na chad par ma yin no //
analyzed: de bas na chad par ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is not annihilation.

original: 'pho bar ma yin zhes bya ba ni sa bon dang myu gu mi 'dra ba kho na ste /
analyzed: 'pho bar ma yin zhes bya ba ni sa bon dang myu gu mi 'dra ba kho na ste /
translated: It is not transference means that the seed and the sprout are not the same.

original: de'i 'pho bar ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i 'pho bar ma yin no //
translated: It is not transference of that.

original: rgyu chung du las zhes bya ba ni sa bon chung du btab pa las so //🔽'bras bu chen po 'grub pa zhes bya ba ni rgyu chung du de las 'bras bu mang po mngon par 'grub pa ste /
analyzed: rgyu chung du las zhes bya ba ni sa bon chung du btab pa las so // 'bras bu chen po 'grub pa zhes bya ba ni rgyu chung du de las 'bras bu mang po mngon par 'grub pa ste /
translated: From a small cause means from a small seed.🔽A great result is produced means that from that small cause a great result is produced.

original: chung du las 'bras bu chen po mngon par 'grub pas de'i phyir rgyu chung du las 'bras bu chen po 'byung ngo //
analyzed: chung du las 'bras bu chen po mngon par 'grub pas de'i phyir rgyu chung du las 'bras bu chen po 'byung ngo //
translated: Since a great result is produced from a small cause, therefore a great result arises from a small cause.

original: 'dra bar rjes su 'gro phyir yang //
analyzed: 'dra bar rjes su 'gro phyir yang //
translated: Because of the continuity of likeness

original: zhes bya ba ni sa bon ji lta bu btab pa de lta bu kho na'i 'bras bu mngon par 'grub pas de'i phyir de dang 'dra ba'i rgyud du ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni sa bon ji lta bu btab pa de lta bu kho na'i 'bras bu mngon par 'grub pas de'i phyir de dang 'dra ba'i rgyud du ste /
translated: means that a result is produced that is exactly like the seed that was sown. Therefore, it is in a continuum that is like that.

original: 'dra bar 'bras bu mngon par 'grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dra bar 'bras bu mngon par 'grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the effect is manifestly established as similar.

original: sa bon myu gu tha dad phyir //
analyzed: sa bon myu gu tha dad phyir //
translated: Because the seed and sprout are different,

original: sa bon rtag pa nyid ma yin //
analyzed: sa bon rtag pa nyid ma yin //
translated: The seed is not permanent.

original: chad par mi 'gyur gang gi phyir //
analyzed: chad par mi 'gyur gang gi phyir //
translated: Because there is no annihilation,

original: sa bon yod na myu gu ste //
analyzed: sa bon yod na myu gu ste //
translated: When the seed exists, the sprout exists.

original: sa bon 'dra ba 'grub pa'i phyir //
analyzed: sa bon 'dra ba 'grub pa'i phyir //
translated: Because the seed is established as similar to the seed,

original: de dang mi 'dra yang mi 'dod //
analyzed: de dang mi 'dra yang mi 'dod //
translated: It is not accepted as dissimilar.

original: myu gu 'bras bu la sogs pa //
analyzed: myu gu 'bras bu la sogs pa //
translated: The sprout and so on are the effect.

original: myu gu 'pho yang yod ma yin //
analyzed: myu gu 'pho yang yod ma yin //
translated: The sprout does not exist even when it has transitioned.

original: sa bon chung rab cig yod na //
analyzed: sa bon chung rab cig yod na //
translated: When a small seed exists,

original: sa bon nyid las 'byung 'gyur te //🔽de bas rgyu ni chung du las //
analyzed: sa bon nyid las 'byung 'gyur te // de bas rgyu ni chung du las //
translated: It arises from the seed itself.🔽Therefore, because a large effect arises

original: 'bras bu chen po skye phyir ro //
analyzed: 'bras bu chen po skye phyir ro //
translated: From a small cause.

original: sa bon s'a lu sogs btab la //
analyzed: sa bon s'a lu sogs btab la //
translated: When a seed of rice and so on is planted,

original: 'bras bu khre rgod la sogs min //
analyzed: 'bras bu khre rgod la sogs min //
translated: The effect is not millet and so on.

original: de nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir /
translated: For that reason,

original: myu gu sa bon ltar mi 'dod //
analyzed: myu gu sa bon ltar mi 'dod //
translated: The sprout is not accepted as being like the seed.

original: rgyu med myu gu skye ba'ang med //
analyzed: rgyu med myu gu skye ba'ang med //
translated: A sprout does not arise without a cause.

original: 'gag dang skye ba mgo mnyam ste //
analyzed: 'gag dang skye ba mgo mnyam ste //
translated: Arising and ceasing are equal,

original: srang mda'i mgo mjug mtho dman bzhin //🔽zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: srang mda'i mgo mjug mtho dman bzhin //🔽zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Like the high and low of the end and beginning of a scale.

original: de ltar na phyi rol gyi rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba kun brtags pa'i bdag nyid kyis ma bsags par blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar na phyi rol gyi rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba kun brtags pa'i bdag nyid kyis ma bsags par blta bar bya'o //
translated: Thus, external dependent origination should be seen as not accumulated in the sense of being imagined.

original: de bzhin nang gi 'ang rgyu dang ni //
analyzed: de bzhin nang gi 'ang rgyu dang ni //
translated: Likewise, the internal is accepted

original: rkyen gyi rnam pa gnyis su bzhed //
analyzed: rkyen gyi rnam pa gnyis su bzhed //
translated: in terms of two aspects: cause and condition.

original: de bzhin nang gi zhes bya ba ni /🔽phyi rol gyi rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba bzhin du rgyu dang rkyen rnam pa gnyis dang 'brel pa'i phyir tha dad pa rnam pa gnyis su @37b rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin nang gi zhes bya ba ni / phyi rol gyi rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba bzhin du rgyu dang rkyen rnam pa gnyis dang 'brel pa'i phyir tha dad pa rnam pa gnyis su @37b rtogs par bya'o //
translated: Likewise, the internal is accepted in terms of two aspects: cause and condition.🔽The internal should be understood as twofold, in terms of two aspects: cause and condition, because it is related to two aspects, like external dependent origination.

original: rgyu dang rkyen gyi rnam pa gnyis su zhes bya ba ni nang gi rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba rgyu dang 'brel pa dang / rkyen dang 'brel pas rnam pa gnyis su khong du chud par bya'o //
analyzed: rgyu dang rkyen gyi rnam pa gnyis su zhes bya ba ni nang gi rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba rgyu dang 'brel pa dang / rkyen dang 'brel pas rnam pa gnyis su khong du chud par bya'o //
translated: The internal dependent origination should be understood in terms of two aspects: the aspect of cause and the aspect of condition.

original: bzhed ces bya ba ni mngon par bzhed pa dang dgongs pa dang / mngon du bzhed pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: bzhed ces bya ba ni mngon par bzhed pa dang dgongs pa dang / mngon du bzhed pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Accepted means intended, considered, and accepted as such.

original: de la nang gi rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba rgyu dang 'brel pa ji ltar rtogs par bya zhe na /
analyzed: de la nang gi rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba rgyu dang 'brel pa ji ltar rtogs par bya zhe na /
translated: How should one understand the internal dependent origination that is related to its cause?🔽It is said:

original: smras pa / 'di'i rgyu dang po ma rig pa //
analyzed: smras pa / 'di'i rgyu dang po ma rig pa //
translated: Its first cause is ignorance,

original: tha ma 'chi yin go rims bzhin //
analyzed: tha ma 'chi yin go rims bzhin //

analyzed: de la thog mar ma rig pa bstan pa'i phyir dang por ma rig pa'o //

analyzed: tha mar 'chi ba'i yan lag bstan pa'i phyir tha ma 'chi ba'o //

analyzed: de dag gi bar gang yin pa de dag ni dbus su 'dod de /

original: de nyid kyi phyir mdo las /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir mdo las /

analyzed: ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis 'du byed rnams /

original: 'du byed kyi rkyen gyis rnam par shes pa /
analyzed: 'du byed kyi rkyen gyis rnam par shes pa /

original: rnam par shes pa'i rkyen gyis ming dang gzugs /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i rkyen gyis ming dang gzugs /

analyzed: ming dang gzugs kyi rkyen gyis skye mched drug / skye mched drug gi rkyen gyis reg pa / reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba /

original: tshor ba'i rkyen gyis sred pa /
analyzed: tshor ba'i rkyen gyis sred pa /

original: sred pa'i rkyen gyis len pa /

original: len pa'i rkyen gyis srid pa /
analyzed: len pa'i rkyen gyis srid pa /

original: srid pa'i rkyen gyis skye ba /
analyzed: srid pa'i rkyen gyis skye ba /

original: skye ba'i rkyen gyis rga shi dang / mya ngan dang / smre sngags 'don pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / yid mi bde ba dang / 'khrug pa rnams 'byung ste /

translated: Due to the condition of birth, there is old age and death, grief, lamentation, suffering, unhappiness, and strife.

analyzed: de ltar na sdug bsngal gyi phung po chen po 'ba' zhig po 'di 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes gsungs so //

analyzed: nyon mongs pa dang / las dang skye ba gzhan dbang gi bdag nyid 'di yang cha gsum gyis rnam par gzhag ste /

translated: The reality of the other-dependent with regard to birth has seven remaining members:

analyzed: rnam par shes pa dang / ming dang gzugs dang / skye mched drug dang / reg pa dang / tshor ba dang / skye ba dang / rga shi rnams so //
translated: consciousness, name-and-form, the six sense bases, contact, feeling, birth, and old age and death.

original: yang zhes @38a * //🔽bya ba'i sgras ni bsdu bar bya bar blta ste /
analyzed: yang zhes @38a * // bya ba'i sgras ni bsdu bar bya bar blta ste /
translated: The word “also”

analyzed: mya ngan dang / smre sngags 'don pa dang / yid mi bde ba dang / 'khrug pa la sogs pa dang / sdug pa dang bral ba dang / mi sdug pa dang phrad pa dang / 'dod pas phongs pa la sogs pa bsdu'o //
translated: should be understood to include sorrow, lamentation, pain, and unhappiness, as well as being separated from what is pleasant, encountering what is unpleasant, not obtaining what one desires, and so on.

analyzed: de ltar rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba yan lag bcu gnyis pa 'di ni ngo bo nyid gsum du rig par bya'o //
translated: Thus, this twelvefold dependent origination should be understood in terms of the three natures.

original: de yang byed pa po la sogs pa dang ngo bo nyid kyis bral bar shes par bya'o /
analyzed: de yang byed pa po la sogs pa dang ngo bo nyid kyis bral bar shes par bya'o /
translated: Moreover, it should be understood as being devoid of an agent and so forth.

original: // / s'a lu ljang pa'i mdo'i rgya cher bshad pa /🔽bam po gsum pa /
analyzed: // / s'a lu ljang pa'i mdo'i rgya cher bshad pa / bam po gsum pa /
translated: The Commentary on the Rice Seedling Sutra

original: gal te dang po ma rig med //
analyzed: gal te dang po ma rig med //
translated: If ignorance did not exist at the beginning,

original: tha ma 'chi ba 'byung mi 'gyur //🔽zhes bya ba la ;
analyzed: tha ma 'chi ba 'byung mi 'gyur // zhes bya ba la ;
translated: death would not occur at the end.

original: gal te dang po ma rig pa med ces bya ba ni /
analyzed: gal te dang po ma rig pa med ces bya ba ni /
translated: If ignorance did not exist at the beginning,

original: gal te ma rig pa med par gyur na /
analyzed: gal te ma rig pa med par gyur na /
translated: if ignorance did not occur,

original: 'du byed rnams mi 'byung ba nyid do //
analyzed: 'du byed rnams mi 'byung ba nyid do //
translated: formations would not occur.

original: de bzhin du gal te rga ba dang 'chi ba'i bar du med par gyur na mya ngan la sogs par 'jug par mi 'gyur ro //🔽de dag las gzhan bdag dang ni //
analyzed: de bzhin du gal te rga ba dang 'chi ba'i bar du med par gyur na mya ngan la sogs par 'jug par mi 'gyur ro // de dag las gzhan bdag dang ni //
translated: Similarly, if aging and death did not exist, grief and so on would not occur.

original: bdag gi zhes pa gang na'ang med ;🔽/ ces bya ba ni /
analyzed: bdag gi zhes pa gang na'ang med ;🔽/ ces bya ba ni /
translated: Apart from these, there is no self or selfhood anywhere.

original: de la ma rig pa yang 'di snyam du bdag gis 'du byed la sogs pa mngon par bsgrubs so snyam du mi sems pa nas rga shi'i bar du yang 'di snyam du bdag gis mya ngan la sogs pa mngon par bsgrubs so snyam du mi sems so //
analyzed: de la ma rig pa yang 'di snyam du bdag gis 'du byed la sogs pa mngon par bsgrubs so snyam du mi sems pa nas rga shi'i bar du yang 'di snyam du bdag gis mya ngan la sogs pa mngon par bsgrubs so snyam du mi sems so //
translated: Ignorance does not think, “I will actualize the formations.”🔽Up to old age and death do not think, “We will actualize sorrow and so on.”🔽The formations and so on do not think, “We are actualized by ignorance and so on.”

original: 'du byed la sogs pa yang 'di snyam du bdag cag ni ma rig pa la sogs pas mngon par bsgrubs so snyam du mi sems pa nas rga shi yang 'di snyam du bdag cag ni skye ba la sogs pas mngon par bsgrubs so snyam du mi sems pa'i
analyzed: 'du byed la sogs pa yang 'di snyam du bdag cag ni ma rig pa la sogs pas mngon par bsgrubs so snyam du mi sems pa nas rga shi yang 'di snyam du bdag cag ni skye ba la sogs pas mngon par bsgrubs so snyam du mi sems pa'i
translated: Up to old age and death do not think, “We are actualized by birth and so on.”

original: bar du'o // dang po ma rig byung na ni //
analyzed: bar du'o // dang po ma rig byung na ni //
translated: When the first, ignorance, occurs,

original: tha ma shi ba 'ang snang bar 'gyur //
analyzed: tha ma shi ba 'ang snang bar 'gyur //
translated: the last, death, will also appear.

original: zhes bya ba ni ma rig pa yod pa las 'du byed la sogs pa mngon par 'grub cing 'byung bar 'gyur bas na rga shi yod pa las mya ngan dang smre sngags 'don pa la sogs pa'i par mngon par 'grub cing 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni ma rig pa yod pa las 'du byed la sogs pa mngon par 'grub cing 'byung bar 'gyur bas na rga shi yod pa las mya ngan dang smre sngags 'don pa la sogs pa'i par mngon par 'grub cing 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Since formations, etc. are produced and originate due to the existence of ignorance, up to since old age and death are produced and originate due to the existence of birth, grief, lamentation, pain, dejection, and anguish are produced and originate due to the existence of old age and death.

original: de ltar 'di ni nang gi rgyu //
analyzed: de ltar 'di ni nang gi rgyu //
translated: Thus, this is the internal cause.

original: zhes bya ba ni de ltar na nang gi rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i rgyu dang 'brel par blta'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni de ltar na nang gi rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i rgyu dang 'brel par blta'o //
translated: Thus, the internal dependent origination should be viewed in terms of its connection with causes.

original: nang gi rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba rkyen dang 'grel par ji ltar ba lta zhe na /
analyzed: nang gi rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba rkyen dang 'grel par ji ltar ba lta zhe na /
translated: How should the internal dependent origination be viewed in terms of its connection with conditions?🔽It is said: Its conditions are of six kinds.

original: smras pa / 'di yi rkyen ni rnam pa drug /'di'i zhes bya ba ni nang gi'o //
analyzed: smras pa / 'di yi rkyen ni rnam pa drug /'di'i zhes bya ba ni nang gi'o //
translated: Its means the internal.

original: rkyen zhes bya ba ni tshogs pa'o //
analyzed: rkyen zhes bya ba ni tshogs pa'o //
translated: Conditions means a collection.

original: rnam pa drug ces bya ba ni rnam pa drug go //
analyzed: rnam pa drug ces bya ba ni rnam pa drug go //
translated: Of six kinds means of six types.

original: tha ma rnam shes thog ma sa //
analyzed: tha ma rnam shes thog ma sa //
translated: The last is consciousness, the first is ignorance.

original: nang gi rkyen du 'dod pa yin //
analyzed: nang gi rkyen du 'dod pa yin //
translated: These are held to be the internal conditions.

original: rnam par shes pa tha mar yongs su bstan pa'i @38b phyir tha ma rnam shes so //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa tha mar yongs su bstan pa'i @38b phyir tha ma rnam shes so //
translated: The last consciousness is the last consciousness.

original: thog ma ni sa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: thog ma ni sa zhes bya'o //
translated: The first is called earth.

original: de nyid kyi phyir mdo las /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir mdo las /
translated: Therefore, a sutra declares:

original: khams drug 'dus pa ste /
analyzed: khams drug 'dus pa ste /
translated: The six elements come together.

original: sa dang / chu dang / me dang / rlung dang / nam mkha' dang / rnam par shes pa la sogs pa ni nang gi rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba rkyen dang 'brel par blta'o zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: sa dang / chu dang / me dang / rlung dang / nam mkha' dang / rnam par shes pa la sogs pa ni nang gi rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba rkyen dang 'brel par blta'o zhes gsungs so //
translated: The internal dependent origination is to be seen in terms of the relation of conditions, such as earth, water, fire, wind, space, and consciousness.🔽Hardness, cohesion,

original: sra dang rjes su sdud pa dang // smin dang dbugs 'phel go 'byed nyid //
analyzed: sra dang rjes su sdud pa dang // smin dang dbugs 'phel go 'byed nyid //
translated: heat, and mobility are the internal elements.

original: ces bya ba ni de la nang gi sa'i khams gang zhe na /
analyzed: ces bya ba ni de la nang gi sa'i khams gang zhe na /
translated: What is the internal earth element?

analyzed: gang lus dang 'brel pa sra ba dang / rtsub pa dang / hrud hrud po dang / mkhrang par gyur pa dang / skra dang / spu dang / sen mo dang / so dang / rdul dang / dri ma dang / pags pa dang / sha dang /
translated: That which is connected with the body, hard, solid, and clung to, such as hair, body hair, nails, teeth, skin, flesh,

translated: The veins, bones, and so on, and whatever else there is in this body, all of that is included in the earth element.

original: rjes su sdud pa zhes bya ba ni sdud pa dang 'brel pa dang / mnyen pa dang / 'khyud pa dang / gong bur byed pa dang / gsher ba nyid dang / 'di lta ste /

translated: The water element is that which moistens, that which is connected, that which is supple, that which embraces, that which forms masses, that which is fluid, and that which is slippery.

original: mchi ma dang / rdul dang / mchil ma dang / snabs dang / zhag dang / rkang dang / khu chu dang / gcin dang / phyi sa dang / khrag dang / chu ser dang / klad pa dang / pho ba dang / long ka la sogs pa dang /

translated: It is tears, sweat, mucus, nasal discharge, synovial fluid, blood, lymph, urine, feces, semen, and brain, spinal cord, stomach, and intestines, and so on.

analyzed: gzhan yang lus 'di la de lta bu'i gsher ba'i rang bzhin yod pa ni chu'i khams zhes bya'o //

original: smin pa zhes bya ba ni smin par byed pa ste /
analyzed: smin pa zhes bya ba ni smin par byed pa ste /
translated: The fire element is that which digests.

original: smin pa dang / tshos pa dang / smin 'gyur dang / dro ba dang / me dang / gdung ba dang / tsha ba dang / lham pa dang / gang lus 'di'i nang na zos pa dang / 'thungs pa dang / 'chos pa rnams legs par bde bar 'jug par byed pa gzhan yang gang cung zad ci yang rung ste /
analyzed: smin pa dang / tshos pa dang / smin 'gyur dang / dro ba dang / me dang / gdung ba dang / tsha ba dang / lham pa dang / gang lus 'di'i nang na zos pa dang / 'thungs pa dang / 'chos pa rnams legs par bde bar 'jug par byed pa gzhan yang gang cung zad ci yang rung ste /
translated: The ripened, the cooked, the ripening, the warm, the fire, the burning, the heat, the boiling, and whatever else there is that is in this body, that is well digested, well consumed, well eaten, well drunk, well chewed, and well absorbed.

original: de lta bu de thams cad ni me'i khams zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de lta bu de thams cad ni me'i khams zhes bya'o //
translated: All of that is called the fire element.

original: dbugs zhes bya ba ni rlung gi khams te /
analyzed: dbugs zhes bya ba ni rlung gi khams te /
translated: The wind element is called the breath.

original: dbugs ni dbugs 'byung ba dang / dbugs rngub pa dang / tshig dang / smra ba dang / 'gro ba dang / 'ong ba dang / zhum pa dang 'phel ba zhes bya ba ni /

translated: The breath is the exhalation and inhalation of the breath, speech, conversation, going, coming, and the so-called expansion and contraction.

original: lus ni rgyas pa dang / skyed pa dang / g-yo ba dang / 'gul ba dang / ldeg pa dang / rgyas par gyur pa dang / 'phel ba dang / cham pa dang / lud pa dang / skyigs bu dang / sbrid pa dang / stod kyi rlung dang /
analyzed: lus ni rgyas pa dang / skyed pa dang / g-yo ba dang / 'gul ba dang / ldeg pa dang / rgyas par gyur pa dang / 'phel ba dang / cham pa dang / lud pa dang / skyigs bu dang / sbrid pa dang / stod kyi rlung dang /
translated: The body is filled, expanded, moved, shaken, agitated, extended, increased, swollen, and filled with phlegm, saliva, and mucus.

translated: Whatever there is of this kind in this body, all of that is collected together and

original: rlung gi khams zhes bya'o //

analyzed: kha'i bu ga dang / rna ba'i bu ga dang / sna'i bu ga dang / mig gi bu ga la sogs pa lus kyi nang gi sbubs 'di ni nam mkha'i khams zhes bya'o //

analyzed: shes dang gzugs kyi rjes 'jug pa //

analyzed: 'di rnams nang gi rkyen yin no // de la ming gi rjes su 'jug pa dang / gzugs kyi rjes su 'jug pa ni nang gi rnam par shes ba'i khams zhes bya'o //

translated: Name is the four non-physical aggregates: feeling, discernment, formation, and consciousness. Form is the first establishment of name-and-form that arises in dependence on the aggregates of the intermediate existence, which arise from the father’s semen and the mother’s blood.

translated: The four afflictions are ignorance of self, pride of self, view of self, and attachment to self. The collection of these four afflictions is called the afflicted mind.

original: khams rnams 'dus par gyur pa las //

original: skyes pa ma yin /

analyzed: bdag dang bdag gir rlom pa dang bral ba'i phyir ro //

analyzed: gzhan yang su'i yang ma yin no zhes bya ba ni dbang phyug la sogs pa'i byed pa po dang / bya ba dang las dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Moreover, it is not anyone’s at all because it is free from an agent such as Īśvara, action, and objects.

analyzed: de bzhin du chu dang / me dang / rlung dang / nam mkha' dang / rnam par shes pa'i khams kyang bdag ma yin /
translated: In the same way, the elements of water, fire, wind, space, and consciousness are not a self,

original: sems can ma yin /
analyzed: sems can ma yin /
translated: not a sentient being,

original: srog ma yin /
analyzed: srog ma yin /
translated: not a life-force,

original: skye ba po ma yin /🔽shed las skyes pa ma yin /
analyzed: skye ba po ma yin / shed las skyes pa ma yin /
translated: not a creature,🔽not a human,🔽not a man,

original: bud med ma yin /🔽skyes pa ma yin /
analyzed: bud med ma yin / skyes pa ma yin /
translated: not a woman,

original: ma ning ma yin /🔽nga ma yin /
analyzed: ma ning ma yin / nga ma yin /
translated: not a neuter,🔽not an “I,”

original: bdag ma yin te /
analyzed: bdag ma yin te /
translated: and not a self.

original: dbang phyug la sogs pa gzhan yang su'i yang ma yin no zhes shes par bya'o //
analyzed: dbang phyug la sogs pa gzhan yang su'i yang ma yin no zhes shes par bya'o //
translated: It is not the creation of any other being, such as a divine creator.

original: gang gcig ril sogs 'du shes pa //
analyzed: gang gcig ril sogs 'du shes pa //
translated: One who perceives the world as a whole,

original: de ni ma rig srid gsum sgrib //
analyzed: de ni ma rig srid gsum sgrib //
translated: is obscured by ignorance, which is the obscuration of the three realms.

original: de la ma rig pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la ma rig pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is ignorance?

original: smras pa / srid gsum sgrib pa zhes bya'o //🔽srid pa gsum ni srid gsum ste //
analyzed: smras pa / srid gsum sgrib pa zhes bya'o // srid pa gsum ni srid gsum ste //
translated: It is said to be the obscuration of the three realms.

original: 'dod pa'i srid pa dang ; gzugs kyi srid pa dang / gzugs med pa'i srid pa'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i srid pa dang ; gzugs kyi srid pa dang / gzugs med pa'i srid pa'o //
translated: The three realms are the desire realm, the form realm, and the formless realm.

original: de dag kyang sems can dang / snod kyi 'jig rten gyi tha snyad kyis rnam pa gnyis su gzhag go //
analyzed: de dag kyang sems can dang / snod kyi 'jig rten gyi tha snyad kyis rnam pa gnyis su gzhag go //
translated: They are also established as two types by the conventions of the world of sentient beings and the world of their environment.

original: yang khams dang / 'gro ba dang / skye gnas kyi bye brag gis ni rig pa gsum du gzhag go //
analyzed: yang khams dang / 'gro ba dang / skye gnas kyi bye brag gis ni rig pa gsum du gzhag go //
translated: Moreover, they are established as three realms by the distinctions of realm, destiny, and birth.

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How is that?🔽It is said:

original: smras pa / de la 'dod @40a * //
analyzed: smras pa / de la 'dod @40a * //
translated: The desire realm is the realm of desire.

original: pa'i khams gnas ris sum cu rtsa drug gi rnam par rig pa snang ba thun mong dang thun mong ma yin pa'i ngo bo nyid la ril po gcig par rtog cing 'du shes pas 'dzin pa'i phyir ma rig pa zhes brjod do //

translated: The consciousness that appears as the thirty-six types of gods and humans is apprehended as a single whole by the conception that it is of the nature of common and uncommon appearances. Therefore, it is called ignorance.🔽🔽

analyzed: de la gnas sum cu rtsa drug ni tsha ba'i rang bzhin gyi dmyal ba chen po brgyad dang / grang ba'i rang bzhin gyi dmyal ba chen po brgyad de /
translated: The thirty-six abodes of the desire realm are the eight great hells of the nature of heat and the eight great hells of the nature of cold.

original: yang sos dang / thig nag dang / bsdus 'jom dang / ngu 'bod dang / ngu 'bod chen po dang / tsha ba dang / rab tu tsha ba dang / mnar med pa zhes bya ba tsha ba'i dmyal ba brgyad dang / aa chu zer ba dang /
analyzed: yang sos dang / thig nag dang / bsdus 'jom dang / ngu 'bod dang / ngu 'bod chen po dang / tsha ba dang / rab tu tsha ba dang / mnar med pa zhes bya ba tsha ba'i dmyal ba brgyad dang / aa chu zer ba dang /
