original: de nyid kyi phyir mdo las /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir mdo las /
translated: Therefore, a sutra declares:

original: khams drug po 'di dag nyid la gang gcig pur 'du shes pa dang / ril por 'du shes pa dang / rtag par 'du shes pa dang / ther zug tu 'du shes pa dang / bde bar 'du shes pa dang / bdag tu 'du shes pa dang /
analyzed: khams drug po 'di dag nyid la gang gcig pur 'du shes pa dang / ril por 'du shes pa dang / rtag par 'du shes pa dang / ther zug tu 'du shes pa dang / bde bar 'du shes pa dang / bdag tu 'du shes pa dang /
translated: In these six elements, the notion of a single entity, the notion of a whole, the notion of permanence, the notion of stability, the notion of pleasure, the notion of self,

original: sems can du 'du shes pa dang / srog tu 'du shes pa dang / skyes bur 'du shes pa dang / gang zag tu 'du shes pa dang / shed las skyes su 'du shes pa dang / shed bur 'du shes pa dang / nga zhes bya ba dang /
analyzed: sems can du 'du shes pa dang / srog tu 'du shes pa dang / skyes bur 'du shes pa dang / gang zag tu 'du shes pa dang / shed las skyes su 'du shes pa dang / shed bur 'du shes pa dang / nga zhes bya ba dang /
translated: the notion of a sentient being, the notion of a life-force, the notion of a human being, the notion of an individual, the notion of a person, the notion of a human, the notion of “I,”

original: bdag gi zhes bya bar 'du shes pa ste /
analyzed: bdag gi zhes bya bar 'du shes pa ste /
translated: and the notion of “mine” are all false.

original: 'di lta bu la sogs pa mi shes pa sna tshogs pa 'di ni ma rig pa zhes bya'o zhes bstan to //🔽de la sa'i khams ni rdzas brgyad yin pa'i phyir gcig pur 'du shes pa mi rung ngo //
analyzed: 'di lta bu la sogs pa mi shes pa sna tshogs pa 'di ni ma rig pa zhes bya'o zhes bstan to // de la sa'i khams ni rdzas brgyad yin pa'i phyir gcig pur 'du shes pa mi rung ngo //
translated: This kind of false notion is called ignorance.

original: rdul phra mo @42a * //
analyzed: rdul phra mo @42a * //
translated: In this regard, since the earth element is composed of eight substances, the notion of a single entity is not appropriate.🔽The notion of a whole is also not appropriate, because the earth element is composed of atoms.

original: rnams ni phan tshun bsags pa'i bdag nyid ma yin pa'i phyir ril por 'dzin par mi rung ngo //
analyzed: rnams ni phan tshun bsags pa'i bdag nyid ma yin pa'i phyir ril por 'dzin par mi rung ngo //
translated: Since they are not a collection of each other, it is not suitable to apprehend them as a whole.

original: rgyu rkyen 'brel par 'jug pa'i phyir rtag par 'du shes par mi rung ngo //
analyzed: rgyu rkyen 'brel par 'jug pa'i phyir rtag par 'du shes par mi rung ngo //
translated: Since they are a connection of causes and conditions, it is not suitable to apprehend them as permanent.

original: yun ring du mi gnas pa'i phyir ther zug tu 'du shes pa med do //
analyzed: yun ring du mi gnas pa'i phyir ther zug tu 'du shes pa med do //
translated: Since they do not remain for a long time, there is no conception of permanence.

original: skyes ma thag tu 'jig pa'i phyir brtan par 'du shes pa med do //
analyzed: skyes ma thag tu 'jig pa'i phyir brtan par 'du shes pa med do //
translated: Since they disintegrate as soon as they arise, there is no conception of stability.

original: 'du byed dang 'gyur ba'i sdug bsngal dang ldan pa'i phyir bde bar 'du shes pa med do //
analyzed: 'du byed dang 'gyur ba'i sdug bsngal dang ldan pa'i phyir bde bar 'du shes pa med do //
translated: Since they are endowed with the suffering of formations and change, there is no conception of pleasure.

original: mi gtsang ba'i rdzas rnam pa sum cu rtsa drug 'dus pa'i phyir gtsang bar 'du shes pa med do //
analyzed: mi gtsang ba'i rdzas rnam pa sum cu rtsa drug 'dus pa'i phyir gtsang bar 'du shes pa med do //
translated: Since they are a collection of thirty-six types of impure substances, there is no conception of purity.

original: 'byung ba dang / 'byung ba las gyur pa'i rdzas du ma yin pa'i phyir bdag tu 'du shes pa med do //
analyzed: 'byung ba dang / 'byung ba las gyur pa'i rdzas du ma yin pa'i phyir bdag tu 'du shes pa med do //
translated: Since they are many substances of the elements and the derivatives of the elements, there is no conception of self.

original: sems dang sems las byung ba'i byin gyis brlabs pa'i phyir sems can du 'du shes pa med do //
analyzed: sems dang sems las byung ba'i byin gyis brlabs pa'i phyir sems can du 'du shes pa med do //
translated: Since they are blessed by mind and mental factors, there is no conception of sentient beings.

original: bya ba med pa'i phyir srog tu 'du shes pa med do //
analyzed: bya ba med pa'i phyir srog tu 'du shes pa med do //
translated: Because there is no action, there is no notion of life.

original: yang 'gro ba dang 'ong ba dang bral ba'i phyir gang zag tu 'du shes pa med do //🔽nga dang nga yir rlom sems dang bral ba'i phyir shed las skyes dang / shed bur 'du shes pa med do //
analyzed: yang 'gro ba dang 'ong ba dang bral ba'i phyir gang zag tu 'du shes pa med do // nga dang nga yir rlom sems dang bral ba'i phyir shed las skyes dang / shed bur 'du shes pa med do //
translated: Because there is no coming or going, there is no notion of a person.🔽Because there is no conceit of “I” and “mine,” there is no notion of a human being or of a creature.

original: nga zhes bya ba dang / bdag gi zhes bya ba la sogs pa dang bral ba'i phyir shed las skyes la sogs par 'du shes pa mi rigs so //
analyzed: nga zhes bya ba dang / bdag gi zhes bya ba la sogs pa dang bral ba'i phyir shed las skyes la sogs par 'du shes pa mi rigs so //
translated: Since there is no “I” and “mine,” etc., it is not reasonable to have the notion of a human being, etc.

original: de ltar na khams drug po mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i rang gi ngo bo de dag mi shes pa gang yin pa 'di ni ma rig pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar na khams drug po mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i rang gi ngo bo de dag mi shes pa gang yin pa 'di ni ma rig pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Thus, the non-understanding of the nature of the six elements as impermanent, etc., is called ignorance.

original: de la ma rig pa zhes bya ba ni rig pa ma yin pas ma rig pa'o //
analyzed: de la ma rig pa zhes bya ba ni rig pa ma yin pas ma rig pa'o //
translated: Here, ignorance is not understanding, and so it is ignorance.

original: rig pa med pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: rig pa med pa ni ma yin te /
translated: It is not the absence of understanding,

original: med pa ni ci yang ma yin no //
analyzed: med pa ni ci yang ma yin no //
translated: for the absence of something is nothing at all.

original: ma rig pa rig pa las gzhan du rig pa gzhan nyid yin no //
analyzed: ma rig pa rig pa las gzhan du rig pa gzhan nyid yin no //
translated: Ignorance is not a different understanding from understanding.

original: de bas na med pa dgag pa yang ma yin /
analyzed: de bas na med pa dgag pa yang ma yin /
translated: Therefore, it is not a negation of the absence of something.

original: gzhan nyid kyang ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan nyid kyang ma yin no //
translated: It is not different.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: What is it?

original: 'gal ba yin te /
analyzed: 'gal ba yin te /
translated: It is contradictory.

original: ma rig pa ni ma rig pa ma yin pa /
analyzed: ma rig pa ni ma rig pa ma yin pa /
translated: Ignorance is not non-ignorance.

original: rig pa'i chos dang 'gal ba la ma rig pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rig pa'i chos dang 'gal ba la ma rig pa zhes bya'o //
translated: That which is contradictory to the Dharma of knowledge is called ignorance.

original: gzhan 'phrul dbang byed kyi lha de'i gong yan chad gnas bcu bdun gyi rnam pa'i rnam par rig pa snang ba ni gzugs kyi khams so //
analyzed: gzhan 'phrul dbang byed kyi lha de'i gong yan chad gnas bcu bdun gyi rnam pa'i rnam par rig pa snang ba ni gzugs kyi khams so //
translated: The appearance of the consciousness of the seventeen levels above the gods who control others' emanations is the form realm.

original: de 'byung ba ni sems can dang / snod kyi 'jig rten gyi ngo bo thun mong dang thun mong ma yin pa'i bye brag rnam par rtog pa'i dbang gis byung ngo ;🔽/ gnas dag ni bsam gtan bzhi bsgom pa rnam pa gsum dang ldan pas tshangs ris la sogs pa bcu gnyis dang / bsam gtan bzhi pa spel mar bsgom pa dang ldan pas /
analyzed: de 'byung ba ni sems can dang / snod kyi 'jig rten gyi ngo bo thun mong dang thun mong ma yin pa'i bye brag rnam par rtog pa'i dbang gis byung ngo ; / gnas dag ni bsam gtan bzhi bsgom pa rnam pa gsum dang ldan pas tshangs ris la sogs pa bcu gnyis dang / bsam gtan bzhi pa spel mar bsgom pa dang ldan pas /
translated: Its origination is from the power of conceptualization, the common and uncommon distinctions of the nature of the world of sentient beings and the world of the environment.

original: gnas gtsang ma'i gnas lnga'o //
analyzed: gnas gtsang ma'i gnas lnga'o //
translated: The levels are the twelve, such as the Brahmakayikas, attained through the three types of cultivation of the four concentrations, and the five pure abodes attained through the cultivation of the fourth concentration in alternation.

original: de la dang po ni tshangs ris dang / tshangs pa'i mdun na 'don dang / tshangs pa chen po'o//
analyzed: de la dang po ni tshangs ris dang / tshangs pa'i mdun na 'don dang / tshangs pa chen po'o//
translated: The first is the Brahmakayikas, Brahmapurohitas, and Mahabrahmans.

original: @42b gnyis pa ni 'od chung dang / tshad med 'od dang / 'od gsal lo //
analyzed: @42b gnyis pa ni 'od chung dang / tshad med 'od dang / 'od gsal lo //
translated: The second is the Parittabhas, Apramanabhas, and Abhasvaras.

original: gsum pa ni dge chung dang / tshad med dge dang / dge rgyas so //
analyzed: gsum pa ni dge chung dang / tshad med dge dang / dge rgyas so //
translated: The third is the Parittasubhas, Apramanasubhas, and Subhakrisnas.

original: bzhi pa ni sprin med dang / bsod nams skyes dang / 'bras bu che'o //
analyzed: bzhi pa ni sprin med dang / bsod nams skyes dang / 'bras bu che'o //
translated: The fourth is the Anabhrakas, Punyaprasavas, and Brhatphalas.

original: gnas gtsang ma'i ni mi che ba dang / mi gdung ba dang / shin tu mthong dang / gya nom snang dang / 'og min no //
analyzed: gnas gtsang ma'i ni mi che ba dang / mi gdung ba dang / shin tu mthong dang / gya nom snang dang / 'og min no //
translated: The Pure Abodes are the Avrihas, Atapa, Sudris, Sudarsana, and Akanistha.

original: bsam gtan bzhi'i sa rtog pa dang bcas pa dang / rtog pa med pa dang / bde ba dang / btang snyoms dang / mtshungs par ldan pa dang / bsam gtan khyad par can dang / mi lcogs pa med pa'i sa 'di dag gang mi shes pa dang /
analyzed: bsam gtan bzhi'i sa rtog pa dang bcas pa dang / rtog pa med pa dang / bde ba dang / btang snyoms dang / mtshungs par ldan pa dang / bsam gtan khyad par can dang / mi lcogs pa med pa'i sa 'di dag gang mi shes pa dang /
translated: The four absorptions are with investigation and analysis, without investigation but with analysis, with pleasure, with equanimity, and associated with the special absorption and the stage of unrestricted access concentration.

original: ma mthong ba dang / mngon par ma rtogs pa 'di yang ma rig pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: ma mthong ba dang / mngon par ma rtogs pa 'di yang ma rig pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Not knowing, not seeing, and not penetrating these is also called ignorance.

original: gang yang ming tsam gyi 'du shes snang ba'i rnam pa'i rnam par rig pa'i rnam par rtog pa las byung ba gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bzhi po nam mkha' dang / rnam shes dang ci yang med pa dang / 'du shes med 'du shes med mi na skye mched rnams gang mi shes pa dang /
analyzed: gang yang ming tsam gyi 'du shes snang ba'i rnam pa'i rnam par rig pa'i rnam par rtog pa las byung ba gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bzhi po nam mkha' dang / rnam shes dang ci yang med pa dang / 'du shes med 'du shes med mi na skye mched rnams gang mi shes pa dang /
translated: The four formless meditative attainments—the base of infinite space, the base of infinite consciousness, the base of nothingness, and the base of neither perception nor nonperception—that arise from the conceptual thoughts of the cognition that perceives the aspects of the mere appearance of the conception of names, are not known,

original: mngon par ma rtogs pa dang / ma mthong ba 'di yang ma rig pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: mngon par ma rtogs pa dang / ma mthong ba 'di yang ma rig pa zhes bya'o //
translated: not realized, and not seen. This is also called ignorance.

original: de nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir /
translated: For this reason,

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis /
translated: the Bhagavān said:

original: bsam gtan bzhi dang mi lcogs med //🔽khyad par can gyis rnams dang // gzugs med snyoms par 'jug pa yi //
analyzed: bsam gtan bzhi dang mi lcogs med // khyad par can gyis rnams dang // gzugs med snyoms par 'jug pa yi //
translated: The four meditative concentrations, the base of infinite space,🔽the base of infinite consciousness,🔽the base of nothingness, and the base of neither perception nor nonperception,

original: 'du shes tha dad bzhi rnams dang // rnam dag rnams kyi sa bzhi dang // sa bcu bstan pa'i bdag nyid rnams //
analyzed: 'du shes tha dad bzhi rnams dang // rnam dag rnams kyi sa bzhi dang // sa bcu bstan pa'i bdag nyid rnams //
translated: the four levels of pure abodes, and the ten levels,

original: dbang phyug chen po thob pa'i gnas //
analyzed: dbang phyug chen po thob pa'i gnas //
translated: are the abodes of attaining maheśvara.

original: de ni khams gsum ma gtogs pa //
analyzed: de ni khams gsum ma gtogs pa //
translated: They are not included in the three realms.

original: rang sems rnal 'byor rnal 'byor dbang //
analyzed: rang sems rnal 'byor rnal 'byor dbang //
translated: The yoga of one’s mind is the lord of yoga.

original: rnam par dag pa 'byung ba'i sa //
analyzed: rnam par dag pa 'byung ba'i sa //
translated: The stage of the arising of purity

original: ye shes ting nge 'dzin dang gzugs //🔽dbang dang so sor rig pa can //
analyzed: ye shes ting nge 'dzin dang gzugs // dbang dang so sor rig pa can //
translated: is the knowledge, meditative concentration, and form

original: zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: zhes gsungs te /
translated: of the one who is powerful and has discernment.

original: de la yang gang nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i mi shes pa dang / ma mthong ba dang / mngon par ma rtogs pa dang / khong du ma chud pa bsgom pa'i lam gyi ye shes skye ba la gegs byed pa de yang ma rig pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de la yang gang nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i mi shes pa dang / ma mthong ba dang / mngon par ma rtogs pa dang / khong du ma chud pa bsgom pa'i lam gyi ye shes skye ba la gegs byed pa de yang ma rig pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Therein, that which is not afflicted ignorance, that which is not seeing, that which is not clear realization, that which is not understanding, and that which obstructs the arising of the knowledge of the path of cultivation is also called ignorance.

original: de lta bas na ma rig pa'i mun pa'i rab rib kyi ling thog gi sa mig bsgribs pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de lta bas na ma rig pa'i mun pa'i rab rib kyi ling thog gi sa mig bsgribs pa'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, because the eyes are covered by the cataracts of the darkness of ignorance,

original: yul rnams la gzugs dang / sgra dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg bya dang / chos kyi rnam pa'i rnam par rig pa /
analyzed: yul rnams la gzugs dang / sgra dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg bya dang / chos kyi rnam pa'i rnam par rig pa /
translated: the consciousnesses of form, sound, smell, taste, touch, and mental objects

original: phyin ci log gi rnam par rtog pa'i bag chags snang ba nyid kyis rtag pa dang / bdag dang / bde ba dang / gtsang ba la sogs par phyin ci @43a * //
analyzed: phyin ci log gi rnam par rtog pa'i bag chags snang ba nyid kyis rtag pa dang / bdag dang / bde ba dang / gtsang ba la sogs par phyin ci @43a * //
translated: appear as the habitual notions of error, as permanence, self, happiness, purity, etc.,

original: log pas 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang gti mug rgyas pa'i phyir 'dod chags skyes pa'i las kyang mngon par 'du byed do //🔽'dod pa la gegs byed pa dang ldan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: log pas 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang gti mug rgyas pa'i phyir 'dod chags skyes pa'i las kyang mngon par 'du byed do // 'dod pa la gegs byed pa dang ldan pa'i phyir /
translated: One also performs actions born of attachment, because of the increase of perverse attachment, aversion and delusion.

original: zhe sdang las skyes pa'i las kyang mngon par 'du byed do //
analyzed: zhe sdang las skyes pa'i las kyang mngon par 'du byed do //
translated: One also performs actions born of aversion, because of the obstruction of desire.

original: lam ma yin pa la lam du 'du shes pa dang ma dag pa la dag par 'du shes pa dang / grol ba ma yin pa la grol bar 'du shes pa'i phyir gti mug las skyes pa yang mngon par 'du byed do //
analyzed: lam ma yin pa la lam du 'du shes pa dang ma dag pa la dag par 'du shes pa dang / grol ba ma yin pa la grol bar 'du shes pa'i phyir gti mug las skyes pa yang mngon par 'du byed do //
translated: One also performs actions born of delusion, because of the notion of a path in what is not a path, the notion of purity in what is impure, and the notion of liberation in what is not liberation.

original: de gnyis las bzlog pa nyid kyis mi g-yo ba'i las kyang mngon par 'du byed do //
analyzed: de gnyis las bzlog pa nyid kyis mi g-yo ba'i las kyang mngon par 'du byed do //
translated: One also performs actions that are unshakable, because of the opposite of those two.

original: rkyen de dang / gzhi des ma rig par chags pa dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug dang / nga rgyal dang / lta ba dang / the tshom dang / phrag dog dang / ser sna'i rjes su song ba'i phyir lus kyi las mi dge ba bdag dang shes pa yongs su bskyab pa'i ched du srog gcod pa dang /
analyzed: rkyen de dang / gzhi des ma rig par chags pa dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug dang / nga rgyal dang / lta ba dang / the tshom dang / phrag dog dang / ser sna'i rjes su song ba'i phyir lus kyi las mi dge ba bdag dang shes pa yongs su bskyab pa'i ched du srog gcod pa dang /
translated: Due to that condition and that basis, because of being influenced by ignorance, attachment, aversion, confusion, pride, views, doubt, jealousy, and miserliness, for the sake of protecting oneself and one's possessions, one creates the unwholesome physical karma of killing,

original: ma byin par len pa dang / 'dod pas log par g-yem pa dang / myos pa'i rgyu chang 'thung pa gzhan du mi 'dod pa'i rnam par smin pa mngon par 'grub pa yang mngon par 'du byed do //
analyzed: ma byin par len pa dang / 'dod pas log par g-yem pa dang / myos pa'i rgyu chang 'thung pa gzhan du mi 'dod pa'i rnam par smin pa mngon par 'grub pa yang mngon par 'du byed do //
translated: taking what is not given, engaging in sexual misconduct, and drinking alcohol that causes intoxication, which results in undesirable ripening.

original: ngag gi brdzun dang / phra ma dang / tshig rtsub po dang / don med par smras pa mi 'dod pa'i rnam par smin pa mngon par 'grub pa yang mngon par 'du byed do //
analyzed: ngag gi brdzun dang / phra ma dang / tshig rtsub po dang / don med par smras pa mi 'dod pa'i rnam par smin pa mngon par 'grub pa yang mngon par 'du byed do //
translated: One also creates the unwholesome verbal karma of lying, divisive speech, harsh speech, and idle chatter, which results in undesirable ripening.

original: yid kyi las brnab sems dang / gnod sems dang ; log par lta ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa yang mngon par 'du byed do //
analyzed: yid kyi las brnab sems dang / gnod sems dang ; log par lta ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa yang mngon par 'du byed do //
translated: The mental action is the volition associated with covetousness, malice, and wrong views.

original: lus dang / ngag dang / yid kyi nyes par spyod pa'i chos yang dag par blangs pa'i rgyus sems can dmyal ba dang / yi dags dang / dud 'gro dang / lha dang / mi dang / lha ma yin rnams su skye bar 'gyur ro //🔽de nyid kyi phyir mi shes pa'i yul 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang gti mug mngon du byed //
analyzed: lus dang / ngag dang / yid kyi nyes par spyod pa'i chos yang dag par blangs pa'i rgyus sems can dmyal ba dang / yi dags dang / dud 'gro dang / lha dang / mi dang / lha ma yin rnams su skye bar 'gyur ro // de nyid kyi phyir mi shes pa'i yul 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang gti mug mngon du byed //
translated: Due to the cause of taking up the Dharma of bad conduct of body, speech, and mind, one is born among hell beings, hungry ghosts, animals, gods, humans, and demigods.🔽Therefore, it is said:

original: ces bya ba smos te /
analyzed: ces bya ba smos te /
translated: The object of ignorance is the manifestation of desire, hatred, and delusion.

original: de la mi shes pas zhes bya ba ni ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis 'du byed kyi dngos po mngon par 'du byed pas lhag par bsgom pa'i 'du byed kyi dngos po so sor rnam par rig pa'i ngo bo'i rnam par shes pa mngon par 'grub bo //
analyzed: de la mi shes pas zhes bya ba ni ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis 'du byed kyi dngos po mngon par 'du byed pas lhag par bsgom pa'i 'du byed kyi dngos po so sor rnam par rig pa'i ngo bo'i rnam par shes pa mngon par 'grub bo //
translated: Therein, due to the condition of ignorance, the entity of formation is formed. By the entity of formation that is cultivated in excess, consciousness is accomplished, having the nature of the individual cognition.

original: de nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir /
translated: Therefore, it is said:

original: de las 'du byed dngos po ni //
analyzed: de las 'du byed dngos po ni //
translated: From that, the entity of formation.

original: rnam par rig pa'i rnam shes 'byung //🔽zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: rnam par rig pa'i rnam shes 'byung // zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: The consciousness that is the representation arises.

original: de las zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de las zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Here, “from that” means

original: 'du byed la brten nas so //
analyzed: 'du byed la brten nas so //
translated: in dependence on the formative forces.🔽“The thing” is the representation.

original: dngos po ni rnam par rig pa'i zhes bya ba ni rnam par rig par byed pas rnam par rig pa ste /
analyzed: dngos po ni rnam par rig pa'i zhes bya ba ni rnam par rig par byed pas rnam par rig pa ste /
translated: The representation is that which represents, i.e., consciousness.

original: rnam par shes pa la @43b las kyi bag chags 'jog pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //🔽rnam shes lhan cig 'byung ba ni //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa la @43b las kyi bag chags 'jog pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go // rnam shes lhan cig 'byung ba ni //
translated: The meaning is that the latent impressions of action are deposited in consciousness.

original: gzugs can ma yin phung po bzhi //🔽zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: gzugs can ma yin phung po bzhi // zhes bya ba la /
translated: The co-arising of consciousness is the four aggregates that are not form.

original: rnam shes lhan cig 'byung ba zhes bya ba ni rnam par shes pa'i rgyu las byung ba'o //🔽gzugs can ma yin phung po bzhi //
analyzed: rnam shes lhan cig 'byung ba zhes bya ba ni rnam par shes pa'i rgyu las byung ba'o // gzugs can ma yin phung po bzhi //
translated: Here, “the co-arising of consciousness” means that which arises from the cause of consciousness.

original: zhes bya ba ni rnam par shes pa'i phung po bzhi ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni rnam par shes pa'i phung po bzhi ste /
translated: “The four aggregates that are not form” are the four aggregates that are not form, i.e.,

original: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba rnams so //
analyzed: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba rnams so //
translated: feeling, conceptualization, the formative forces, and consciousness.

original: gzugs can ma yin zhes bya ba ni 'byung ba dang 'byung ba las gyur pa bsags pa'i rnam pa dang bral ba'i phyir yin gyi /
analyzed: gzugs can ma yin zhes bya ba ni 'byung ba dang 'byung ba las gyur pa bsags pa'i rnam pa dang bral ba'i phyir yin gyi /
translated: The phrase “not having form” means that it is devoid of the aspect of form that is composed of the primary elements and the derivative form.

original: rtag pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rtag pa ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not that it is permanent.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: What is it, then?

original: sems dang sems las byung ba'i ngo bo dag yin no //
analyzed: sems dang sems las byung ba'i ngo bo dag yin no //
translated: It is the nature of mind and the mental factors.

original: phung po nyid ni rdzas du ma'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phung po nyid ni rdzas du ma'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The aggregates are not the self because they are multiple substances.

original: gzugs ni khams bzhi po pha ma'i khu chu dang / khrag las byung ba sa dang / chu dang / me dang / rlung gi khams te /
analyzed: gzugs ni khams bzhi po pha ma'i khu chu dang / khrag las byung ba sa dang / chu dang / me dang / rlung gi khams te /
translated: Form is the four primary elements that arise from the father’s semen and the mother’s blood, namely, the earth element, the water element, the fire element, and the wind element.

original: de dag bsdus nas rnam par shes pa'i rkyen gyis ming dang gzugs zhes bya'o //🔽ming dang gzugs la brten nas ni //
analyzed: de dag bsdus nas rnam par shes pa'i rkyen gyis ming dang gzugs zhes bya'o // ming dang gzugs la brten nas ni //
translated: These are combined and called name-and-form on the basis of consciousness.

original: dbang po skye mched 'byung bar 'gyur //🔽zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: dbang po skye mched 'byung bar 'gyur //🔽zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Name-and-form is the condition for the arising of the sense faculties and the sense bases.🔽The sense faculties and the sense bases are the condition for contact.

original: gang sngon dbang po la sred pa dang bcas pa'i bag chags ming dang gzugs la bzhag pa'i ming dang gzugs des rkyen byas nas mig la sogs pa'i dbang po drug mngon par 'grub pas dbang po skye mched drug 'byung bar 'gyur zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gang sngon dbang po la sred pa dang bcas pa'i bag chags ming dang gzugs la bzhag pa'i ming dang gzugs des rkyen byas nas mig la sogs pa'i dbang po drug mngon par 'grub pas dbang po skye mched drug 'byung bar 'gyur zhes bya'o //
translated: The six sense-spheres arise from the condition of name-and-form, which is the name-and-form in which the latent tendencies of craving for the sense-faculties are deposited.

original: dbang po skye mched sgo drug ni rnam par shes pa drug gi rten du gyur pa ste /
analyzed: dbang po skye mched sgo drug ni rnam par shes pa drug gi rten du gyur pa ste /
translated: The six sense-spheres are the six sense-spheres of the sense-faculties, which are the basis of the six consciousnesses.

original: gzugs la sogs pa'i yul dmigs pa'i rnam par rig pa snang ba 'dzin pa'i rang gi ngo bo rnams mngon par bsgrubs pas bcom ldan 'das kyis ming dang gzugs la brten pa'i dbang po rnams ni skye mched drug go zhes gsungs so //🔽yul dang dbang po rnam par shes //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa'i yul dmigs pa'i rnam par rig pa snang ba 'dzin pa'i rang gi ngo bo rnams mngon par bsgrubs pas bcom ldan 'das kyis ming dang gzugs la brten pa'i dbang po rnams ni skye mched drug go zhes gsungs so // yul dang dbang po rnam par shes //
translated: The Blessed One said that the sense-faculties based on name-and-form are the six sense-spheres, because they establish the appearances of the representations that apprehend the objects such as form.

original: 'dus pa las ni reg pa 'byung //
analyzed: 'dus pa las ni reg pa 'byung //
translated: Contact arises from the union of the object, sense-faculty, and consciousness.

original: zhes bya ba ni dbang po skye mched drug po rkyen du byas nas yul la dbang po dang / rnam par shes pa 'dus pa'i phyir reg pa ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni dbang po skye mched drug po rkyen du byas nas yul la dbang po dang / rnam par shes pa 'dus pa'i phyir reg pa ste /
translated: Contact is the coming together of the sense faculty, the consciousness, and the object.

original: dbang po dang rnam par shes pa dag gzugs la sogs pa'i yul rnams la reg pa lta bur bar ma chod nyid du 'jug ste /
analyzed: dbang po dang rnam par shes pa dag gzugs la sogs pa'i yul rnams la reg pa lta bur bar ma chod nyid du 'jug ste /
translated: Contact is like the sense faculty and consciousness touching the object such as form, because they engage without obstruction.

original: 'di la reg pa ni 'ga' yang med do //
analyzed: 'di la reg pa ni 'ga' yang med do //
translated: There is no contact in the sense of touching.

original: bsags pa ma yin pa rnam par shes pa lnga ni tshogs bsags pa yul dang / dbang po rnams dang lhan cig gcig tu 'gyur du 'ong bas reg pa lta bu yin gyi reg pa ni ma yin no @44a * //
analyzed: bsags pa ma yin pa rnam par shes pa lnga ni tshogs bsags pa yul dang / dbang po rnams dang lhan cig gcig tu 'gyur du 'ong bas reg pa lta bu yin gyi reg pa ni ma yin no @44a * //
translated: The five non-accumulative consciousnesses are like contact because they are not accumulated, but they are not contact, because they are not a collection of sense faculty, object, and consciousness.

original: zhes bya'o // de nyid kyi phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang /
analyzed: zhes bya'o // de nyid kyi phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang /
translated: For this reason, the Bhagavān also said:

original: chos gsum 'dus pa ni reg pa'o zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: chos gsum 'dus pa ni reg pa'o zhes gsungs te /
translated: The coming together of three things is contact.

original: dmigs pa snang ba'i rnam par rig pa skye ba'o //
analyzed: dmigs pa snang ba'i rnam par rig pa skye ba'o //
translated: The arising of the representation of the appearance of the object.

original: de bzhin du reg pa'i ro myang ba la 'chums pa la /
analyzed: de bzhin du reg pa'i ro myang ba la 'chums pa la /
translated: Similarly, one who is attached to the taste of contact

original: reg pa'i tshogs drug la brten te tshor ba'i tshogs drug skye'o //
analyzed: reg pa'i tshogs drug la brten te tshor ba'i tshogs drug skye'o //
translated: The six collections of feeling arise in dependence on the six collections of contact.

original: de nyid kyi phyir /🔽reg byung tshor bar shes bya ste //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir / reg byung tshor bar shes bya ste //
translated: Therefore, it is said:

original: zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: “Feeling should be understood as arising from contact.”

original: tshor ba ni reg pas bskyed pa ste /
analyzed: tshor ba ni reg pas bskyed pa ste /
translated: Feeling is generated by contact.

original: reg pa'i rgyu las 'byung zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: reg pa'i rgyu las 'byung zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It arises from the cause of contact.

original: de la tshor ba zhes bya ba ni des tshor bar byed pas na tshor ba ste /
analyzed: de la tshor ba zhes bya ba ni des tshor bar byed pas na tshor ba ste /
translated: Here, feeling is that which feels.

original: tshor ba ni myong ba'o //
analyzed: tshor ba ni myong ba'o //
translated: Feeling is experience.

original: bde ba dang sdug bsngal ba dang / bde ba yang ma yin /
analyzed: bde ba dang sdug bsngal ba dang / bde ba yang ma yin /
translated: Pleasant, painful, and neither pleasant nor painful.

original: sdug bsngal ba yang ma yin pa dang / yid bde ba dang / yid mi bde ba'i bye brag la tshor bar snang ba'i rnam pa'i rnam par rig pa rnam par rtog pa'i dbang gis byung ba yul dang / dbang po dang rnam par shes pa gsum tshan drug gi bye brag gis tshor ba'i tshogs drug skye bas bcom ldan 'das kyis reg pa dang lhan cig skyes pa ni tshor ba'o zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: sdug bsngal ba yang ma yin pa dang / yid bde ba dang / yid mi bde ba'i bye brag la tshor bar snang ba'i rnam pa'i rnam par rig pa rnam par rtog pa'i dbang gis byung ba yul dang / dbang po dang rnam par shes pa gsum tshan drug gi bye brag gis tshor ba'i tshogs drug skye bas bcom ldan 'das kyis reg pa dang lhan cig skyes pa ni tshor ba'o zhes gsungs so //
translated: The Blessed One said: “Feeling arises together with contact.”🔽Similarly, craving arises with the nature of attachment to and clinging to the taste of feeling.

original: de bzhin du tshor ba'i ro myang ba cung zad la chags shing mngon par zhen pa'i bdag nyid ni tshor ba'i rgyu can gyi sred pa zhes bya ba sred pa skye ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du tshor ba'i ro myang ba cung zad la chags shing mngon par zhen pa'i bdag nyid ni tshor ba'i rgyu can gyi sred pa zhes bya ba sred pa skye ste /
translated: Craving is said to have feeling as its cause.

original: de nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir /
translated: Therefore, it is said:

original: de bzhin tshor las sred pa 'byung //🔽zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: de bzhin tshor las sred pa 'byung // zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: Similarly, craving arises from feeling.

original: sred pa zhes bya ba ni khams gsum pa'i 'dod chags te /
analyzed: sred pa zhes bya ba ni khams gsum pa'i 'dod chags te /
translated: Craving is attachment to the three realms.

original: chags pa dang / lhag par zhen pa dang / mngon par 'dod pa dang / zhen pa dang / mi 'bral bar 'dod pa dang / dga' ba dang / sdug pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: chags pa dang / lhag par zhen pa dang / mngon par 'dod pa dang / zhen pa dang / mi 'bral bar 'dod pa dang / dga' ba dang / sdug pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Attachment, excessive attachment, strong desire, clinging, not wanting to be separated, delight, and love are synonyms.

original: de yang dbang po dang / yul dang / rnam par shes pa'i bye brag gis sred pa'i tshogs drug tu rnam par gzhag ste /
analyzed: de yang dbang po dang / yul dang / rnam par shes pa'i bye brag gis sred pa'i tshogs drug tu rnam par gzhag ste /
translated: Moreover, craving is established as six groups of craving by way of the distinctions of sense faculty, object, and consciousness.

original: sred par snang ba'i rnam pa can gyi rnam par rig pa'i dbang gis byung ba'i sred pa'i tshogs drug skye bas bde bar gshegs pas tshor ba la zhen pa ni srid pa'o zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: sred par snang ba'i rnam pa can gyi rnam par rig pa'i dbang gis byung ba'i sred pa'i tshogs drug skye bas bde bar gshegs pas tshor ba la zhen pa ni srid pa'o zhes gsungs so //
translated: The six groups of craving arise by the power of the representations that appear as craving, and therefore the Sugata said, “Clinging to feeling is craving.”

original: de ltar lhag par zhen pa'i sred pa 'phel pa ni len pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar lhag par zhen pa'i sred pa 'phel pa ni len pa'o //
translated: Thus, the increase of craving that is excessive attachment is grasping.

original: de nyid kyi phyir /🔽sred 'phel nye bar len pa ste //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir / sred 'phel nye bar len pa ste //
translated: Therefore,

original: zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: it is said, “The increase of craving is grasping.”

original: sred pa ni chags pas kun nas 'khyud pa 'bral bar mi 'dod pa'i rgyu'o //
analyzed: sred pa ni chags pas kun nas 'khyud pa 'bral bar mi 'dod pa'i rgyu'o //
translated: Craving is the cause of not wanting to be separated from what is embraced by attachment.

original: dge ba dang mi dge ba dang lung du ma bstan pa la sogs pa ni len pa ste /
analyzed: dge ba dang mi dge ba dang lung du ma bstan pa la sogs pa ni len pa ste /
translated: Virtue, nonvirtue, and indeterminate are appropriated.🔽Because they are appropriated, they are called appropriators.

original: nye bar len pa'i phyir nye bar len pa'o //
analyzed: nye bar len pa'i phyir nye bar len pa'o //
translated: Or, they are appropriators because they appropriate.

original: nye bar lnga pa'i len pa ni nye bar len pa'o //
analyzed: nye bar lnga pa'i len pa ni nye bar len pa'o //
translated: The appropriator is the appropriator of the five aggregates.

original: rang gi las ji ltar blangs @44b pa'i lam brgyags kyi gzhan gyi dbang gis len pa las skyes pa yang srid pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rang gi las ji ltar blangs @44b pa'i lam brgyags kyi gzhan gyi dbang gis len pa las skyes pa yang srid pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The path of karma that is appropriated in accordance with one’s actions is called “becoming” because it is born from the power of appropriation.

original: de nyid kyi phyir /🔽len pa las ni srid pa 'byung //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir / len pa las ni srid pa 'byung //
translated: For this reason,🔽it is said: “Becoming arises from appropriation.”🔽Because it is the cause of the arising of the aggregates, it is called “becoming.”

original: zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: It is called “becoming” because it is the cause of the arising of the aggregates.🔽It is called “becoming” because it is the cause of the arising of the aggregates.🔽It is called “becoming” because it is the cause of the arising of the aggregates.🔽It is called “becoming” because it is the cause of the arising of the aggregates.🔽It is called “becoming” because it is the cause of the arising of the aggregates.🔽It is called “becoming” because it is the cause of the arising of the aggregates.🔽It is called “becoming” because it is the cause of the arising of the aggregates.🔽It is called “becoming” because it is the cause of the arising of the aggregates.🔽It is called “becoming” because it is the cause of the arising of the aggregates.🔽It is called “becoming” because it is the cause of the arising of the aggregates.🔽It is called “becoming” because it is the cause of the arising of the aggregates.🔽It is called “becoming” because it is the cause of the arising of the aggregates.🔽It is called “becoming” because it is the cause of the arising of the aggregates.🔽It is called “becoming” because it is the cause of the arising of the aggregates.🔽It is called “becoming” because it is the cause of the arising of the aggregates.🔽It is called “becoming” because it is the cause of the arising of the aggregates.🔽It is called “becoming” because it is the cause of the arising of the aggregates.🔽It is called “becoming” because it is the cause of the arising of the aggregates.🔽It is called “becoming” because it is the cause of the arising of the aggregates.🔽It is called “becoming” because it is the cause of the arising of the aggregates.

original: rang gi las kyi bag chags ji lta ba snang ba'i rnam pa can gyi rnam par rig pa rnam par rtog pa'i dbang gis byung ba yang srid pa mngon par bsgrub pa'i phyir srid pa zhes bya ste yang 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang gi las kyi bag chags ji lta ba snang ba'i rnam pa can gyi rnam par rig pa rnam par rtog pa'i dbang gis byung ba yang srid pa mngon par bsgrub pa'i phyir srid pa zhes bya ste yang 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It is called “becoming” because it is the cause of the arising of the aggregates.

original: rang gi las ni bag chags ji lta ba'i dbang gis zhes bya ba ni dge ba dang mi dge ba dang / mi g-yo ba'i las kyi bag chags kyi dbang gis zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: rang gi las ni bag chags ji lta ba'i dbang gis zhes bya ba ni dge ba dang mi dge ba dang / mi g-yo ba'i las kyi bag chags kyi dbang gis zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Its function is to project the consciousness that is to be reborn, by the power of the residual impressions of karma.

original: de ltar na las kyi srid pa ni rgyu yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na las kyi srid pa ni rgyu yin no //
translated: Thus, the existence of karma is the cause.

original: srid las phung 'byung skye ba ste //
analyzed: srid las phung 'byung skye ba ste //
translated: The arising of the aggregates from existence is birth.

original: las kyi srid pa'i rgyu de las phung po 'byung ba ni skye ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: las kyi srid pa'i rgyu de las phung po 'byung ba ni skye ba zhes bya'o //
translated: The arising of the aggregates from the cause of the existence of karma is called birth.

original: de la phung po 'byung ba zhes bya ba ni phung po skye ba ste /
analyzed: de la phung po 'byung ba zhes bya ba ni phung po skye ba ste /
translated: The arising of the aggregates is the birth of the aggregates.

original: khams dang skye mched thob pa yang bsdus te skye ba zhes brjod do //
analyzed: khams dang skye mched thob pa yang bsdus te skye ba zhes brjod do //
translated: The attainment of the elements and sense bases is also included in birth.

original: de la phung po zhes bya ba ni rdzas du ma bsags pa'i phyir spungs pa'i don ni phung po'i don to //
analyzed: de la phung po zhes bya ba ni rdzas du ma bsags pa'i phyir spungs pa'i don ni phung po'i don to //
translated: The meaning of aggregate is a heap, because it is a collection of many substances.

original: yang na mi rtag pa nyid kyis 'joms pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: yang na mi rtag pa nyid kyis 'joms pa'i phyir te /
translated: Or, it is because they are destroyed by impermanence.

original: skyes ma thag tu mi rtag pa nyid kyi srin pos za bar byed /
analyzed: skyes ma thag tu mi rtag pa nyid kyi srin pos za bar byed /
translated: As soon as they are born, they are devoured by the demon of impermanence.

original: 'joms par byed /
analyzed: 'joms par byed /
translated: They are destroyed.

original: 'jig par byed ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: 'jig par byed ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It is the meaning of “that which causes destruction.”

original: de ltar mngon par grub na skye ba'i rgyus skye ba'i rkyen gyis rga ba nyid 'grub bo //
analyzed: de ltar mngon par grub na skye ba'i rgyus skye ba'i rkyen gyis rga ba nyid 'grub bo //
translated: When that is fully accomplished, aging is established through the condition of birth, the cause of birth.

original: de nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir /
translated: Therefore,

original: de bzhin skye las rga ba'o //
analyzed: de bzhin skye las rga ba'o //
translated: in the same way, aging is from birth.

original: zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: It is said.

original: skye ba'i rkyen gyis mngon par bsgrub pa'i phung po rnams rga ba ni rnyings pa nyid de /
analyzed: skye ba'i rkyen gyis mngon par bsgrub pa'i phung po rnams rga ba ni rnyings pa nyid de /
translated: Aging is the aging of the aggregates that are fully accomplished through the condition of birth.

original: nyam chung bar byed pa dang / spyi cer ba dang / mgo skya ba dang / gnyer mas gang ba dang / sgur ba dang / sgu ba dang / kyor kyor po dang / sgra ngar ngar po nyid dang / 'khar ba la brten pa dang /
analyzed: nyam chung bar byed pa dang / spyi cer ba dang / mgo skya ba dang / gnyer mas gang ba dang / sgur ba dang / sgu ba dang / kyor kyor po dang / sgra ngar ngar po nyid dang / 'khar ba la brten pa dang /
translated: It is the state of being weak, stooped, gray-haired, wrinkled, bent over, crooked, lame, and wheezing, and the state of needing to rely on a cane,

original: spyod pa mi gsal ba dang / dbang po nyams pa dang / dran pa nyams pa zhes bya ba de lta bu ni skye ba'i rkyen gyis mngon par bsgrub pa'i phung po rnams rang gi las kyi rnam pa can gyi rnam par rig pa snang ba rnam par rtog pa'i bag chags kyi dbang gis bskyed pa'i rnyings pa ni rga🔽ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: spyod pa mi gsal ba dang / dbang po nyams pa dang / dran pa nyams pa zhes bya ba de lta bu ni skye ba'i rkyen gyis mngon par bsgrub pa'i phung po rnams rang gi las kyi rnam pa can gyi rnam par rig pa snang ba rnam par rtog pa'i bag chags kyi dbang gis bskyed pa'i rnyings pa ni rga ba zhes bya'o //
translated: The condition of birth establishes the aggregates, which are the appearance of representations that have the aspect of one’s own karma, through the power of the latent propensities of conceptualization. The aging of those aggregates is called “aging.”

original: de ltar rga bas rgas par gyur pa'i phung po gzhan du 'gyur ba ni 'chi ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar rga bas rgas par gyur pa'i phung po gzhan du 'gyur ba ni 'chi ba zhes bya'o //
translated: The transformation of the aggregates that are aged by aging is called “death.”

original: de nyid kyi phyir smras pa /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir smras pa /
translated: Therefore it is said:

original: de bzhin rga ba'i phung med pa //
analyzed: de bzhin rga ba'i phung med pa //
translated: Likewise, the absence of the aggregates of aging

original: de ni 'chi ba zhes brjod do //
analyzed: de ni 'chi ba zhes brjod do //
translated: Is called “death.”

original: de la rga ba zhes bya ba ni shig shig por gyur pa rga ba'i rkyen gyis 'chi ba 'byung ngo //
analyzed: de la rga ba zhes bya ba ni shig shig por gyur pa rga ba'i rkyen gyis 'chi ba 'byung ngo //
translated: Therein, “aging” is the condition of the body becoming decrepit, and through the condition of aging, death occurs.

original: de la 'chi ba zhes bya ba ni phung po gzhan du gyur pa ste /
analyzed: de la 'chi ba zhes bya ba ni phung po gzhan du gyur pa ste /
translated: Therein, “death” is the transformation of the aggregates.

original: 'chi ba dang / shi ba dang / dus byed pa dang / 'jig rten @45a * //
analyzed: 'chi ba dang / shi ba dang / dus byed pa dang / 'jig rten @45a * //
translated: Death, dying, and transmigration

original: pha rol du 'gro ba dang / 'pho ba dang / 'gro ba dang / phung po gyes pa dang / phung po 'jig pa dang / tshe zad pa dang / srog gi dbang po 'gags pa zhes bya ba de lta bu la sogs pa bsdus pa ni rga shi'o //
analyzed: pha rol du 'gro ba dang / 'pho ba dang / 'gro ba dang / phung po gyes pa dang / phung po 'jig pa dang / tshe zad pa dang / srog gi dbang po 'gags pa zhes bya ba de lta bu la sogs pa bsdus pa ni rga shi'o //
translated: The term “aging and death” includes such expressions as “passing away,” “transference,” “passing on,” “the dissolution of the aggregates,” “the destruction of the aggregates,” “the exhaustion of life,” and “the cessation of the life faculty.”

original: 'chi bar snang ba'i rnam pa can gyi rnam par rig pa'i rnam par rtog pa'i dbang gis byung ba /
analyzed: 'chi bar snang ba'i rnam pa can gyi rnam par rig pa'i rnam par rtog pa'i dbang gis byung ba /
translated: It is a designation that is dependent on the conceptualization of consciousness, which has the appearance of death.

original: phung po 'jig pa 'chi ba ste /
analyzed: phung po 'jig pa 'chi ba ste /
translated: “Death” is the destruction of the aggregates.

original: gnas skabs tha ma nyal ba'i tha ma rnam par shes pa 'pho ba /
analyzed: gnas skabs tha ma nyal ba'i tha ma rnam par shes pa 'pho ba /
translated: It is the transference of consciousness at the final moment of sleep.

original: drod yal ba /
analyzed: drod yal ba /
translated: It is the loss of body heat.

original: tshe dang bral ba /
analyzed: tshe dang bral ba /
translated: It is the loss of life.

original: ris mthun pa 'dor ba /
analyzed: ris mthun pa 'dor ba /
translated: It is the abandonment of a class affiliate.

analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i phyir nyon mongs pa'o //

analyzed: tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa'i rgyus mi shes pa ni ma rig pa'o //

analyzed: 'di ni rnam par shes pa'i rkyen gyis ming dang gzugs zhes bya'o //

analyzed: de ni ming dang gzugs kyi rkyen gyis skye mched drug ces bya'o //

analyzed: skye mched drug po las reg pa'i tshogs drug 'byung ste /

original: de ni skye mched drug gi rkyen gyis reg pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de ni skye mched drug gi rkyen gyis reg pa zhes bya'o //

analyzed: ji lta bur reg pa 'byung ba de lta bur tshor ba 'byung ste /

original: de ni reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de ni reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba zhes bya'o //

translated: From experience and excessive attachment, the thought arises, “May I not be separated from the essence of my own happiness!” This is called “craving as a condition for grasping.”

original: de ltar smon cing yang srid pa bskyed pa'i las lus dang / ngag dang / yid kyis kun nas slong ba de ni len pa'i rkyen gyis srid pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar smon cing yang srid pa bskyed pa'i las lus dang / ngag dang / yid kyis kun nas slong ba de ni len pa'i rkyen gyis srid pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The act of wishing in this way and the act of generating further existence through body, speech, and mind are called “grasping as a condition for becoming.”

original: las de las skyes pa'i phung po rnams mngon par 'grub pa gang yin pa de ni srid pa'i rkyen gyis skye ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: las de las skyes pa'i phung po rnams mngon par 'grub pa gang yin pa de ni srid pa'i rkyen gyis skye ba zhes bya'o //
translated: The actualization of the aggregates that arise from this act is called “becoming as a condition for birth.”

original: skyes nas mngon du grub pa'i phyir phung po rnams kyi 'phel ba yongs su smin pa dang / 'jig par 'gyur ba de ni skye ba'i rkyen gyis rga shi zhes bya'o //
analyzed: skyes nas mngon du grub pa'i phyir phung po rnams kyi 'phel ba yongs su smin pa dang / 'jig par 'gyur ba de ni skye ba'i rkyen gyis rga shi zhes bya'o //
translated: The growth, maturation, and destruction of the aggregates that arise from birth are called “birth as a condition for old age and death.”

original: yan lag snga ma snga ma rnams ni phyi ma phyi ma skye ba rnams kyi rgyu nyid yin pas de dag ni phyi ma 'byung ba'i phyir rkyen kho na ste /
analyzed: yan lag snga ma snga ma rnams ni phyi ma phyi ma skye ba rnams kyi rgyu nyid yin pas de dag ni phyi ma 'byung ba'i phyir rkyen kho na ste /
translated: The former members are the cause of the latter members, because they are the cause of their arising. They are only conditions, because they are the cause of their arising.

original: de ltar rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i yan lag bcu gnyis po 'di ni rgyu gzhan dang gzhan las byung ba'o //
analyzed: de ltar rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i yan lag bcu gnyis po 'di ni rgyu gzhan dang gzhan las byung ba'o //
translated: Thus, this twelvefold dependent origination arises from one cause to another.

original: yan lag bcu gnyis gsum 'jug pa //
analyzed: yan lag bcu gnyis gsum 'jug pa //
translated: The twelve members are included in the three causal lifecontinua.🔽They are included in the three causal lifecontinua, because they are the cause of the lifecontinuum.🔽The lifecontinuum is the causal lifecontinuum, because it is the cause of the lifecontinuum.

original: 'di ni rtag chad thogs med skye //
analyzed: 'di ni rtag chad thogs med skye //
translated: The lifecontinuum is the resultant lifecontinuum, because it is the result of the lifecontinuum.

original: chu bo'i rgyun bzhin 'jug pa yis //🔽thog ma med pa'i dus can 'jug /🔽mi rtag pa ma yin pa de ni rgyun du gnas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chu bo'i rgyun bzhin 'jug pa yis // thog ma med pa'i dus can 'jug / mi rtag pa ma yin pa de ni rgyun du gnas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The lifecontinuum is the causal lifecontinuum, because it is the cause of the lifecontinuum.🔽The lifecontinuum is the resultant lifecontinuum, because it is the result of the lifecontinuum.🔽The lifecontinuum is the causal lifecontinuum, because it is the cause of the lifecontinuum.🔽The lifecontinuum is the resultant lifecontinuum, because it is the result of the lifecontinuum.

original: 'dus byas ma yin pa de ni 'du byed dang bral ba'i phyir ro //🔽sems pa po yod pa ma yin pa de ni sems dang bral ba'i phyir ro //🔽rkyen las byung ba ma yin pa ni rkyen dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dus byas ma yin pa de ni 'du byed dang bral ba'i phyir ro // sems pa po yod pa ma yin pa de ni sems dang bral ba'i phyir ro // rkyen las byung ba ma yin pa ni rkyen dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The lifecontinuum is the causal lifecontinuum, because it is the cause of the lifecontinuum.🔽The lifecontinuum is the resultant lifecontinuum, because it is the result of the lifecontinuum.🔽The lifecontinuum is the causal lifecontinuum, because it is the cause of the lifecontinuum.🔽The lifecontinuum is the resultant lifecontinuum, because it is the result of the lifecontinuum.🔽The lifecontinuum is the causal lifecontinuum, because it is the cause of the lifecontinuum.🔽The lifecontinuum is the resultant lifecontinuum, because it is the result of the lifecontinuum.🔽The lifecontinuum is the causal lifecontinuum, because it is the cause of the lifecontinuum.🔽The lifecontinuum is the resultant lifecontinuum, because it is the result of the lifecontinuum.🔽The lifecontinuum is the causal lifecontinuum, because it is the cause of the lifecontinuum.

original: zad pa'i chos ma yin pa ni bsags pa dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zad pa'i chos ma yin pa ni bsags pa dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The lifecontinuum is the resultant lifecontinuum, because it is the result of the lifecontinuum.🔽The lifecontinuum

original: 'gog pa'i chos ma yin pa ni skye ba dang / gnas pa dang / 'jig pa dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'gog pa'i chos ma yin pa ni skye ba dang / gnas pa dang / 'jig pa dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It is not a dharma of cessation because it is free from arising, abiding, and destruction.

original: thog ma med pa'i dus nas zhugs pa ni dus kyi mtshams yongs su chad pa dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thog ma med pa'i dus nas zhugs pa ni dus kyi mtshams yongs su chad pa dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It has been operating since beginningless time because it is free from a definite beginning.

original: klung gi rgyun bzhin du rgyun 'byung bas rgyun ma chad par 'jug pa'o /
analyzed: klung gi rgyun bzhin du rgyun 'byung bas rgyun ma chad par 'jug pa'o /
translated: It is uninterrupted because it is a continuous process like the current of a river.

original: // /'phags @47a * //  pa s'a lu ljang pa'i mdo /
analyzed: // /'phags @47a * //  pa s'a lu ljang pa'i mdo /
translated: Noble Sūtra of the Rice Seedling

original: rgya cher bshad pa /
analyzed: rgya cher bshad pa /
translated: Extensive Commentary

original: bam po bzhi pa ste tha ma'o //
analyzed: bam po bzhi pa ste tha ma'o //
translated: Part Four, the Final Part

original: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba 'di chu bo'i rgyun bzhin du rgyun mi 'chad par rjes su 'jug mod kyi /
analyzed: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba 'di chu bo'i rgyun bzhin du rgyun mi 'chad par rjes su 'jug mod kyi /
translated: Although this dependent origination operates continuously like the current of a river,

original: 'on kyang bzhi po 'di dag ni rgyu ni sdud par byed pa ste /
analyzed: 'on kyang bzhi po 'di dag ni rgyu ni sdud par byed pa ste /
translated: nevertheless, these four are the causes of accumulation.

original: yan lag bzhi ni yan lag bcu gnyis pa'i rten cing 'brel pa zhes bya ba sdud par byed pa'i rgyur 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yan lag bzhi ni yan lag bcu gnyis pa'i rten cing 'brel pa zhes bya ba sdud par byed pa'i rgyur 'gyur ro //
translated: The four limbs become the cause of accumulation for the twelve limbs called dependent origination.

original: de'i phyir bzhi gang zhe na zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de'i phyir bzhi gang zhe na zhes gsungs so //
translated: Therefore, it is said, What are the four?

original: ma rig sred las rnam par shes //
analyzed: ma rig sred las rnam par shes //
translated: Ignorance, craving, and karma

original: de dag go rims bzhin du bshad //
analyzed: de dag go rims bzhin du bshad //
translated: These are explained in order.🔽

original: ma rig pa dang / sred pa dang / las dang / rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba go rims bzhin no //🔽rgyu las rnam shes sa bon te //🔽rnam par shes pa ni sa bon gyi rang bzhin gyi rgyu byed do //🔽las ni zhing du gsungs pa yin //
analyzed: ma rig pa dang / sred pa dang / las dang / rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba go rims bzhin no // rgyu las rnam shes sa bon te // rnam par shes pa ni sa bon gyi rang bzhin gyi rgyu byed do // las ni zhing du gsungs pa yin //
translated: They are ignorance, craving, action, and consciousness.🔽Action is said to be the field.

original: las ni zhing gi rang bzhin gyi rgyu byed do zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: las ni zhing gi rang bzhin gyi rgyu byed do zhes gsungs so //
translated: Action is the cause that is the field.

original: ma rig pa dang / sred pa ni nyon mongs pa'i rang bzhin gyi rgyu byed do //
analyzed: ma rig pa dang / sred pa ni nyon mongs pa'i rang bzhin gyi rgyu byed do //
translated: Ignorance and craving are the cause that is the defilement.🔽Action and the defilements are the seed of consciousness.🔽Action and the defilements are the seed of consciousness.

original: las dang nyon mongs rnam par shes ;
analyzed: las dang nyon mongs rnam par shes ;
translated: Action is the field of consciousness.

original: / sa bon nyid du nyer gnas la //🔽las dang nyon mongs pa dag ni sa bon rnam par shes pa skyed par byed do //🔽de la / las ni sa bon rnam shes kyi //
analyzed: / sa bon nyid du nyer gnas la // las dang nyon mongs pa dag ni sa bon rnam par shes pa skyed par byed do // de la / las ni sa bon rnam shes kyi //
translated: Craving is the water that moistens the seed of consciousness.🔽Ignorance is the seed of consciousness.🔽Action is the field of consciousness.

original: zhing gi bya ba yang byed do //🔽sred pas rnam shes zhes bya ba'i //
analyzed: zhing gi bya ba yang byed do // sred pas rnam shes zhes bya ba'i //
translated: It is also the field of the seed of consciousness.

original: sa bon de ma thag rlan byed //
analyzed: sa bon de ma thag rlan byed //
translated: Craving is the water that moistens the seed of consciousness.

original: ma rig sa bon rnam par shes //
analyzed: ma rig sa bon rnam par shes //
translated: Ignorance is the seed of consciousness.

original: brlan pas bsten pa 'debs par byed //
analyzed: brlan pas bsten pa 'debs par byed //
translated: The moisture is the nourishing.

original: las dang sred dang ma rig pa //
analyzed: las dang sred dang ma rig pa //
translated: Karma, craving, and ignorance

original: zhing dang brlan dang 'debs byed rnams //🔽rnam par shes la 'di bya dang // rnam shes bdag 'dis snyam pa med //
analyzed: zhing dang brlan dang 'debs byed rnams // rnam par shes la 'di bya dang // rnam shes bdag 'dis snyam pa med //
translated: are the field, the moisture, and the sowing.

original: de la las kyang 'di snyam du //
analyzed: de la las kyang 'di snyam du //
translated: Consciousness is the one who does these things, but consciousness does not think,🔽“I will do these things.”

original: mi sems so zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni las kyang 'di snyam du //🔽bdag gis sa bon rnam par shes pa'i zhing gi bya ba yang bya'o snyam du mi sems pa nyid do //
analyzed: mi sems so zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni las kyang 'di snyam du // bdag gis sa bon rnam par shes pa'i zhing gi bya ba yang bya'o snyam du mi sems pa nyid do //
translated: Karma does not think,🔽“I will make the field of consciousness grow.”🔽And so on. Karma also does not think, “I will do the work of a field for the seed of consciousness.”

original: sred pa yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni 'di ltar sred pa yang 'di snyam du bdag gis sa bon rnam par shes pa brlan pa'i bya ba bya'o snyam du mi sems so //
analyzed: sred pa yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni 'di ltar sred pa yang 'di snyam du bdag gis sa bon rnam par shes pa brlan pa'i bya ba bya'o snyam du mi sems so //
translated: Craving does not think, “I will do the work of moistening the seed of consciousness.”

original: ma rig pa yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni ma rig pa yang 'di snyam du bdag gis sa bon rnam par shes pa gdab bo snyam du mi sems so //
analyzed: ma rig pa yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni ma rig pa yang 'di snyam du bdag gis sa bon rnam par shes pa gdab bo snyam du mi sems so //
translated: Ignorance does not think, “I will sow the seed of consciousness.”

original: rnam par shes pa yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni 'di snyam du bdag ni rkyen 'di dag gis bskyed do snyam du mi sems te /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni 'di snyam du bdag ni rkyen 'di dag gis bskyed do snyam du mi sems te /
translated: Consciousness, etc. do not think, “I am produced by these conditions.”

original: 'on kyang sa bon rnam par shes //
analyzed: 'on kyang sa bon rnam par shes //
translated: However, the seed is consciousness.

original: las dang nyon mongs gnas pa ni //
analyzed: las dang nyon mongs gnas pa ni //
translated: Karma and the afflictions are its field.

original: sa bon rnam shes zhes brjod pa //
analyzed: sa bon rnam shes zhes brjod pa //
translated: The seed is called consciousness.

original: ma @47b rig lud kyis bran pa dang // sred pa'i chu yis bsten na ni //🔽ma rig lud ces bya ba ni lud dang 'dra bas lud de thams cad kyi rjes su 'gro ba'i phyir ro //🔽lud kyis bran pa zhes bya ba ni lud kyis bkab pa'o //🔽sred pa'i chu yis bsten na ni //
analyzed: ma @47b rig lud kyis bran pa dang // sred pa'i chu yis bsten na ni // ma rig lud ces bya ba ni lud dang 'dra bas lud de thams cad kyi rjes su 'gro ba'i phyir ro // lud kyis bran pa zhes bya ba ni lud kyis bkab pa'o // sred pa'i chu yis bsten na ni //
translated: When it is moistened by the water of craving,

original: zhes bya ba ni sred pa nyid chu'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni sred pa nyid chu'o //
translated: The water of craving is craving itself.

original: bsten na zhes bya ba ni brlan na'o //🔽rgyu las ming dang gzugs kyi ni //
analyzed: bsten na zhes bya ba ni brlan na'o // rgyu las ming dang gzugs kyi ni //
translated: Moistened means saturated.🔽From that, name and form

original: myu gu skye ba'ang snang bar 'gyur //
analyzed: myu gu skye ba'ang snang bar 'gyur //
translated: The sprout of name and form appears.

original: zhes bya ba ni rgyu dang rkyen tshogs pa skye ba ni ming dang gzugs kyi myu gu mngon par 'grub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni rgyu dang rkyen tshogs pa skye ba ni ming dang gzugs kyi myu gu mngon par 'grub par 'gyur ro //
translated: The arising of the collection of causes and conditions is the establishment of the sprout of name-and-form.

original: ming dang gzugs kyi myu gu dang yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni /🔽rang gzhan gnyis ka la sogs pas /
analyzed: ming dang gzugs kyi myu gu dang yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni / rang gzhan gnyis ka la sogs pas /
translated: The sprout of name-and-form, etc.

original: ming gzugs 'di dag 'byung min gyi //
analyzed: ming gzugs 'di dag 'byung min gyi //
translated: The sprout of name-and-form does not arise from self, from other, from both, or without cause.

original: ming dang gzugs kyi myu gu 'di dag ni rang dang gzhan gnyis ka la sogs pas bskyed pa ma yin no //
analyzed: ming dang gzugs kyi myu gu 'di dag ni rang dang gzhan gnyis ka la sogs pas bskyed pa ma yin no //
translated: The sprout of name-and-form does not arise from self, from other, from both, or without cause.

original: 'o na ji lta bu yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ji lta bu yin zhe na /
translated: How is it, then?

original: smras pa / pha dang ma ni phrad pa dang // dus rnams mi 'gal nyid las so //
analyzed: smras pa / pha dang ma ni phrad pa dang // dus rnams mi 'gal nyid las so //
translated: It is said: From the union of father and mother, and from the proper sequence of the elements.

original: pha dang ma ni phrad pa dang // zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni pha dang ma kun tu chags par gyur pa dang / 'dus pa dang / ma rungs par gyur pa ste /
analyzed: pha dang ma ni phrad pa dang // zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni pha dang ma kun tu chags par gyur pa dang / 'dus pa dang / ma rungs par gyur pa ste /
translated: From the union of father and mother, etc. means that the father and mother are passionate, come together, and are fertile.

original: bu 'chags par nus pa dang / dus dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: bu 'chags par nus pa dang / dus dang ldan pa'o //
translated: The embryo is able to develop, and the time is right.

original: nyi ma gsum 'das te khrag ngan pa dang bral ba de ni /
analyzed: nyi ma gsum 'das te khrag ngan pa dang bral ba de ni /
translated: Three days after the passing of the sun, when the bad blood is gone,

original: bud med rnams kyi dus su brjod de /🔽de'i tshe skyes pa dang yang phrad /
analyzed: bud med rnams kyi dus su brjod de / de'i tshe skyes pa dang yang phrad /
translated: This is the time of women.

original: khu ba dang khrag dang yang ldan ;
analyzed: khu ba dang khrag dang yang ldan ;
translated: At that time, the intermediate existence being meets with a man and woman who are copulating.

original: dri za bdag nyid kyang sems kyang sems phyin ci log tu gyur te /
analyzed: dri za bdag nyid kyang sems kyang sems phyin ci log tu gyur te /
translated: It is attracted by the smell of semen and blood, and its mind becomes distorted.🔽If it is to be reborn as a male, it has a desire to copulate with the woman and a hatred for the man.🔽If it is to be reborn as a female, it has a desire to copulate with the man and a hatred for the woman.

original: pha dang ma'i bya ba la mos na mngal du skye ba'i rim gyis nur nur po dang / mer mer po dang / nar nar po dang / gor gor bo dang / rkang lag 'gyur ba'i gnas skabs las 'das te skye ba na /
analyzed: pha dang ma'i bya ba la mos na mngal du skye ba'i rim gyis nur nur po dang / mer mer po dang / nar nar po dang / gor gor bo dang / rkang lag 'gyur ba'i gnas skabs las 'das te skye ba na /
translated: It enters the womb and passes through the stages of an embryo, a blister, a lump of flesh, a lump of meat, and a shape with limbs.🔽Then it becomes a fetus and is born.

original: byis pa dang / gzhon nu dang / bar ma dang / dar la bab pa dang / rgan po la sogs pa'i gnas skabs bcur 'gyur ro //
analyzed: byis pa dang / gzhon nu dang / bar ma dang / dar la bab pa dang / rgan po la sogs pa'i gnas skabs bcur 'gyur ro //
translated: After birth, it becomes a child, a youth, a middle-aged person, an old person, and so on.

original: de nyid kyi phyir yang smras pa /🔽myong ba cung zad 'brel pa ni //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir yang smras pa / myong ba cung zad 'brel pa ni //
translated: Therefore, it is said:

original: sa bon rnam par shes par brjod //
analyzed: sa bon rnam par shes par brjod //
translated: The seed of consciousness is connected with a little experience.

original: ma yi mngal du rim bzhin 'phel //
analyzed: ma yi mngal du rim bzhin 'phel //
translated: It grows in the mother’s womb in stages

original: ming gzugs myu gu skyed par byed //
analyzed: ming gzugs myu gu skyed par byed //
translated: and produces the sprout of name and form.

original: 'on kyang pha de dang ma phrad pa dang / zla mtshan dang ldan pa dang / rkyen gzhan yang chogs pa na ma'i mngal du myong ba dang ldan pa'i sa bon rnam par shes pa ming dang gzugs kyi myu gu mngon par 'grub bo //
analyzed: 'on kyang pha de dang ma phrad pa dang / zla mtshan dang ldan pa dang / rkyen gzhan yang chogs pa na ma'i mngal du myong ba dang ldan pa'i sa bon rnam par shes pa ming dang gzugs kyi myu gu mngon par 'grub bo //
translated: But when the father and mother come together, when the mother is in season, and when there is a gandharva present, then the consciousness that is accompanied by the seed of experience produces the sprout of name-and-form in the mother’s womb.

original: rkyen rnams ma tshang med pa dang // rgyu rnams 'gal ba ma yin las //🔽sgyu ma bdag med 'dzin med par //
analyzed: rkyen rnams ma tshang med pa dang // rgyu rnams 'gal ba ma yin las // sgyu ma bdag med 'dzin med par //
translated: When the conditions are not incomplete, and the causes are not opposed,

original: skye ba yang ni yod pa yin /
analyzed: skye ba yang ni yod pa yin /
translated: then there is production, even though there is no self, no owner, and no grasping.

original: @48a * // de nyid kyi phyir bdag po med pa'i chos bdag gi med pa dang / 'dzin pa med pa dang / sgyu ma'i mtshan nyid kyi rang bzhin dag la rgyu dang rkyen ma tshang pa med pa'i phyir zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: @48a * // de nyid kyi phyir bdag po med pa'i chos bdag gi med pa dang / 'dzin pa med pa dang / sgyu ma'i mtshan nyid kyi rang bzhin dag la rgyu dang rkyen ma tshang pa med pa'i phyir zhes gsungs so //
translated: Therefore, it is said that “in things that are without an owner, without an inner being, without grasping, and whose nature is like an illusion, when the causes and conditions are not incomplete,

original: bdag po med pa zhes bya ba ni nang gi byed pa'i skyes bu la sogs pa mi dmigs pa'i ngo bo yin mod kyi ;
analyzed: bdag po med pa zhes bya ba ni nang gi byed pa'i skyes bu la sogs pa mi dmigs pa'i ngo bo yin mod kyi ;
translated: ” “Without an owner” means that the inner agent, etc., are not perceived.

original: de la mngon par zhen phas bskyed pa gang kun tu 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: de la mngon par zhen phas bskyed pa gang kun tu 'dzin pa'o //
translated: “Grasping” is the attachment that arises from the false view of self.

original: chos zhes bya ba ni phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched kyi ngo bo nyid do //
analyzed: chos zhes bya ba ni phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched kyi ngo bo nyid do //
translated: The so-called “dharmas” are the nature of the aggregates, elements, and sense-fields.

original: bdag gi zhes bya ba ni bdag dang bdag gi dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: bdag gi zhes bya ba ni bdag dang bdag gi dang bral ba'o //
translated: “ Mine” is free from “I” and “mine.”

original: 'dzin pa med pa zhes bya ba ni dbang phyug la sogs pa yongs su 'dzin pa mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro //🔽sgyu ma'i mtshan nyid kyi rang bzhin dag la zhes bya ba ni ji ltar sgyu ma ni med pa yin yang tha snyad rnam pa sna tshogs sgrub par byed pa de bzhin du sgyu ma'i rang bzhin gyi chos thams cad la bya ba la sogs pa rnam pa
analyzed: 'dzin pa med pa zhes bya ba ni dbang phyug la sogs pa yongs su 'dzin pa mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro // sgyu ma'i mtshan nyid kyi rang bzhin dag la zhes bya ba ni ji ltar sgyu ma ni med pa yin yang tha snyad rnam pa sna tshogs sgrub par byed pa de bzhin du sgyu ma'i rang bzhin gyi chos thams cad la bya ba la sogs pa rnam pa
translated: “ Non-apprehending” is because the apprehension of Īśvara and so forth is not observed.

original: sna tshogs dmigs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sna tshogs dmigs par 'gyur ro //
translated: “ The nature of illusory characteristics” means that just as an illusion, although non-existent, establishes various conventions, in the same way, in all dharmas that have the nature of an illusion, various activities and so forth are observed.

original: rgyu dang rkyen 'dus pa ma gtogs par rgyu dang rkyen la sogs pa'i chos cung zad kyang skye ba'am 'jig par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: rgyu dang rkyen 'dus pa ma gtogs par rgyu dang rkyen la sogs pa'i chos cung zad kyang skye ba'am 'jig par mi 'gyur te /
translated: Apart from the assembly of causes and conditions, no dharma whatsoever arises or ceases due to causes and conditions.

original: ji ltar yang rgyu dang rkyen ma tshang ba'i phyir dngos po rnams skye ba med pa de khong du chud par bya ba'i phyir dper /
analyzed: ji ltar yang rgyu dang rkyen ma tshang ba'i phyir dngos po rnams skye ba med pa de khong du chud par bya ba'i phyir dper /
translated: In any case, in order to understand that things are not produced because their causes and conditions are incomplete, he gives an example:

original: mig gi rnam par shes pa yang //
analyzed: mig gi rnam par shes pa yang //
translated: The eye consciousness

original: rgyu lnga po yis 'byung ba ste //🔽zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: rgyu lnga po yis 'byung ba ste // zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: arises from five causes.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: He says this because

original: mig gi rnam par shes pa ni rgyu lngas 'byung ste /
analyzed: mig gi rnam par shes pa ni rgyu lngas 'byung ste /
translated: the eye consciousness arises from five causes.

original: lnga gang zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni /🔽mig dang gzugs dang de bzhin snang //
analyzed: lnga gang zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni / mig dang gzugs dang de bzhin snang //
translated: What are the five?

original: nam mkha' de bskyed yid la byed //
analyzed: nam mkha' de bskyed yid la byed //
translated: The eye, form, light, space, and mental application that generates it.

original: ces bya ba de nyid kyi phyir mig la brten pa dang / gzugs dang / snang ba dang / nam mkha' dang / de bskyed pa yid la byed pa la yang zhes bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: ces bya ba de nyid kyi phyir mig la brten pa dang / gzugs dang / snang ba dang / nam mkha' dang / de bskyed pa yid la byed pa la yang zhes bya ba gsungs so //
translated: Therefore, he says, “the eye, form, light, space, and mental application that generates it.”

original: de la mig ces bya ba ni gzugs blta bar bya ba la mig gi dbang po ma tshang ba med par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: de la mig ces bya ba ni gzugs blta bar bya ba la mig gi dbang po ma tshang ba med par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: Therein, the “eye” is the unimpaired eye faculty for seeing forms.

original: de nyid kyi phyir mig ni rnam par shes pa'i rten gyi bya ba byed do zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir mig ni rnam par shes pa'i rten gyi bya ba byed do zhes gsungs so //
translated: That is why it is said that the eye exercises the action of basis of visual consciousness.

original: snang ba zhes bya ba ni zla ba dang / skar ma dang / me dang / sman dang / nor bu'i 'od rnams te mngon par bya ba la snang ba yang nye bar gnas par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: snang ba zhes bya ba ni zla ba dang / skar ma dang / me dang / sman dang / nor bu'i 'od rnams te mngon par bya ba la snang ba yang nye bar gnas par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: Light is the light of the moon, the stars, fire, gems, and medicinal herbs. It is the presence of light that makes visible form manifest.

original: nam mkha' yang mi sgrib pa nyid kyis ma tshang bar ma gyur pa'o //
analyzed: nam mkha' yang mi sgrib pa nyid kyis ma tshang bar ma gyur pa'o //
translated: Space is the absence of any tangible thing.

original: de bskyed pa la yid la byed pa yang bsam pa'i bya ba la mtshang bar ma gyur pa'o //
analyzed: de bskyed pa la yid la byed pa yang bsam pa'i bya ba la mtshang bar ma gyur pa'o //
translated: Mental attention is the presence of a mental state that is not distracted from the action of seeing.

original: lnga po ma tshang med pa las //
analyzed: lnga po ma tshang med pa las //
translated: When these five factors are complete,

original: mig gi rnam par shes pa 'byung //
analyzed: mig gi rnam par shes pa 'byung //
translated: visual consciousness arises.🔽If any one of the conditions for visual consciousness is absent, visual consciousness does not arise; but when all are present, it does arise.

original: mig gi rnam par shes pa'i rkyen de @48b dag las gang yang rung ba zhig med na yang mig gi rnam par shes pa 'byung bar mi 'gyur gyi yod na 'byung bar 'gyur ro //🔽de dag bdag gis de skyed ces //
analyzed: mig gi rnam par shes pa'i rkyen de @48b dag las gang yang rung ba zhig med na yang mig gi rnam par shes pa 'byung bar mi 'gyur gyi yod na 'byung bar 'gyur ro // de dag bdag gis de skyed ces //
translated: None of these factors can claim to produce visual consciousness.

original: rnam rtog skye med ji lta bar //
analyzed: rnam rtog skye med ji lta bar //
translated: Just as the arising of a thought is not a real arising,

original: zhes bya ba ni de la mig gi dbang po ni 'di snyam du mig gi rnam par shes pa'i rten gyi bya ba bya'o snyam du mi sems so ;
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni de la mig gi dbang po ni 'di snyam du mig gi rnam par shes pa'i rten gyi bya ba bya'o snyam du mi sems so ;
translated: The eye faculty does not think, “I will perform the function of a support for eye consciousness.”

original: / gzugs kyang 'di snyam du bdag gis mig gi rnam par shes pa'i dmigs pa'i bya ba bya'o snyam du mi sems so //
analyzed: / gzugs kyang 'di snyam du bdag gis mig gi rnam par shes pa'i dmigs pa'i bya ba bya'o snyam du mi sems so //
translated: Form does not think, “I will perform the function of the focal object for eye consciousness.”

original: snang ba yang 'di snyam du bdag gis mig gi rnam par shes pa'i mngon pa'i bya ba bya'o snyam du mi sems so //
analyzed: snang ba yang 'di snyam du bdag gis mig gi rnam par shes pa'i mngon pa'i bya ba bya'o snyam du mi sems so //
translated: Light does not think, “I will perform the function of illumination for eye consciousness.”

original: nam mkha' yang 'di snyam du bdag gis mig gi rnam par shes pa'i mi bsgrib pa'i bya ba bya'o snyam du mi sems so //
analyzed: nam mkha' yang 'di snyam du bdag gis mig gi rnam par shes pa'i mi bsgrib pa'i bya ba bya'o snyam du mi sems so //
translated: Space does not think, “I will perform the function of nonobstruction for eye consciousness.”

original: de skyed pa'i yid la byed pa yang 'di snyam du bdag gis mig gi rnam par shes pa'i bsam pa'i bya ba bya'o snyam du mi sems so //
analyzed: de skyed pa'i yid la byed pa yang 'di snyam du bdag gis mig gi rnam par shes pa'i bsam pa'i bya ba bya'o snyam du mi sems so //
translated: The attention that generates eye consciousness does not think, “I will perform the function of directing eye consciousness.”

original: mig gi rnam par shes pa yang 'di snyam du bdag ni rkyen 'di dag gis bskyed do snyam du mi sems te /
analyzed: mig gi rnam par shes pa yang 'di snyam du bdag ni rkyen 'di dag gis bskyed do snyam du mi sems te /
translated: Eye consciousness does not think, “I am generated by these conditions.”

original: 'on kyang rkyen 'di dag yod pa las mig gi rnam par shes pa skye bar 'gyur gyi med na mi 'gyur ba ltar /
analyzed: 'on kyang rkyen 'di dag yod pa las mig gi rnam par shes pa skye bar 'gyur gyi med na mi 'gyur ba ltar /
translated: But just as visual consciousness arises from the presence of these conditions and does not arise from their absence,

original: rna ba'i dbang po la sogs kun //
analyzed: rna ba'i dbang po la sogs kun //
translated: so it is with the ear faculty and so on.

original: skye ba'i rim pa 'di nyid yin //
analyzed: skye ba'i rim pa 'di nyid yin //
translated: This is the very same process of arising.

original: de bzhin du rna ba'i dbang po la sogs pa yang rgyu lngas skye ba'i rim pa khong du chud par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du rna ba'i dbang po la sogs pa yang rgyu lngas skye ba'i rim pa khong du chud par bya'o //
translated: In the same way, one should understand the process of arising of the ear faculty and so on in terms of these five causes.

original: rgyu dang rkyen ni tshogs pa las //
analyzed: rgyu dang rkyen ni tshogs pa las //
translated: From the assembly of causes and conditions,🔽free of an agent and so on,

original: byed po la sogs bral ba dang // nga 'dzin pa dang bral ba las //
analyzed: byed po la sogs bral ba dang // nga 'dzin pa dang bral ba las //
translated: free of the grasping of an “I,”

original: skye ba yang ni snga ma bzhin //
analyzed: skye ba yang ni snga ma bzhin //
translated: arising occurs, just as before.

original: de ltar rten cing 'brel 'byung ba'i //
analyzed: de ltar rten cing 'brel 'byung ba'i //
translated: Thus, all that is dependently arisen

original: rgyu can kun tu shes par bya //
analyzed: rgyu can kun tu shes par bya //
translated: is to be understood as being conditioned.

original: de ltar te /
analyzed: de ltar te /
translated: In this way,

original: rgyu dang rkyen gyi rim pa bshad ma thag pa'i rim pa de ltar chos thams cad kyi skye ba dang / gnas pa dang / 'jig pa rtogs par bya'o //🔽'jig rten 'di nas pha rol du //
analyzed: rgyu dang rkyen gyi rim pa bshad ma thag pa'i rim pa de ltar chos thams cad kyi skye ba dang / gnas pa dang / 'jig pa rtogs par bya'o // 'jig rten 'di nas pha rol du //
