translated: the arising, enduring, and disintegrating of all phenomena should be understood in the very same way as the process of the causes and conditions that have just been explained.🔽There is no phenomenon anywhere

original: 'gro ba'i chos 'ga' gang na'ang med //
analyzed: 'gro ba'i chos 'ga' gang na'ang med //
translated: that goes from this world to the next.

original: 'on kyang rgyu dang rkyen dag las //
analyzed: 'on kyang rgyu dang rkyen dag las //
translated: But the effect of action is perceived

original: las kyi 'bras bur mngon pa yin //
analyzed: las kyi 'bras bur mngon pa yin //
translated: in dependence upon causes and conditions.

original: de la chos zhes bya ba ni mig dang / rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / yid la sogs pa'i chos dang / gzugs dang / sgra dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg bya dang / chos la sogs pa dang /
analyzed: de la chos zhes bya ba ni mig dang / rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / yid la sogs pa'i chos dang / gzugs dang / sgra dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg bya dang / chos la sogs pa dang /
translated: Here, the term “phenomena” refers to phenomena such as the eyes, ears, nose, tongue, body, and mind; form, sound, smell, taste, texture, and mental phenomena;

original: phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba la sogs pa'i chos so //
analyzed: phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba la sogs pa'i chos so //
translated: the aggregates, elements, sense bases, dependent arising, and so on.

original: 'di nas zhes bya ba ni /🔽'jig rten 'di nas 'jig rten pha rol lam /
analyzed: 'di nas zhes bya ba ni / 'jig rten 'di nas 'jig rten pha rol lam /
translated: “ From here” refers to🔽the fact that no phenomenon passes from this world to the next world,

original: 'jig rten pha rol nas 'jig rten 'dir chos 'ga' yang mi 'pho ba'o //🔽gal @49a * //
analyzed: 'jig rten pha rol nas 'jig rten 'dir chos 'ga' yang mi 'pho ba'o // gal @49a * //
translated: or from the next world to this world.

original: te de ltar na rtag par smra ba'am /
analyzed: te de ltar na rtag par smra ba'am /
translated: If that is so, then it would follow that you are advocating eternalism,

original: rgyu med pa dang mi mthun pa'i rgyur smra bar 'gyur du 'ong ngo zhe na /
analyzed: rgyu med pa dang mi mthun pa'i rgyur smra bar 'gyur du 'ong ngo zhe na /
translated: or that causes are not necessary, or that causes are incompatible with their effects.

original: bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Buddha replied:

original: rgyu dang rkyen ma tshad pa med pa'i phyir las kyi 'bras bur mngon pa yang yod do //
analyzed: rgyu dang rkyen ma tshad pa med pa'i phyir las kyi 'bras bur mngon pa yang yod do //
translated: Because the causes and conditions are not incomplete, the effect of the action is also evident.

original: de la 'pho ba yang med la las kyi 'bras bu yang chud mi za bar mngon sum dang / rjes su dpag pa dang / yid ches pa'i lung las rab tu grags pa'i dpe 'di dag gis shes par bya ste /🔽ji ltar me long rab phyis la //
analyzed: de la 'pho ba yang med la las kyi 'bras bu yang chud mi za bar mngon sum dang / rjes su dpag pa dang / yid ches pa'i lung las rab tu grags pa'i dpe 'di dag gis shes par bya ste / ji ltar me long rab phyis la //
translated: Here, the transference is not evident, but the effect of the action is not lost. This should be understood through these examples that are well known from direct perception, inference, and reliable reports.🔽Just as in a well-polished mirror,

original: bzhin gyi gzugs brnyan dmigs pa bzhin //🔽me long nang du gzugs brnyan yang //
analyzed: bzhin gyi gzugs brnyan dmigs pa bzhin // me long nang du gzugs brnyan yang //
translated: the reflection of a face is seen,🔽in a mirror, a reflection does not

original: 'phos pa yod pa ma yin nyid //
analyzed: 'phos pa yod pa ma yin nyid //
translated: exist as a transferred entity.

original: de nyid kyi phyir gsungs pa ;
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir gsungs pa ;
translated: For this very reason, it is said:

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is like this:

original: rab tu phyis pa'i me long gi dkyil 'khor la bzhin gyi gzugs brnyan snang ba yang bzhin me long gi dkyil 'khor nang du ma 'phos mod kyi /
analyzed: rab tu phyis pa'i me long gi dkyil 'khor la bzhin gyi gzugs brnyan snang ba yang bzhin me long gi dkyil 'khor nang du ma 'phos mod kyi /
translated: In a well-polished mirror, the reflection of a face appears, and the face does not transfer into the mirror.

original: rgyu dang rkyen ma tshang ba med pa'i phyir bzhin du mngon pa yang yod do //
analyzed: rgyu dang rkyen ma tshang ba med pa'i phyir bzhin du mngon pa yang yod do //
translated: Because the causes and conditions are not incomplete, the face is also evident.

original: de bzhin du 'ga' yang 'di nas shi 'phos pa yang med la /
analyzed: de bzhin du 'ga' yang 'di nas shi 'phos pa yang med la /
translated: Likewise, there is no one who dies and transmigrates from here.🔽

original: pha rol tu skyes pa yang med mod kyi /
analyzed: pha rol tu skyes pa yang med mod kyi /
translated: Likewise, there is no one who dies here and is born over there.

original: rgyu dang rkyen ma tshang ba med pa'i phyir las kyi 'bras bur mngon pa yang yod do //
analyzed: rgyu dang rkyen ma tshang ba med pa'i phyir las kyi 'bras bur mngon pa yang yod do //
translated: But because the causes and conditions are not incomplete, the result of action is also evident.

original: de dag phan tshun rtog med cing //
analyzed: de dag phan tshun rtog med cing //
translated: They do not conceive of each other,

original: byed pa po dang lam rnams spangs //
analyzed: byed pa po dang lam rnams spangs //
translated: and they are devoid of agent and action.

original: de bzhin skye ba snang ba ni //
analyzed: de bzhin skye ba snang ba ni //
translated: Likewise, birth is apparent,

original: sngon 'phel bya ba'i rim pa las //
analyzed: sngon 'phel bya ba'i rim pa las //
translated: from the sequence of development in the past.

original: de dag ces bya ba ni /
analyzed: de dag ces bya ba ni /
translated: “ They” refers to

original: bzhin dang me long do ;
analyzed: bzhin dang me long do ;
translated: the face and the mirror.

original: / phan tshun zhes bya ba ni gcig la gcig go //
analyzed: / phan tshun zhes bya ba ni gcig la gcig go //
translated: “ Each other” means one in relation to the other.

original: rtog med ces bya ba ni rnam par rtog pa med pa'o //🔽byed pa po dang las rnams spangs //
analyzed: rtog med ces bya ba ni rnam par rtog pa med pa'o // byed pa po dang las rnams spangs //
translated: “ Do not conceive” means they do not conceive of each other.

original: zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “ And they are devoid of agent and action” means

original: de la byed pa po dang las med do //
analyzed: de la byed pa po dang las med do //
translated: that they are devoid of agent and action.

original: chad par mi 'gyur ram zhe na //
analyzed: chad par mi 'gyur ram zhe na //
translated: “ But is it not annihilation?”

original: de bzhin skye ba snang ba ni //
analyzed: de bzhin skye ba snang ba ni //
translated: “ Likewise, birth is apparent”

original: zhes smos so //
analyzed: zhes smos so //
translated: is stated.

original: ji ltar byed pa med pa'i bya ba dang las su 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar byed pa med pa'i bya ba dang las su 'gyur zhe na /
translated: How can there be action and agent without activity?

original: smras pa / sngon 'phel bya ba'i rim las so //
analyzed: smras pa / sngon 'phel bya ba'i rim las so //
translated: He replied: “From the stages of the process of increase in the past.”

original: ji ltar zla ba ring gnas pa //
analyzed: ji ltar zla ba ring gnas pa //
translated: Just as the moon appears

original: chu snod chung du'i nang du ni //
analyzed: chu snod chung du'i nang du ni //
translated: in a small vessel filled with water,

original: snang ste 'phos pa'ang ma yin la //
analyzed: snang ste 'phos pa'ang ma yin la //
translated: without moving,

original: bya ba dang ni las kyang yod //
analyzed: bya ba dang ni las kyang yod //
translated: there is action and there is karma.

original: de nyid kyi phyir bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir bka' stsal pa /
translated: Therefore, it was said:

original: dper na zla ba'i dkyil 'khor ni dpag tshad bzhi khri nyis stong na gnas te /
analyzed: dper na zla ba'i dkyil 'khor ni dpag tshad bzhi khri nyis stong na gnas te /
translated: For example, the orb of the moon is located forty-two thousand yojanas away,

original: 'on kyang snod chung du chus gang bar zla ba'i dkyil 'khor gyi gzugs brnyan snang yang zla ba'i dkyil 'khor ni gnas de na ma 'phos te /
analyzed: 'on kyang snod chung du chus gang bar zla ba'i dkyil 'khor gyi gzugs brnyan snang yang zla ba'i dkyil 'khor ni gnas de na ma 'phos te /
translated: but the reflection of the orb of the moon appears in a small vessel filled with water. The orb of the moon does not move to that location,

original: 'on kyang snod chung du chus gang ba'i nang du snang ste /
analyzed: 'on kyang snod chung du chus gang ba'i nang du snang ste /
translated: but the reflection of the orb of the moon appears in a small vessel filled with water.

original: rgyu dang rkyen ma tshang ba med pa'i phyir zla ba'i gzugs brnyan mngon pa yang @49b yod do //
analyzed: rgyu dang rkyen ma tshang ba med pa'i phyir zla ba'i gzugs brnyan mngon pa yang @49b yod do //
translated: Because the causes and conditions are not incomplete, the reflection of the moon appears.

original: de bzhin du 'di nas su yang shi 'phos pa dang / ma skyes mod kyi rgyu dang rkyen rnams ma tshang ba med pa'i phyir las kyi 'bras bur mngon pa yang yod do //
analyzed: de bzhin du 'di nas su yang shi 'phos pa dang / ma skyes mod kyi rgyu dang rkyen rnams ma tshang ba med pa'i phyir las kyi 'bras bur mngon pa yang yod do //
translated: In the same way, although no one dies here and no one is born there, still, because the causes and conditions are not incomplete, the effect of action is evident.

original: yang dper na me ni rgyu ma tshang na mi 'bar gyi rgyu dang rkyen tshogs pa las 'bar ro //
analyzed: yang dper na me ni rgyu ma tshang na mi 'bar gyi rgyu dang rkyen tshogs pa las 'bar ro //
translated: Again, for example, fire does not burn when its causes are incomplete, but it burns when the causes and conditions are assembled.

original: de bzhin du bdag po med pa'i chos 'dzin pa med pa phan tshun gyi rkyen can sgyu ma'i mtshan nyid kyi rang bzhin dag la rgyu dang rkyen ma tshang ba med pa'i phyir skye ba'i gnas nyid mtshams sbyor ba ma'i mngal de dang der sa bon rnam par
analyzed: de bzhin du bdag po med pa'i chos 'dzin pa med pa phan tshun gyi rkyen can sgyu ma'i mtshan nyid kyi rang bzhin dag la rgyu dang rkyen ma tshang ba med pa'i phyir skye ba'i gnas nyid mtshams sbyor ba ma'i mngal de dang der sa bon rnam par
translated: In the same way, in the absence of a self, in the absence of a possessor of attributes, in mutually dependent phenomena, which are by nature like a magical creation, the seed of consciousness, generated by action and reactive emotions, comes to growth in that and that birthplace, in that and that mother’s womb, due to the causes and conditions not being incomplete.

original: shes pa las dang nyon mongs pa rnams kyis bskyed pa'i ming dang gzugs kyi myu gu mngon par 'grub po //
analyzed: shes pa las dang nyon mongs pa rnams kyis bskyed pa'i ming dang gzugs kyi myu gu mngon par 'grub po //
translated: The sprout of name and form, generated by consciousness, comes to growth.

original: phyi yi las dang bya ba rgyu //
analyzed: phyi yi las dang bya ba rgyu //
translated: External action and activity are the cause.

original: de ni brtags pa'i bdag nyid do //
analyzed: de ni brtags pa'i bdag nyid do //
translated: That is the imagined nature.

original: de la phyi'i rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i bya ba dang / las su rnam par gzhag pa ni brtags pa'i bdag nyid du shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de la phyi'i rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i bya ba dang / las su rnam par gzhag pa ni brtags pa'i bdag nyid du shes par bya'o //
translated: The external dependent origination should be understood as having the nature of the imagined.

original: de bzhin gzhan dbang nang gi ste //
analyzed: de bzhin gzhan dbang nang gi ste //
translated: The other-dependent is internal.

original: rnam shes lnga po 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: rnam shes lnga po 'byung ba'o //
translated: The five consciousnesses arise from it.

original: de la gzhan gyi dbang gi rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i mtshan nyid ni nang gi ste /
analyzed: de la gzhan gyi dbang gi rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i mtshan nyid ni nang gi ste /
translated: The characteristic of the other-dependent dependent origination is internal.

original: dbang po lnga dang / yul gyi rnam par rig pa snang ba'i rnam pa can du rig par bya'o //🔽brtag bya min phyir don dam ni //
analyzed: dbang po lnga dang / yul gyi rnam par rig pa snang ba'i rnam pa can du rig par bya'o // brtag bya min phyir don dam ni //
translated: It should be understood as the five sense faculties and the five sense objects, which are the appearances of the aspects of consciousness.🔽The ultimate is the perfected,

original: yongs su grub par 'dod pa yin //
analyzed: yongs su grub par 'dod pa yin //
translated: because it is not imagined.

original: gang brtag pa dang gzhan gyi dbang gi bdag nyid kyi rnam pa'i rnam par rig pa snang ba'i rnam pa dang bral ba la rnam par rtog pa med pa shin tu yongs su dag pa /
analyzed: gang brtag pa dang gzhan gyi dbang gi bdag nyid kyi rnam pa'i rnam par rig pa snang ba'i rnam pa dang bral ba la rnam par rtog pa med pa shin tu yongs su dag pa /
translated: The perfected is the aspect of consciousness that is free from the appearance of the aspects of the imagined and the other-dependent, which are the objects of imagination. It is non-conceptual, completely pure,

original: chu'i khams dang / gser dang / nam mkha' lta bur yongs su dag pa /
analyzed: chu'i khams dang / gser dang / nam mkha' lta bur yongs su dag pa /
translated: and completely purified like water, gold, and space.

original: nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa'i ngo bo yongs su dag pa /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa'i ngo bo yongs su dag pa /
translated: It is the essence of the afflictive and cognitive obscurations, which are completely purified.

original: zla ba shar ba lta bur yon tan bsam gyis mi khyab pa /
analyzed: zla ba shar ba lta bur yon tan bsam gyis mi khyab pa /
translated: Like the rising moon, it has inconceivable qualities.

original: gzhal du med pa'i 'od zer snang ba'i bdag nyid can 'phos pa med pa /
analyzed: gzhal du med pa'i 'od zer snang ba'i bdag nyid can 'phos pa med pa /
translated: It is the nature of the light of immeasurable rays, which is not transferred.

original: sems can thams cad kyi don lhun gyis grub par rgyun mi 'chad par mdzad pa /
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyi don lhun gyis grub par rgyun mi 'chad par mdzad pa /
translated: It spontaneously and uninterruptedly accomplishes the welfare of all sentient beings.

original: thog ma dang dbus dang tha ma dang bral ba /
analyzed: thog ma dang dbus dang tha ma dang bral ba /
translated: It is free from beginning, middle, and end.

original: khams gsum las yang dag par 'das pa /
analyzed: khams gsum las yang dag par 'das pa /
translated: It is completely beyond the three realms.

original: dri ma dang bral ba /
analyzed: dri ma dang bral ba /
translated: It is free from stains.

original: dri ma med pa /
analyzed: dri ma med pa /
translated: It is stainless.

original: dri ma spangs pa'i ngo bo //
analyzed: dri ma spangs pa'i ngo bo //
translated: It is the essence of the abandonment of stains.

original: so so rang gis rtog pa'i spyod yul gyi bdag nyid lus dang / ngag dang / yid kyi sa las yang dag par 'das pa /
analyzed: so so rang gis rtog pa'i spyod yul gyi bdag nyid lus dang / ngag dang / yid kyi sa las yang dag par 'das pa /
translated: It is the object of individual knowledge, the nature that is beyond the level of body, speech, and mind.

original: so so rang gis rig pa /
analyzed: so so rang gis rig pa /
translated: It is individually realized.

original: gzhan la rag ma las pa /
analyzed: gzhan la rag ma las pa /
translated: It is not dependent on others.

original: gzugs sna tshogs kyi nor bu rin po che'i rgyal po lta bu ste /
analyzed: gzugs sna tshogs kyi nor bu rin po che'i rgyal po lta bu ste /
translated: It is like the king of precious jewels with various forms.

original: bla na med pa'i chos kyi sku zhes bya'o //
analyzed: bla na med pa'i chos kyi sku zhes bya'o //
translated: It is called the unsurpassed dharma body.

original: rgyu dang rkyen dang ldan skye ba //
analyzed: rgyu dang rkyen dang ldan skye ba //
translated: Arising endowed with causes and conditions

original: nam yang rnam gnyis shes par bya //
analyzed: nam yang rnam gnyis shes par bya //
translated: Should always be understood in two ways.

original: @50a * // byed pa po la sogs pas dben //
analyzed: @50a * // byed pa po la sogs pas dben //
translated: It is devoid of an agent and so forth,

original: gsog gsob stong sogs snying po med //
analyzed: gsog gsob stong sogs snying po med //
translated: Hollow, void, insubstantial, and so forth.

original: de nyid kyi phyir de la nang gi rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba rgyu lngar blta ste zhes bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir de la nang gi rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba rgyu lngar blta ste zhes bya ba gsungs so //
translated: Therefore, it is said, “The internal dependent origination should be seen in terms of five causes.”

original: gang zhe na /
analyzed: gang zhe na /
translated: What are they?

original: gsungs pa / rtag par ma yin te /
analyzed: gsungs pa / rtag par ma yin te /
translated: It is said, “It is not permanent,

original: gang gi phyir tha ma 'chi ba'i phung po rnams kyang gzhan la /
analyzed: gang gi phyir tha ma 'chi ba'i phung po rnams kyang gzhan la /
translated: Because the aggregates at the time of death are one thing,

original: skye ba'i char gtogs pa rnams kyang gzhan te /
analyzed: skye ba'i char gtogs pa rnams kyang gzhan te /
translated: And those at birth are another.

original: tha ma 'chi ba'i phung po gang yin pa de nyid skye ba'i char gtogs pa rnams ma yin no //
analyzed: tha ma 'chi ba'i phung po gang yin pa de nyid skye ba'i char gtogs pa rnams ma yin no //
translated: The aggregates at the time of death are not the same as those at birth.

original: skyed par byed pa'i rgyu gang yin pa de nyid 'jig par byed pa yin la /
analyzed: skyed par byed pa'i rgyu gang yin pa de nyid 'jig par byed pa yin la /
translated: The cause that produces is the same as that which destroys.

original: 'jig par byed pa'i rgyu gang yin pa de nyid kyang skyed par byed pa yin par 'gyur du 'ong bas tha ma 'chi ba'i phung po rnams kyang 'gags la /
analyzed: 'jig par byed pa'i rgyu gang yin pa de nyid kyang skyed par byed pa yin par 'gyur du 'ong bas tha ma 'chi ba'i phung po rnams kyang 'gags la /
translated: It would follow that the cause of destruction would also be the cause of production.

original: skye ba'i char gtogs pa'i phung po rnams kyang 'byung bas de'i phyir rtag par ma yin no //
analyzed: skye ba'i char gtogs pa'i phung po rnams kyang 'byung bas de'i phyir rtag par ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, because the aggregates at death cease and the aggregates at birth arise, the self is not permanent.🔽The aggregates at death do not arise from those that have already ceased,

original: tha ma 'chi ba'i phung po rnams sngon 'gags pa las ma yin zhes bya ba ni 'gags nas yun ring du lon pa las ma yin pa /
analyzed: tha ma 'chi ba'i phung po rnams sngon 'gags pa las ma yin zhes bya ba ni 'gags nas yun ring du lon pa las ma yin pa /
translated: that is, from those that have already ceased a long time ago.

original: skye ba'i char gtogs pa zhes bya ba ni skye ba'i cha la brten pas na skye ba'i cha la gtogs pa ste /
analyzed: skye ba'i char gtogs pa zhes bya ba ni skye ba'i cha la brten pas na skye ba'i cha la gtogs pa ste /
translated: The aggregates at birth are called “those that belong to birth” because they are based on the part of birth.

original: phung po rnams 'byung bar 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: phung po rnams 'byung bar 'gyur ba'o //
translated: They are the aggregates that arise.🔽It would be illogical for the aggregates at birth to arise when the aggregates at death have not ceased.

original: tha ma 'chi ba ma 'gags pa kho nar skye ba'i char gtogs pa'i phung po dag 'byung bar 'gyur na mi rung bas bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: tha ma 'chi ba ma 'gags pa kho nar skye ba'i char gtogs pa'i phung po dag 'byung bar 'gyur na mi rung bas bka' stsal pa /
translated: Therefore, the Buddha said,🔽The aggregates at death cease

original: tha ma 'chi ba'i phung po rnams kyang 'gags la /
analyzed: tha ma 'chi ba'i phung po rnams kyang 'gags la /
translated: and the aggregates at birth arise.

original: de nyid kyi tshe skye ba'i char gtogs pa'i phung po rnams srang mda'i mthon dman bzhin du 'byung bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de nyid kyi tshe skye ba'i char gtogs pa'i phung po rnams srang mda'i mthon dman bzhin du 'byung bar 'gyur te /
translated: At that time, the aggregates that are part of birth arise like the swing of a balance arm.

original: de'i phyir chad par ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir chad par ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is not annihilation.

original: sems can gyi ris mi 'dra ba nas skal ba mnyam pa'i skye bar skye ba gzhan mngon par 'grub pas de'i phyir 'pho bar ma yin no //
analyzed: sems can gyi ris mi 'dra ba nas skal ba mnyam pa'i skye bar skye ba gzhan mngon par 'grub pas de'i phyir 'pho bar ma yin no //
translated: Since birth in another life is produced in a different class of sentient beings, it is not transference.

original: las chung du byas pas 'bras bu chen po'i rnam par smin pa myong ste /
analyzed: las chung du byas pas 'bras bu chen po'i rnam par smin pa myong ste /
translated: A small action produces a great result.

original: de'i phyir rgyu chung du las 'bras bu chen po mngon par 'grub bo //
analyzed: de'i phyir rgyu chung du las 'bras bu chen po mngon par 'grub bo //
translated: Therefore, a small cause produces a great result.

original: ji ltar myong bar 'gyur ba'i las bsags pa de lta bu myong bar 'gyur ba'i rnam par smin pa myong bas de'i phyir de dang 'dra ba'i rgyud du'o //
analyzed: ji ltar myong bar 'gyur ba'i las bsags pa de lta bu myong bar 'gyur ba'i rnam par smin pa myong bas de'i phyir de dang 'dra ba'i rgyud du'o //
translated: Since the experience of the result of evolution of an action is in accordance with the accumulation of the action, therefore, it is a similar stream.

original: gang gis rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba 'di la yang dag pa'i shes rab kyis de ltar yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du /
analyzed: gang gis rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba 'di la yang dag pa'i shes rab kyis de ltar yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du /
translated: One who, by means of correct wisdom, sees dependent origination in this way, as it really is,

original: rtag par rgyun du srog med pa dang / ji lta bu nyid dang / ma nor ba nyid dang / ma skyes pa dang / ma byung ba dang / ma byas pa dang / 'dus ma byas ba dang / thogs pa med pa dang / dmigs pa med pa dang /
analyzed: rtag par rgyun du srog med pa dang / ji lta bu nyid dang / ma nor ba nyid dang / ma skyes pa dang / ma byung ba dang / ma byas pa dang / 'dus ma byas ba dang / thogs pa med pa dang / dmigs pa med pa dang /
translated: It is always and continuously without life force, suchness, non-erroneousness, unborn, unarisen, uncreated, unconditioned, unobstructed, non-apprehensible,

original: zhi ba dang / mi 'phrogs pa dang / rnam par zhi ba ma yin pa'i @50b rang bzhin dang / med pa dang / gsog dang / gsob dang / snying po med pa dang / nad dang / 'bras dang / sdig pa dang / mi rtag pa dang /
analyzed: zhi ba dang / mi 'phrogs pa dang / rnam par zhi ba ma yin pa'i @50b rang bzhin dang / med pa dang / gsog dang / gsob dang / snying po med pa dang / nad dang / 'bras dang / sdig pa dang / mi rtag pa dang /
translated: peaceful, unassailable, not by nature thoroughly pacified, non-existent, hollow, void, insubstantial, a disease, an abscess, a thorn, impermanent,

original: sdug bsngal ba dang / stong pa dang / bdag med par mthong ba zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: sdug bsngal ba dang / stong pa dang / bdag med par mthong ba zhes bya ba la /
translated: suffering, empty, and without self.

original: gang gis rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba 'di la zhes bya ba ni nang gi rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba gang yin pa 'di la'o //
analyzed: gang gis rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba 'di la zhes bya ba ni nang gi rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba gang yin pa 'di la'o //
translated: As for “one sees dependent origination as it really is,” this refers to the inner dependent origination.

original: yang dag pa'i zhes bya ba ni phyin ci ma log pa'i'o //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i zhes bya ba ni phyin ci ma log pa'i'o //
translated: “Correctly” means without error.

original: shes rab kyis zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'i shes rab kyis so //
analyzed: shes rab kyis zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'i shes rab kyis so //
translated: “By wisdom” means by supramundane wisdom.

original: yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du zhes bya ba ni de kho na nyid ji lta bar ro //
analyzed: yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du zhes bya ba ni de kho na nyid ji lta bar ro //
translated: “Just as it is” means just as it is in reality.

original: rtag par rgyun du zhes bya ba ni dus thams cad du rgyun mi 'chad par ro //
analyzed: rtag par rgyun du zhes bya ba ni dus thams cad du rgyun mi 'chad par ro //
translated: “Always” means at all times, without interruption.

original: srog med pa zhes bya ba ni srog dang byed pa la sogs pa dang bral ba'i phyir srog med pa'o //
analyzed: srog med pa zhes bya ba ni srog dang byed pa la sogs pa dang bral ba'i phyir srog med pa'o //
translated: “Without life” means without life, without an agent, and so on.

original: ma skyes pa zhes bya ba ni skye ba dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma skyes pa zhes bya ba ni skye ba dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
translated: “Unborn” means free from arising.

original: ma byung ba zhes bya ba ni gnas pa dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma byung ba zhes bya ba ni gnas pa dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
translated: “Not come into existence” means free from abiding.

original: ma byas pa zhes bya ba ni byed pa po med pa'i phyir ro //🔽'dus ma byas pa zhes bya ba ni 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma byas pa zhes bya ba ni byed pa po med pa'i phyir ro // 'dus ma byas pa zhes bya ba ni 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
translated: “Not made” means without a maker.🔽“Unconditioned” means free from the characteristics of the conditioned.

original: thogs pa med pa zhes bya ba ni sgrib pa dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thogs pa med pa zhes bya ba ni sgrib pa dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
translated: “Unimpeded” means free from obscurations.

original: dmigs pa med pa zhes bya ba ni dmigs par bya ba dang dmigs par byed pa dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dmigs pa med pa zhes bya ba ni dmigs par bya ba dang dmigs par byed pa dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
translated: “Signless” means free from the object of signs and the act of signing.

original: zhi ba zhes bya ba ni zhi ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: zhi ba zhes bya ba ni zhi ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: “Peaceful” means just peace.

original: 'jigs pa med pa zhes bya ba ni skye ba la sogs pa'i 'jigs pa dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'jigs pa med pa zhes bya ba ni skye ba la sogs pa'i 'jigs pa dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
translated: “Fearless” means free from the fear of birth, etc.

original: mi 'phrogs pa zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa'i gzhan dbang dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi 'phrogs pa zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa'i gzhan dbang dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
translated: “Unconquerable” means free from the control of the addictions.

original: mi zad pa zhes bya ba ni rtag tu rnam par gnas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi zad pa zhes bya ba ni rtag tu rnam par gnas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: “Imperishable” means always abiding.

original: rnam par zhi ba ma yin zhes bya ba ni gcig tu zhi ba'i bgrod pa dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par zhi ba ma yin zhes bya ba ni gcig tu zhi ba'i bgrod pa dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
translated: “Not quieted” means free from the course of complete quiet.

original: med pa zhes bya ba ni phung po las gud na gzhan med pa'i phyir ro //🔽gsog ces bya ba ni grol ba'i bdag lcags thur lta bu gcig pur med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: med pa zhes bya ba ni phung po las gud na gzhan med pa'i phyir ro // gsog ces bya ba ni grol ba'i bdag lcags thur lta bu gcig pur med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: “Nonexistent” means not existing apart from the aggregates.🔽“Hollow” means not existing as a single, liberated self, like a bamboo.

original: gsob ces bya ba ni nang na 'dus pa'i ngo bo bdag gi rdzas med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gsob ces bya ba ni nang na 'dus pa'i ngo bo bdag gi rdzas med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: “Empty” means not existing as a substantial self, like a mass of foam.

original: snying po med pa zhes bya ba ni 'phro ba'i bdag nyed med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: snying po med pa zhes bya ba ni 'phro ba'i bdag nyed med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: “Without essence” means that the nature of its dispersion does not exist.

original: nad ces bya ba ni nad kyi bdag nyid phung po las gud na med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nad ces bya ba ni nad kyi bdag nyid phung po las gud na med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: “Disease” means that the nature of disease does not exist apart from the aggregates.

original: 'bras zhes bya ba ni phung po las ma gtogs pa gnod bar byed pa gzhan med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'bras zhes bya ba ni phung po las ma gtogs pa gnod bar byed pa gzhan med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: “Blight” means that there is no other harm apart from the aggregates.

original: sdig pa zhes bya ba ni las dang nyon mongs pa las gud na gnod pa'i ngo bo gzhan med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sdig pa zhes bya ba ni las dang nyon mongs pa las gud na gnod pa'i ngo bo gzhan med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: “Evil” means that there is no other nature of harm apart from action and affliction.

original: mi rtag pa zhes bya ba ni skyes ma thag tu 'jig pa ste /🔽phung po las @51a * //
analyzed: mi rtag pa zhes bya ba ni skyes ma thag tu 'jig pa ste / phung po las @51a * //
translated: “Impermanent” means that it perishes as soon as it arises.

original: gud na gzhan med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gud na gzhan med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It does not exist apart from the aggregates.

original: sdug bsngal zhes bya ba ni 'du byed dang 'gyur ba'i sdug bsngal las gung na med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sdug bsngal zhes bya ba ni 'du byed dang 'gyur ba'i sdug bsngal las gung na med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: “Suffering” means that it does not exist apart from the suffering of the formations and the suffering of change.

original: stong pa zhes bya ba ni brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid yang dag pa ma yin pa'i kun tu rtog pa las gud na med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: stong pa zhes bya ba ni brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid yang dag pa ma yin pa'i kun tu rtog pa las gud na med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: “Empty” means that it does not exist apart from the imagined nature, which is a false imagination.

original: bdag med pa zhes bya ba ni phung po las ma gtogs pa bdag gi rdzas med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag med pa zhes bya ba ni phung po las ma gtogs pa bdag gi rdzas med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Non-self means that there is no substance of a self apart from the aggregates.

original: byed pa po la sogs pas dben //
analyzed: byed pa po la sogs pas dben //
translated: It is devoid of an agent and so forth.

original: gsob gsog stong sogs snying po med //
analyzed: gsob gsog stong sogs snying po med //
translated: It is hollow, false, empty, and so forth, without essence.

original: de ltar shes rab kyis mthong gang //🔽ci cir ci ltar gang du cis //
analyzed: de ltar shes rab kyis mthong gang // ci cir ci ltar gang du cis //
translated: That which is seen by wisdom🔽Is not thought, speech, and so forth.

original: snyam pa'i rtog smra sogs spangs pa //
analyzed: snyam pa'i rtog smra sogs spangs pa //
translated: It is free from the thought, “What? How? Where? Why?”

original: yon tan mtha' yas bsam mi khyab //
analyzed: yon tan mtha' yas bsam mi khyab //
translated: It has infinite, inconceivable qualities.

original: zhi ba chos kyi rang bzhin sku //
analyzed: zhi ba chos kyi rang bzhin sku //
translated: The peaceful body of reality is its nature.

original: de bzhin nyid kyi phyir de ni //
analyzed: de bzhin nyid kyi phyir de ni //
translated: Because it is suchness,

original: sngon gyi mtha' la mi rtog go //
analyzed: sngon gyi mtha' la mi rtog go //
translated: It is not imagined in the past.

original: zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: zhes gsungs te /
translated: This is what is said.

original: ci bdag 'das pa'i dus na byung bar 'gyur ram snyam pa'i rmongs pa 'di la mi skye'o //
analyzed: ci bdag 'das pa'i dus na byung bar 'gyur ram snyam pa'i rmongs pa 'di la mi skye'o //
translated: The delusion, “Did I exist in the past?” does not arise for them.🔽Because wisdom arises for those who are not deluded, they do not think, “In the past, did I have such a form?” and so forth.

original: ma rmongs pa la ye shes skye ba'i phyir bdag 'das pa'i dus na mi 'di lta bur 'gyur ram snyam pa la sogs pa dang / bdag lha'am /
analyzed: ma rmongs pa la ye shes skye ba'i phyir bdag 'das pa'i dus na mi 'di lta bur 'gyur ram snyam pa la sogs pa dang / bdag lha'am /
translated: They do not think, “Was I a god,🔽a ghost, or a human?”

original: sha za'am / bde bar gnas pa'am /
analyzed: sha za'am / bde bar gnas pa'am /
translated: They do not think, “Did I live happily,🔽or did I live unhappily?”

original: sdug bsngal bar gnas pa cir 'gyur ram snyam pa'i rmongs pa med pa nyid do //🔽bdag bde 'gro'am /🔽ngan 'gro'am / yun ring ba'am /
analyzed: sdug bsngal bar gnas pa cir 'gyur ram snyam pa'i rmongs pa med pa nyid do // bdag bde 'gro'am / ngan 'gro'am / yun ring ba'am /
translated: There is no confusion about what will happen when one is in a state of suffering.🔽There is no confusion about whether one will go to a good or bad rebirth.

original: yun thung ba ji ltar 'gyur snyam pa'i rmongs pa yang med pa nyid ngo ;🔽/ ma 'ongs pa'i mtha' la mi rtog ste /
analyzed: yun thung ba ji ltar 'gyur snyam pa'i rmongs pa yang med pa nyid ngo ; / ma 'ongs pa'i mtha' la mi rtog ste /
translated: There is no confusion about whether it will be long or short.🔽There is no confusion about what will happen in the future.

original: ci ma 'ongs pa'i dus na 'byung bar 'gyur ram snyam pa dang / 'on te 'byung bar mi 'gyur snyam pa'i rmongs pa yang 'di la med pa nyid do //🔽ma 'ongs pa'i dus na cir 'gyur snyam pa ma 'ongs pa'i dus na lha'am /
analyzed: ci ma 'ongs pa'i dus na 'byung bar 'gyur ram snyam pa dang / 'on te 'byung bar mi 'gyur snyam pa'i rmongs pa yang 'di la med pa nyid do // ma 'ongs pa'i dus na cir 'gyur snyam pa ma 'ongs pa'i dus na lha'am /
translated: There is no confusion about whether or not one will exist in the future.🔽There is no confusion about what will happen in the future.🔽There is no confusion about whether one will be a god,

original: sha za'am / mi cir 'gyur snyam pa'i rmongs pa yang 'di la mi 'byung ba nyid do //🔽bde ba'am / sdug bsngal ba'am /🔽gzugs bzang ba'am /
analyzed: sha za'am / mi cir 'gyur snyam pa'i rmongs pa yang 'di la mi 'byung ba nyid do // bde ba'am / sdug bsngal ba'am / gzugs bzang ba'am /
translated: a ghost, or a human in the future.🔽There is no confusion about whether one will be happy or suffering.

original: gzugs ngan pa ji ltar 'gyur snyam pa'i rmongs pa yang 'di la med do //
analyzed: gzugs ngan pa ji ltar 'gyur snyam pa'i rmongs pa yang 'di la med do //
translated: There is no confusion about whether one will be beautiful or ugly.🔽There is no confusion about what will happen in the future.

original: nang la yang mi rtog go zhes bya ba ni nang la rmongs par mi 'gyur ba ste /🔽'di ci zhig ces bya ba ni bdag gam bdag med snyam pa'o //🔽'di ji lta bu zhig ces bya ba ci gzugs can nam /
analyzed: nang la yang mi rtog go zhes bya ba ni nang la rmongs par mi 'gyur ba ste / 'di ci zhig ces bya ba ni bdag gam bdag med snyam pa'o // 'di ji lta bu zhig ces bya ba ci gzugs can nam /
translated: He does not speculate about the past, future, and present.

original: 'on te gzugs can ma yin pa zhig snyam pa'i rmongs pa yang 'di la mi 'byung ngo //🔽ci zhig yod ces bya ba ni legs par byas pa'i las byas pa'am /
analyzed: 'on te gzugs can ma yin pa zhig snyam pa'i rmongs pa yang 'di la mi 'byung ngo // ci zhig yod ces bya ba ni legs par byas pa'i las byas pa'am /
translated: He does not speculate about what is within the range of experience of the eye, ear, nose, tongue, body, and thought.🔽He does not speculate about what is seen, heard, sensed, or known.

original: nyes par byas pa'i las byas pa snyam pa'i rmongs pa yang 'di la mi skye'o //
analyzed: nyes par byas pa'i las byas pa snyam pa'i rmongs pa yang 'di la mi skye'o //
translated: He does not speculate about what is attained, sought, or pondered by the mind.🔽He does not speculate about the cosmos.🔽He does not speculate about beings.

original: @51b sems can 'di lha'i 'gro ba'am /
analyzed: @51b sems can 'di lha'i 'gro ba'am /
translated: He does not speculate about life.🔽He does not speculate about the world.🔽He does not speculate about the internal.🔽He does not speculate about the external.🔽He does not speculate about the internal and external.🔽He does not speculate about the past, future, and present.🔽He does not speculate about what is within the range of experience of the eye, ear, nose, tongue, body, and thought.🔽He does not speculate about what is seen, heard, sensed, or known.🔽He does not speculate about what is attained, sought, or pondered by the mind.🔽He does not speculate about the cosmos.🔽He does not speculate about beings.🔽He does not speculate about life.

original: mi'i 'gro ba gang nas 'ongs te 'di nas shi 'phos nas lha rnams sam mi rnams sam /
analyzed: mi'i 'gro ba gang nas 'ongs te 'di nas shi 'phos nas lha rnams sam mi rnams sam /
translated: He does not speculate about the world.🔽He does not speculate about the internal.🔽He does not speculate about the external.🔽He does not speculate about the internal and external.🔽He does not speculate about the past, future, and present.

original: dmyal ba'am / yi dags dang / dud 'gro gang du 'gro bar 'gyur snyam pa'i rmongs pa yang 'di la mi 'byung ngo //
analyzed: dmyal ba'am / yi dags dang / dud 'gro gang du 'gro bar 'gyur snyam pa'i rmongs pa yang 'di la mi 'byung ngo //
translated: He does not speculate about what is within the range of experience of the eye, ear, nose, tongue, body, and thought.🔽He does not speculate about what is seen, heard, sensed, or known.🔽He does not speculate about what is attained, sought, or pondered by the mind.🔽He does not speculate about the cosmos.🔽He does not speculate about beings.🔽He does not speculate about life.🔽He does not speculate about the world.

original: 'jig rten na dge sbyong ngam /
analyzed: 'jig rten na dge sbyong ngam /
translated: He does not speculate about the internal.🔽He does not speculate about the external.🔽He does not speculate about the internal and external.🔽He does not speculate about the past, future, and present.🔽He does not speculate about what is within the range of experience of the eye, ear, nose, tongue, body, and thought.🔽He does not speculate about what is seen, heard, sensed, or known.🔽He does not speculate

original: bram ze dag gi lta bar gyur pa tha dad pa gang dag yod par 'gyur ba zhes bya ba la lta bar gyur pa zhes bya ba ni lta ba'i gnas so //
analyzed: bram ze dag gi lta bar gyur pa tha dad pa gang dag yod par 'gyur ba zhes bya ba la lta bar gyur pa zhes bya ba ni lta ba'i gnas so //
translated: The Brahmins have various views, which are called “views” because they are the basis of views.

original: tha dad pa zhes bya ba ni so so ba'o //
analyzed: tha dad pa zhes bya ba ni so so ba'o //
translated: “ Various” means different.

original: 'di lta ste zhes pa ni bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di lta ste zhes pa ni bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: “ For example” is stated to indicate.

original: bdag tu smra ba dang ldan pa zhes bya ba ni phung po las ma gtogs par bdag med de /
analyzed: bdag tu smra ba dang ldan pa zhes bya ba ni phung po las ma gtogs par bdag med de /
translated: “ Endowed with the doctrine of self” means that there is no self apart from the aggregates.

original: ma dpyad par bdag dang bdag gi zhes bya ba'i ngo bor bdag tu 'dzin pa dang ldan pa'i phyir bdag tu smra ba dang ldan pa zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: ma dpyad par bdag dang bdag gi zhes bya ba'i ngo bor bdag tu 'dzin pa dang ldan pa'i phyir bdag tu smra ba dang ldan pa zhes gsungs te /
translated: Since the self is grasped as the nature of the self and entities connected to the self without analysis, it is said to be “endowed with the doctrine of self.”

original: phyin ci log tu 'dzin pas kun nas bslang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phyin ci log tu 'dzin pas kun nas bslang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because it is motivated by the grasping of the inverted views.

original: gang zag tu smra ba dang ldan pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni yang 'gro ba'i phyir gang zag ces bya ba phung po las ma gtogs pa gang 'jig rten 'di spangs nas 'jig rten pha rol du 'gro ba'am /
analyzed: gang zag tu smra ba dang ldan pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni yang 'gro ba'i phyir gang zag ces bya ba phung po las ma gtogs pa gang 'jig rten 'di spangs nas 'jig rten pha rol du 'gro ba'am /
translated: “ Endowed with the doctrine of the person” and so on. Since the person is said to be that which transmigrates, it is the person, which is not separate from the aggregates, that abandons this world and transmigrates to the next world.

original: 'jig rten pha rol spangs nas 'jig rten 'dir 'ongs pa yod pa ma yin pas 'dzin pa dang / ngan pa phyin ci log gi 'dzin pa zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: 'jig rten pha rol spangs nas 'jig rten 'dir 'ongs pa yod pa ma yin pas 'dzin pa dang / ngan pa phyin ci log gi 'dzin pa zhes gsungs so //
translated: Since there is no coming to this world from another world, it is grasping. It is also called “evil grasping” and “grasping at what is wrong.”

original: dge mtshan dang bkra shis su ldan pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: dge mtshan dang bkra shis su ldan pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: Endowed with auspicious signs and good fortune.

original: dge mtshan ni 'jig rten bzo'i gnas dang / rig pa'i gnas rnam pa sna tshogs gang dag yin pa dga' ston dang / bag ma gtong ba dang / bag ma len pa dang / 'thab mo dang / g-yul dang / skyed mos tshal dang / chu klung dang /
analyzed: dge mtshan ni 'jig rten bzo'i gnas dang / rig pa'i gnas rnam pa sna tshogs gang dag yin pa dga' ston dang / bag ma gtong ba dang / bag ma len pa dang / 'thab mo dang / g-yul dang / skyed mos tshal dang / chu klung dang /
translated: Auspicious signs are the various worldly arts and sciences, such as festivals, giving away a daughter, taking a wife, fighting, battles, parks, rivers,

original: rgya mtsho dang / ri dang / tshal dang / 'phags pa'i gzhan de dang de dag tu 'gro ba dang / lta ba dang / 'pho ba dang / 'jug pa dang / gnas pa'i rjes su dga' ba rtse ba'i bde ba myong ba'i gar dang /
analyzed: rgya mtsho dang / ri dang / tshal dang / 'phags pa'i gzhan de dang de dag tu 'gro ba dang / lta ba dang / 'pho ba dang / 'jug pa dang / gnas pa'i rjes su dga' ba rtse ba'i bde ba myong ba'i gar dang /
translated: oceans, mountains, forests, going to this and that holy place, seeing, moving, entering, and experiencing the pleasure of sporting in the joy of staying.

original: glu dang / tshig tu smra ba dang / rgyug pa dang / mchong ba dang / tshar dang / skyes pa dang / bud med dang / khye'u dang / bu mor 'gyed pa'i gtam dang / rtsod pa dang / lde'u brjod pa dang / glang po che dang /
analyzed: glu dang / tshig tu smra ba dang / rgyug pa dang / mchong ba dang / tshar dang / skyes pa dang / bud med dang / khye'u dang / bu mor 'gyed pa'i gtam dang / rtsod pa dang / lde'u brjod pa dang / glang po che dang /
translated: singing, speaking, running, jumping, and so on;

original: rta la sogs pa 'thab pa dang / rtsva d'ur ba dang / zho dang / gi'u wang dang / zhing gshol dang / tho ba dang / me tog dang / 'bras bu dang / bum pa dang / dung dang / nya la sogs pa dang /
analyzed: rta la sogs pa 'thab pa dang / rtsva d'ur ba dang / zho dang / gi'u wang dang / zhing gshol dang / tho ba dang / me tog dang / 'bras bu dang / bum pa dang / dung dang / nya la sogs pa dang /
translated: men, women, boys, and girls; disputes, stories, and so on; elephants, horses, and so on fighting; grass, curd, chalk, fields, plows, hammers, flowers, fruits, pots, conches, fish, and so on;

original: bram ze dang / khyu mchog dang / zla ba dang / nyi ma dang / gza' dang / skar ma @52a * //
analyzed: bram ze dang / khyu mchog dang / zla ba dang / nyi ma dang / gza' dang / skar ma @52a * //
translated: brahmins, bulls, the moon, the sun, planets, stars, and so on;

original: dang ; rgyu skar dang // yud tsam dang / sbyor ba dang / byed pa la sogs pa ste ltas mkhan la sogs pa bdag nyid dang dag pa tshol ba dang / phyin ci log rnam pa du ma'i 'phyang thag la 'ju zhing lam ma yin pa la lam du 'du shes pa dang /
analyzed: dang ; rgyu skar dang // yud tsam dang / sbyor ba dang / byed pa la sogs pa ste ltas mkhan la sogs pa bdag nyid dang dag pa tshol ba dang / phyin ci log rnam pa du ma'i 'phyang thag la 'ju zhing lam ma yin pa la lam du 'du shes pa dang /
translated: Those who are attached to the ropes of many different kinds of mistaken views, who perceive a path where there is no path,

original: ma dag pa la dag par 'du shes pa dang / ma grol ba la grol bar 'du shes pas 'gro ba drug gi 'khor lor zhugs pa'i blo gros can 'gro ba dang 'gro bar gyur pa rnams ni 'khor ba kho na'i rjes su 'brang gi /
analyzed: ma dag pa la dag par 'du shes pa dang / ma grol ba la grol bar 'du shes pas 'gro ba drug gi 'khor lor zhugs pa'i blo gros can 'gro ba dang 'gro bar gyur pa rnams ni 'khor ba kho na'i rjes su 'brang gi /
translated: who perceive purity where there is no purity, and who perceive freedom where there is no freedom, and who are intelligent, who have entered the wheel of the six existences, and who have become wanderers, follow only saṃsāra.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa'i ni ma yin no zhes de dag yang dag pa'i shes rab kyis mthong ba na phyin ci log rnam pa bzhi dang bral ba'i phyir rtsa ba nas bcad de /
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa'i ni ma yin no zhes de dag yang dag pa'i shes rab kyis mthong ba na phyin ci log rnam pa bzhi dang bral ba'i phyir rtsa ba nas bcad de /
translated: They do not follow nirvāṇa. When they see that with correct wisdom, they are free from the four mistaken views and are cut off at the root.

original: de mi snang bar gyur cing spangs pa yin pas yongs su shes nas rtsa ba nas bcad de /
analyzed: de mi snang bar gyur cing spangs pa yin pas yongs su shes nas rtsa ba nas bcad de /
translated: Since they do not appear and are abandoned, they are known and cut off at the root.

original: shing ta la'i mgo bzhin mi snang ba'i rang bzhin du phyis mi skye mi 'gag pa'i chos su 'gyur ro zhes bya'o //
analyzed: shing ta la'i mgo bzhin mi snang ba'i rang bzhin du phyis mi skye mi 'gag pa'i chos su 'gyur ro zhes bya'o //
translated: It is like the top of a palm tree, which does not arise or cease as a phenomenon that does not appear again.

original: de nyid kyi phyir smras pa /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir smras pa /
translated: Therefore, it is said:

original: de bzhin 'di nas 'chi 'pho pa //
analyzed: de bzhin 'di nas 'chi 'pho pa //
translated: Likewise, there is no one who dies here

original: 'ga' med 'gro bar skyes pa'ang snang //
analyzed: 'ga' med 'gro bar skyes pa'ang snang //
translated: and is seen to be born in another world.

original: de nyid kyi phyir dpe brjod pa ;🔽/ ji ltar bud shing dang 'brel ba //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir dpe brjod pa ; / ji ltar bud shing dang 'brel ba //
translated: Therefore, an example is given:🔽Just as the stream of fire

original: me yi rgyun ni 'jug 'gyur gyi //🔽rgyu ni ma tshang gyur pa las //
analyzed: me yi rgyun ni 'jug 'gyur gyi // rgyu ni ma tshang gyur pa las //
translated: is seen to move in dependence on fuel,🔽but not when the cause is incomplete,

original: me yi rjes su 'jug pa min //🔽de bzhin zhes bya ba ni ji ltar zla ba'i gzugs thag ring po na gnas nas kyang chu'i snod chung ngu 'am /
analyzed: me yi rjes su 'jug pa min // de bzhin zhes bya ba ni ji ltar zla ba'i gzugs thag ring po na gnas nas kyang chu'i snod chung ngu 'am /
translated: so it is for the stream of consciousness.🔽Just as the form of the moon is seen in a small vessel of water or in a large vessel of water,

original: chu dang til mar gyi snod chen po dang / du ma dag tu yang snang ba zla ba'i gzugs 'phos pa'am /
analyzed: chu dang til mar gyi snod chen po dang / du ma dag tu yang snang ba zla ba'i gzugs 'phos pa'am /
translated: or in many vessels of water, even though the moon does not move or become multiple,

original: du ma nyid kyang med mod kyi /
analyzed: du ma nyid kyang med mod kyi /
translated: and yet the moon is not multiple,

original: 'on kyang chu'i snod du ma dag tu snang ngo //
analyzed: 'on kyang chu'i snod du ma dag tu snang ngo //
translated: and yet the moon is seen in many vessels of water,🔽so it is for this world.

original: de bzhin du 'di nas 'ga' yang shi 'phos pa yang med /
analyzed: de bzhin du 'di nas 'ga' yang shi 'phos pa yang med /
translated: There is no one who dies here🔽and is seen to be born in another world.

original: song ba yang med /
analyzed: song ba yang med /
translated: There is no going,

original: 'ong ba yang med /
analyzed: 'ong ba yang med /
translated: and there is no coming.

original: rgyu dang rkyen ma tshang ba med pa'i shi 'phos pa dang / song ba dang / 'ong ba dang snang ba de bzhin du chu snod dang 'dra ba sems can gyi rgyud 'gro ba'i gnas gzhan rnam pa du ma tha dad pas sems zla ba'i gzugs brnyan skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rgyu dang rkyen ma tshang ba med pa'i shi 'phos pa dang / song ba dang / 'ong ba dang snang ba de bzhin du chu snod dang 'dra ba sems can gyi rgyud 'gro ba'i gnas gzhan rnam pa du ma tha dad pas sems zla ba'i gzugs brnyan skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Just as the reflection of the moon in water appears due to the coming together of the water vessel and the moon in the sky, so too, the arising of the moon-like cognition occurs due to the coming together of the various different realms of sentient beings, which are like the water vessels, and the moon-like cognition itself, which is like the moon in the sky.

original: rgyu dang rkyen rnams ma tshang ba med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni dge ba dang / mi dge ba dang / mi g-yo ba la sogs pa'i rgyu ji ltar 'phangs pa der snang ba'i rnam pa can gyi rnam par rig pa 'byung ste /
analyzed: rgyu dang rkyen rnams ma tshang ba med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni dge ba dang / mi dge ba dang / mi g-yo ba la sogs pa'i rgyu ji ltar 'phangs pa der snang ba'i rnam pa can gyi rnam par rig pa 'byung ste /
translated: Because the causes and conditions are not incomplete means that the cognition with the aspect of appearance arises in accordance with the projected causes, whether virtuous, non-virtuous, or neutral, etc.

original: bdag dang bdag gi dang bral ba'i dngos po thams cad la rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i rim pa rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: bdag dang bdag gi dang bral ba'i dngos po thams cad la rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i rim pa rtogs par bya'o //
translated: One should understand the process of dependent origination in all things, which are devoid of self and what belongs to self.

original: rgyun mi 'chad pa'i dpe brjod /🔽ji ltar bud shing dang 'brel na //
analyzed: rgyun mi 'chad pa'i dpe brjod / ji ltar bud shing dang 'brel na //
translated: The example of the uninterrupted continuity:🔽Just as the continuity of fire

original: me yi rgyun ni 'jug 'gyur gyi //
analyzed: me yi rgyun ni 'jug 'gyur gyi //
translated: is engaged in connection with fuel,

original: las dang nyon mongs pas bsgos pa'i sems kyi rgyud me'i rgyun dang 'dra ba'i @52b bud shing ni las dang nyon mongs pa kho na yin par brtag ste /
analyzed: las dang nyon mongs pas bsgos pa'i sems kyi rgyud me'i rgyun dang 'dra ba'i @52b bud shing ni las dang nyon mongs pa kho na yin par brtag ste /
translated: The fuel of the continuum of mind, which is imbued with karma and afflictions, is like a stream of fire, and is only karma and afflictions.

original: ji ltar me bud shing rgyur byas nas 'bar ba rgyun mi 'chad la /
analyzed: ji ltar me bud shing rgyur byas nas 'bar ba rgyun mi 'chad la /
translated: Just as fire, taking fuel as its cause, burns without interruption,

original: bud shing med na rgyun 'chad par 'gyur ba de bzhin du 'dir yang las dang nyon mongs pa'i bud shing bcad de /
analyzed: bud shing med na rgyun 'chad par 'gyur ba de bzhin du 'dir yang las dang nyon mongs pa'i bud shing bcad de /
translated: and when there is no fuel, the stream is interrupted, so here also, having cut the fuel of karma and afflictions,

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa'i kun gzhi rnam par shes pa'i sa bon gyi rgyun ye shes kyi me dang phrad pas bsregs na rgyu 'gag pa'i phyir 'bras bu mi 'byung ngo //
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa'i kun gzhi rnam par shes pa'i sa bon gyi rgyun ye shes kyi me dang phrad pas bsregs na rgyu 'gag pa'i phyir 'bras bu mi 'byung ngo //
translated: if the stream of seeds of the afflicted foundation consciousness is burned by contact with the fire of wisdom, then the result does not arise because its cause is stopped.

original: de nyid kyi phyir bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir bka' stsal pa /
translated: For that very reason, it is said:

original: dge slong ngam bram ze gang dag yod pa 'di lta ste zhes bya ba ni 'di las phyi rol pa rnams so //
analyzed: dge slong ngam bram ze gang dag yod pa 'di lta ste zhes bya ba ni 'di las phyi rol pa rnams so //
translated: “Monks or brahmans who exist, that is to say,” refers to those outside this teaching.

original: 'jig rten na zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten 'jig cing 'jig cing 'gro ba'i don te /
analyzed: 'jig rten na zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten 'jig cing 'jig cing 'gro ba'i don te /
translated: “In the world” means that the world is destroyed and destroyed and goes.

original: 'jig pa'i phyir 'jig rten pas zhig par 'gyur ba zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: 'jig pa'i phyir 'jig rten pas zhig par 'gyur ba zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Because it is destroyed, it is called “destroyed” by worldly people.

original: lta bar gyur pa zhes bya ba ni lta ba dang mthong ba ste phyin ci log gi bstan bcos nyan pa dang / sems pa la sogs pa'i log pa'i shes pa byung ba'i phyir log pa'i shes pa ni lta ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: lta bar gyur pa zhes bya ba ni lta ba dang mthong ba ste phyin ci log gi bstan bcos nyan pa dang / sems pa la sogs pa'i log pa'i shes pa byung ba'i phyir log pa'i shes pa ni lta ba zhes bya'o //
translated: “View” means seeing, because wrong knowledge arises from listening to and reflecting on treatises that are erroneous.

original: tha dad pa ni so so ba'o //
analyzed: tha dad pa ni so so ba'o //
translated: “Different” means individual.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: For example,

original: bdag tu smra ba dang ldan pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga po gzugs dang / tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba bdag dang bdag gi dang bral ba dag la bdag nyid du yang dag lta ba'i shes rab nyon mongs pa can gang yin pa de ni lta ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: bdag tu smra ba dang ldan pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga po gzugs dang / tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba bdag dang bdag gi dang bral ba dag la bdag nyid du yang dag lta ba'i shes rab nyon mongs pa can gang yin pa de ni lta ba zhes bya'o //
translated: “endowed with the doctrine of self” and so on. The five appropriated aggregates, called form, feeling, conception, formation, and consciousness, are devoid of self and what belongs to self. The afflicted wisdom that views them as a self is called “view.”

original: 'jig tshogs dang / mtha' dang / lta ba dang / tshul khrims dang / brtul zhugs dang / log par lta ba sngon du 'gro ba'i shes rab ngan pa ma rig pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i phyir lta ba zhes bya ba de dang / ma rig pa sngon du 'gro ba'i 'dod chags dang /
analyzed: 'jig tshogs dang / mtha' dang / lta ba dang / tshul khrims dang / brtul zhugs dang / log par lta ba sngon du 'gro ba'i shes rab ngan pa ma rig pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i phyir lta ba zhes bya ba de dang / ma rig pa sngon du 'gro ba'i 'dod chags dang /
translated: Since it is associated with the bad wisdom that precedes the view of the transitory collection, the view of extremes, wrong view, the view of moral discipline and ascetic practice, and wrong view, it is called “view.”🔽Since it is associated with desire, anger, pride, ignorance, view, doubt, and secondary afflictions that precede ignorance, it is called “affliction.”

original: khong khro ba dang / nga rgyal dang / ma rig pa dang / lta ba dang / the tshom dang / nye ba'i nyon mongs pa mtshungs par ldan pa dang / lta ba ma yin pa'i mtshan nyid khams kyi rnam pa dang bye brag gi tha dad pa ma gtogs nas /
analyzed: khong khro ba dang / nga rgyal dang / ma rig pa dang / lta ba dang / the tshom dang / nye ba'i nyon mongs pa mtshungs par ldan pa dang / lta ba ma yin pa'i mtshan nyid khams kyi rnam pa dang bye brag gi tha dad pa ma gtogs nas /
translated: Except for the characteristics of the different aspects and distinctions of the elements that are not views,

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa'i kun gzhi rnam par shes pa la bag chags su gnas pa de'i rnam pa can gyi rnam par shes pa snang ba gsos pa rnams thog ma nyid du 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam la bstan te /
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa'i kun gzhi rnam par shes pa la bag chags su gnas pa de'i rnam pa can gyi rnam par shes pa snang ba gsos pa rnams thog ma nyid du 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam la bstan te /
translated: the consciousness that appears as the aspect of that which abides as traces in the alaya consciousness of affliction is first taught in the transcendent path.

original: 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi bsgom pa goms pa'i rim gyis sdug bsngal dang / kun 'byung dang / 'gog pa dang / lam mthong pa dang / bsgom pa dang / rnam par grol ba @53a * //
analyzed: 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi bsgom pa goms pa'i rim gyis sdug bsngal dang / kun 'byung dang / 'gog pa dang / lam mthong pa dang / bsgom pa dang / rnam par grol ba @53a * //
translated: By the stages of cultivating the four noble truths, one realizes the abandonment of suffering, origin, cessation, and the path, and one realizes the abandonment by seeing, cultivation, liberation,🔽distinction, and uninterrupted [path].

original: dang ; khyad par dang / bar chad med pas spangs pa mngon du byas pa dang / gang yang byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun dang / dran pa nye bar gzhag pa dang / yang dag par spong ba dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa dang /
analyzed: dang ; khyad par dang / bar chad med pas spangs pa mngon du byas pa dang / gang yang byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun dang / dran pa nye bar gzhag pa dang / yang dag par spong ba dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa dang /
translated: One also realizes the thirty-seven factors of enlightenment, the four establishments of mindfulness, the four right efforts, the four legs of supernatural power,

original: dbang po dang / stobs dang / byang chub kyi yan lag dang / lam dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba dang / bsam gtan dang / gzugs med pa dang / tshad med pa dang / rjes su dran ba drug la sogs pa dang /
analyzed: dbang po dang / stobs dang / byang chub kyi yan lag dang / lam dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba dang / bsam gtan dang / gzugs med pa dang / tshad med pa dang / rjes su dran ba drug la sogs pa dang /
translated: the five faculties, the five powers, the seven factors of enlightenment, the path, dependent origination, the dhyānas, the formless [absorptions], the immeasurables, the six recollections, and so forth.

original: chos dang / gang zag la bdag med pa dang / byang chub kyi sems bsgom pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / gzungs dang / dad pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / shes rab dang / sa dang / dbang dang /
analyzed: chos dang / gang zag la bdag med pa dang / byang chub kyi sems bsgom pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / gzungs dang / dad pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / shes rab dang / sa dang / dbang dang /
translated: the Dharma, the selflessness of persons and phenomena, the cultivation of the mind of enlightenment, meditative stabilization, retention, faith, effort, meditative stabilization, wisdom, the levels, the powers,

original: mngon par shes pa dang / ye shes dang / pha rol tu phyin pa dang / rnam par grol ba'i sgo dang / bzod pa bsgom pa la sogs pa'i rim gyis 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam gyi rjes su 'gro bas /
analyzed: mngon par shes pa dang / ye shes dang / pha rol tu phyin pa dang / rnam par grol ba'i sgo dang / bzod pa bsgom pa la sogs pa'i rim gyis 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam gyi rjes su 'gro bas /
translated: the superknowledges, the pristine wisdoms, the perfections, the doors of liberation, the cultivation of forbearance, and so forth, one goes in the wake of the supramundane path.

original: mos pas spyod pa la rab tu gnas shing nges par 'byung ba rab tu sbyor ba mngon sum du byas pa las dbang po dang / stobs dang / mi 'jigs pa dang / ma 'dres pa dang / so sor rig pa dang / dpe byad dang /
analyzed: mos pas spyod pa la rab tu gnas shing nges par 'byung ba rab tu sbyor ba mngon sum du byas pa las dbang po dang / stobs dang / mi 'jigs pa dang / ma 'dres pa dang / so sor rig pa dang / dpe byad dang /
translated: Through the cultivation of the path of meditation, one is established in the stage of engagement through belief and one manifests the application of definite emergence.

original: skyes bu chen po'i mtshan dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa la sogs pa bsgom pa yongs su rdzogs nas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i rjes su rtogs pa las zhi gnas dang / lhag mthong gi rjes su mthun pa mnyam pa nyid du gyur pa /
analyzed: skyes bu chen po'i mtshan dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa la sogs pa bsgom pa yongs su rdzogs nas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i rjes su rtogs pa las zhi gnas dang / lhag mthong gi rjes su mthun pa mnyam pa nyid du gyur pa /
translated: Having perfected the cultivation of the marks of a great being, the bases of supernatural power, and so forth, the subsequent realization of unsurpassed perfect complete enlightenment is the concordance of calm abiding and insight.

original: yon tan mtha' yas bsam mi khyab //
analyzed: yon tan mtha' yas bsam mi khyab //
translated: The qualities are limitless and inconceivable.

original: zhi ba chos kyi rang bzhin sku //
analyzed: zhi ba chos kyi rang bzhin sku //
translated: The body of the nature of peace and phenomena

original: thog ma dbus dang mtha' bral ba //
analyzed: thog ma dbus dang mtha' bral ba //
translated: Is free from beginning, middle, and end.

original: rtogs nas sangs rgyas go 'phang thob //
analyzed: rtogs nas sangs rgyas go 'phang thob //
translated: Having realized that, the state of buddhahood is attained.

original: ces bya'o // de la gzugs kyi phung po zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: ces bya'o // de la gzugs kyi phung po zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Regarding that, the so-called aggregate of form

original: gzugs su snang ba'i rnam pa can gyi rnam par rig pa snang ba'i rnam par rtog pa las byung ba rdzas du ma'i bdag nyid 'byung ba dang / 'byung ba las gyur pa'i gzugs kyi mtshan nyid spyi bcu gcig bdag nyid bdag gi rdzas rnam pa lngar sgro 'dogs pas kun nas bslang ba mig dang /
analyzed: gzugs su snang ba'i rnam pa can gyi rnam par rig pa snang ba'i rnam par rtog pa las byung ba rdzas du ma'i bdag nyid 'byung ba dang / 'byung ba las gyur pa'i gzugs kyi mtshan nyid spyi bcu gcig bdag nyid bdag gi rdzas rnam pa lngar sgro 'dogs pas kun nas bslang ba mig dang /
translated: The form aggregate is the appearance of the aspect of the form that appears, which arises from the conceptualization of appearance. It is the nature of many substances, the nature of the eleven universals that are the characteristics of form derived from the elements, and the nature of the five substances of the self. It is the eye,🔽ear, and so on, form, sound, and so on, and the aggregates, elements,

original: rna ba la sogs pa dang / gzugs dang / sgra la sogs pa dang / 'dod pa dang / gzugs dang / gzugs med pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i yang dag pa ma yin pa'i kun tu rtog pa'i mtshan nyid phung po dang / khams dang /
analyzed: rna ba la sogs pa dang / gzugs dang / sgra la sogs pa dang / 'dod pa dang / gzugs dang / gzugs med pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i yang dag pa ma yin pa'i kun tu rtog pa'i mtshan nyid phung po dang / khams dang /
translated: and sense bases that are associated with the desire, form, and formless realms. It is the nature of the objects of the sense faculties and consciousnesses.

original: skye mched dang / dbang po dang / rnam par @53b shes pa'i yul gyi bdag nyid dang / gzhan yang de lta bu'i gzugs kyi mtshan nyid kyi chos ni gzugs kyi phung po zhes bya'o //
analyzed: skye mched dang / dbang po dang / rnam par @53b shes pa'i yul gyi bdag nyid dang / gzhan yang de lta bu'i gzugs kyi mtshan nyid kyi chos ni gzugs kyi phung po zhes bya'o //
translated: Moreover, phenomena that have the characteristics of form are called the form aggregate.

original: de la tshor ba'i phung po zhes bya ba ni bde ba dang / sdug bsngal dang / gnyis ka'i rnam par myong ba'i rnam pa can gyi rnam par rig pa snang ba ste /
analyzed: de la tshor ba'i phung po zhes bya ba ni bde ba dang / sdug bsngal dang / gnyis ka'i rnam par myong ba'i rnam pa can gyi rnam par rig pa snang ba ste /
translated: The so-called aggregate of feeling is the appearance of the aspect of experience of pleasure, pain, and neither pleasure nor pain.

original: yul dang / dbang po dang / rnam par shes pa dbye bas tshor ba'i tshogs drug go //
analyzed: yul dang / dbang po dang / rnam par shes pa dbye bas tshor ba'i tshogs drug go //
translated: The aggregate of feeling is the group of six feelings, divided into the six sense objects, the six sense faculties, and the six consciousnesses.

original: khams kyi rnam pa dang bye brag gi dbye bas ni nyon mongs pa dang / nye ba'i nyon mongs pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i phyir rab tu dbye ba mtha' yas te /
analyzed: khams kyi rnam pa dang bye brag gi dbye bas ni nyon mongs pa dang / nye ba'i nyon mongs pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i phyir rab tu dbye ba mtha' yas te /
translated: The aggregate of feeling is divided into an infinite number of subdivisions, according to the different elements and distinctions, because it is associated with the root afflictions and secondary afflictions.

original: bde ba dang / sdug bsngal dang / yid bde ba dang / yid mi bde ba btang snyoms dang ldan pa'i phyir bdag gi rdzas rnam pa drug nyid yang dag pa ma yin pa'i kun tu rtog pa rnam par rtog pa'i kun gzhi rnam par shes pa'i bag chags dang 'brel bas 'dod chags dang /
analyzed: bde ba dang / sdug bsngal dang / yid bde ba dang / yid mi bde ba btang snyoms dang ldan pa'i phyir bdag gi rdzas rnam pa drug nyid yang dag pa ma yin pa'i kun tu rtog pa rnam par rtog pa'i kun gzhi rnam par shes pa'i bag chags dang 'brel bas 'dod chags dang /
translated: The six substances of the self are associated with pleasure, pain, mental pleasure, mental pain, and indifference. The six substances of the self are associated with the latent tendencies of the store consciousness, which is the imagination of what is unreal, the imagination that is conceptualization.

original: zhe sdang dang / gti mug la sogs pa khams gsum pa'i rnam par rtog pa'i dbang gis byung ba rdzas su ma bsdus pa'i phyir tshor pa'i phung po zhes bya'o //🔽'du shes ni phra ba dang / rags pa dang / chen por gyur pa la sogs pa mtshan mar 'dzin pa snang ba'i rnam pa can gyi rnam par rig pa rnam par rtog pa'i dbang gis byung ba sngon dgod pa dang / dga' ba dang /
analyzed: zhe sdang dang / gti mug la sogs pa khams gsum pa'i rnam par rtog pa'i dbang gis byung ba rdzas su ma bsdus pa'i phyir tshor pa'i phung po zhes bya'o // 'du shes ni phra ba dang / rags pa dang / chen por gyur pa la sogs pa mtshan mar 'dzin pa snang ba'i rnam pa can gyi rnam par rig pa rnam par rtog pa'i dbang gis byung ba sngon dgod pa dang / dga' ba dang /
translated: It is called the aggregate of feeling because it is not included in the substance of the other aggregates, but arises through the power of conceptualization in the three realms, such as hatred, desire, and delusion.

original: rtses pa la sogs pa rjes su dran zhing skyes pa dang bud med la sogs pa'i mtshan ma'i khyad par 'dzin pa'i bdag nyid de /
analyzed: rtses pa la sogs pa rjes su dran zhing skyes pa dang bud med la sogs pa'i mtshan ma'i khyad par 'dzin pa'i bdag nyid de /
translated: Perception is the cognition that apprehends the signs of the subtle, the gross, the great, and so forth, having the aspect of appearance. It arises through the power of conceptualization. It is the nature of recollecting past play, joy, and laughter, and apprehending the specific signs of men, women, and so forth.

original: yul dang / dbang po dang / rnam par shes pa'i dbye bas 'du shes kyi tshogs drug go //
analyzed: yul dang / dbang po dang / rnam par shes pa'i dbye bas 'du shes kyi tshogs drug go //
translated: It is the group of six perceptions due to the division of objects, faculties, and consciousnesses.

original: 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug dang 'brel pa'i phyir khams kyi rnam pa dang / bye brag gi dbye bas ni rab 'byam mtha' yas te /
analyzed: 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug dang 'brel pa'i phyir khams kyi rnam pa dang / bye brag gi dbye bas ni rab 'byam mtha' yas te /
translated: It is infinite and limitless due to the division of types and distinctions of realms, because it is connected with desire, hatred, and delusion.

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa'i kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa'i bag chags dang 'brel pa'i phyir bdag tu rmongs pa la sogs pa dang ldan pa'i bdag nyid ni 'du shes zhes bya'o //
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa'i kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa'i bag chags dang 'brel pa'i phyir bdag tu rmongs pa la sogs pa dang ldan pa'i bdag nyid ni 'du shes zhes bya'o //
translated: Because it is related to the habitual propensities of the store-consciousness which is affected by the process of becoming, it is the self which is endowed with the delusion of selfhood, etc. and is called perception.

original: 'du byed ni mtshungs par ldan pa dang / ldan pa ma yin pa dang / gdags pa dang / 'dus byas dang ; 'dus ma byas su snang ba'i rnam pa can gyi rnam par rig pa rnam par rtog pa'i dbang gis byung ba rnams so //🔽sngon 'phangs pa'i kun gzhi rnam par shes pa las yod pa'i bag chags kyi dbye bas ni khams kyi rnam pa dang / bye brag gi rab 'byam mtha' yas dang ldan pa'i 'du byed kyi rdzas du ma @54a * //
analyzed: 'du byed ni mtshungs par ldan pa dang / ldan pa ma yin pa dang / gdags pa dang / 'dus byas dang ; 'dus ma byas su snang ba'i rnam pa can gyi rnam par rig pa rnam par rtog pa'i dbang gis byung ba rnams so // sngon 'phangs pa'i kun gzhi rnam par shes pa las yod pa'i bag chags kyi dbye bas ni khams kyi rnam pa dang / bye brag gi rab 'byam mtha' yas dang ldan pa'i 'du byed kyi rdzas du ma @54a * //
translated: The formative forces are the representations which appear as the associated, the dissociated, the designations, the compounded and the uncompounded, and which arise through the power of conceptual differentiation.

original: bsdus pa'i phyir 'du byed kyi phung po zhes bya'o //
analyzed: bsdus pa'i phyir 'du byed kyi phung po zhes bya'o //
translated: The formative forces are called the aggregate of formative forces because they are the many substances of the formative forces which are endowed with the infinite varieties and distinctions of the elements, due to the division of the habitual propensities that exist in the store-consciousness which was projected previously.

original: de la rnam par shes pa'i phung po ni rnam pa brgyad de /
analyzed: de la rnam par shes pa'i phung po ni rnam pa brgyad de /
translated: The aggregate of consciousness is eightfold.

original: yul dang / dbang po dang / rnam par shes pa'i bye brag tu snang ba'i rnam pa can gyi rnam par rig pa rnam par rtog pa'i dbang gis byung ba kun gzhi rnam par shes pa'i bag chags dang 'brel pa'i phyir khams kyi rnam pa dang /
analyzed: yul dang / dbang po dang / rnam par shes pa'i bye brag tu snang ba'i rnam pa can gyi rnam par rig pa rnam par rtog pa'i dbang gis byung ba kun gzhi rnam par shes pa'i bag chags dang 'brel pa'i phyir khams kyi rnam pa dang /
translated: The aggregate of consciousness is the consciousness that appears as the various aspects of objects, faculties, and consciousnesses, and is related to the latent impressions of the store consciousness, because it arises through the power of conceptualization.

original: bye brag gi dbye bas rab 'byam mtha' yas ni rnam par shes pa'i phung po zhes bya'o //
analyzed: bye brag gi dbye bas rab 'byam mtha' yas ni rnam par shes pa'i phung po zhes bya'o //
translated: The aggregate of consciousness is called the aggregate of consciousness because it has the aspect of the elements and is related to the various divisions of the infinite variety of consciousnesses.

original: de dag nyid kyang khams dang / skye mched dang / zag pa dang bcas pa dang / 'dus byas dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa la sogs pa'i rnam grangs kyi dbye bas rang gi mtshan nyid dang 'brel pas bsdus te /
analyzed: de dag nyid kyang khams dang / skye mched dang / zag pa dang bcas pa dang / 'dus byas dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa la sogs pa'i rnam grangs kyi dbye bas rang gi mtshan nyid dang 'brel pas bsdus te /
translated: Those very [aggregates, elements, and sense bases] are included by being related to their own characteristics through the categories of elements, sense bases, those with outflows, conditioned phenomena, the thoroughly afflictive, and so on.

original: phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched rnams zhes bya'o //
analyzed: phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched rnams zhes bya'o //
translated: They are called the aggregates, elements, and sense bases.

original: de ltar na kun nas nyon mongs pa'i kun gzhi rnam par shes pa'i sa bon dang 'brel pa yang dag pa ma yin pa'i kun du rtog pas kun nas bslangs pa khams gsum par slong ba'i sems dang / sems las byung ba de dag ni 'khor ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar na kun nas nyon mongs pa'i kun gzhi rnam par shes pa'i sa bon dang 'brel pa yang dag pa ma yin pa'i kun du rtog pas kun nas bslangs pa khams gsum par slong ba'i sems dang / sems las byung ba de dag ni 'khor ba zhes bya'o //
translated: Thus, the mind and mental factors that are related to the seeds of the afflicted foundational consciousness, that are motivated by unreal imagination, and that are active in the three realms are called “samsara.”

original: 'on kyang de la thog ma nyid du byed pa po la sogs pa dang bral ba gsog gsob snying po med pa zhes bya bar rig nas bden pa bzhi bsgom pa lugs dang mthun par 'dug pas gtan la phab ste /
analyzed: 'on kyang de la thog ma nyid du byed pa po la sogs pa dang bral ba gsog gsob snying po med pa zhes bya bar rig nas bden pa bzhi bsgom pa lugs dang mthun par 'dug pas gtan la phab ste /
translated: However, having first understood that it is like an illusion, a mirage, a plantain tree, and so forth, and that it is devoid of an agent and so forth, one should then contemplate the four noble truths in the forward order and thus ascertain them.

original: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i ye shes kyi me byung nas ma rig pa'i mun pa la sogs pa dang bral te rgyu dang rkyen gyi don gyi de kho na nyid yongs su shes pa las zhi ba chos kyi skur rtogs so //
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i ye shes kyi me byung nas ma rig pa'i mun pa la sogs pa dang bral te rgyu dang rkyen gyi don gyi de kho na nyid yongs su shes pa las zhi ba chos kyi skur rtogs so //
translated: Then, when the fire of supramundane wisdom arises, one is free from the darkness of ignorance and so forth, and one realizes the peace of the body of reality, the reality that is the object of causes and conditions.

original: de'i phyir sdug bsngal dang / kun 'byung ba dang / 'gog pa dang / lam mthong ba dang / bsgom pa'i lam gyi go rims zhes bya ste /🔽de la sdug bsngal gyi bden pa la mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / stong pa dang / bdag med par yang dag par rjes su mthong ba'i shes pa dang / bzod pa dang / grol ba dang / spong ba dang / khyad par dang /
analyzed: de'i phyir sdug bsngal dang / kun 'byung ba dang / 'gog pa dang / lam mthong ba dang / bsgom pa'i lam gyi go rims zhes bya ste / de la sdug bsngal gyi bden pa la mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / stong pa dang / bdag med par yang dag par rjes su mthong ba'i shes pa dang / bzod pa dang / grol ba dang / spong ba dang / khyad par dang /
translated: Therefore, it is called the order of the path of seeing and the path of cultivation of the truths of suffering, origin, cessation, and path.🔽With regard to the truth of suffering, there is the knowledge, forbearance, liberation, abandonment, distinction,

original: bar chad med pa'i shes pas sdug bsngal de mngon par rtogs nas nyon mongs pa'i kun gzhi rnam par shes ba'i bag chags yang dag par bcom ste /
analyzed: bar chad med pa'i shes pas sdug bsngal de mngon par rtogs nas nyon mongs pa'i kun gzhi rnam par shes ba'i bag chags yang dag par bcom ste /
translated: and uninterrupted knowledge that sees impermanence, suffering, emptiness, and selflessness. Having realized suffering through that, one completely destroys the predispositions for the afflicted foundation consciousness.

original: gang zag dang chos la bdag med par rtogs nas khams gsum par snang ba yang dag pa ma yin pa'i kun tu rtog pa las byung ba'i sems tsam pa 'di la sgyu ma dang / smig rgyu dang / dri za'i grong khyer dang / mgal me'i 'khor lo dang /
analyzed: gang zag dang chos la bdag med par rtogs nas khams gsum par snang ba yang dag pa ma yin pa'i kun tu rtog pa las byung ba'i sems tsam pa 'di la sgyu ma dang / smig rgyu dang / dri za'i grong khyer dang / mgal me'i 'khor lo dang /
translated: Having realized the selflessness of persons and phenomena, they meditate on this mind-only of the three realms as being like an illusion, a mirage, a city of gandharvas, a fire wheel,

original: brag ca dang / chu zla dang / gzugs brnyan bzhin du rnam par bsgoms na /
analyzed: brag ca dang / chu zla dang / gzugs brnyan bzhin du rnam par bsgoms na /
translated: an echo, the moon in water, and a reflection.

original: phung po la sogs pa @54b dang ; khams dang / skye mched du gzung ba dang / 'dzin pa dang bral nas chos la bdag med pa mnyam pa nyid la zhugs te /
analyzed: phung po la sogs pa @54b dang ; khams dang / skye mched du gzung ba dang / 'dzin pa dang bral nas chos la bdag med pa mnyam pa nyid la zhugs te /
