translated: Free from the apprehended and apprehender of the skandhas, dhātus, and āyatanas, they enter the sameness of the selflessness of phenomena.

original: rang gi sems nyid gzod ma nas ma skyes pa'o zhes stong pa'i ye shes la zhugs nas chos thams cad ngo bo nyid med pa'i ye shes kyi snying rje'i rtsa ba can byang chub kyi sems kyi rgyur gyur pa thabs sna tshogs dang / bsod nams dang /
analyzed: rang gi sems nyid gzod ma nas ma skyes pa'o zhes stong pa'i ye shes la zhugs nas chos thams cad ngo bo nyid med pa'i ye shes kyi snying rje'i rtsa ba can byang chub kyi sems kyi rgyur gyur pa thabs sna tshogs dang / bsod nams dang /
translated: Their own mind is primordially unborn. Having entered the wisdom of emptiness, they enter the wisdom of the essencelessness of all phenomena. The root of compassion is bodhicitta.

original: ye shes kyi tshogs bsags nas pha rol tu phyin pa bcu'i rgyu dag gis sa bcu'i rten can ye shes bcu'i dmigs pa dbang bcu'i 'bras bu can yon tan bsam gyis mi khyab cing mtha' yas pa'i 'byung gnas zhi ba chos kyi sku rtogs so //🔽de bzhin du kun 'byung gi bden pa la kun 'byung dang / rgyu dang / rab tu skye ba dang / rkyen du bar chad med pa dang / rnam par grol ba dang / spong ba dang / khyad par dang / mthong ba dang / bsgom pa lugs dang mthun pa dang /
analyzed: ye shes kyi tshogs bsags nas pha rol tu phyin pa bcu'i rgyu dag gis sa bcu'i rten can ye shes bcu'i dmigs pa dbang bcu'i 'bras bu can yon tan bsam gyis mi khyab cing mtha' yas pa'i 'byung gnas zhi ba chos kyi sku rtogs so // de bzhin du kun 'byung gi bden pa la kun 'byung dang / rgyu dang / rab tu skye ba dang / rkyen du bar chad med pa dang / rnam par grol ba dang / spong ba dang / khyad par dang / mthong ba dang / bsgom pa lugs dang mthun pa dang /
translated: Having accumulated the collection of wisdom, one realizes the peaceful dharmakāya, the source of inconceivable and limitless qualities, which is the support of the ten stages, the object of the ten wisdoms, and the result of the ten powers, by means of the ten perfections that are its causes.

original: lugs dang mi mthun pa'i rnam pas kun nas nyon mongs pa'i kun gzhi rnam par shes pa'i bag chags kyi dri ma dang bral nas zhi ba chos kyi sku la 'jug go //
analyzed: lugs dang mi mthun pa'i rnam pas kun nas nyon mongs pa'i kun gzhi rnam par shes pa'i bag chags kyi dri ma dang bral nas zhi ba chos kyi sku la 'jug go //
translated: Similarly, one enters the peaceful dharmakāya, having become free from the stains of the latent tendencies of the alaya-consciousness, which is afflicted by the aspects of the truth of the origin of suffering, such as origin, cause, strong generation, condition, uninterrupted, liberation, abandonment, distinction, seeing, and meditation, in accordance with the natural order,🔽and in the reverse order.

original: 'gog pa'i bden nga la yang 'gog pa dang / zhi ba dang / gya nom pa dang / nges par 'byung ba bar chad med pa dang / rnam par grol ba dang / spong ba dang / khyad par dang / mthong ba dang / bsgom pa'i lam gyi rim gyis kun nas nyon mongs pa'i kun gzhi rnam par shes pa'i bag chags yang dag par bcom pas bar chad med pa dang /
analyzed: 'gog pa'i bden nga la yang 'gog pa dang / zhi ba dang / gya nom pa dang / nges par 'byung ba bar chad med pa dang / rnam par grol ba dang / spong ba dang / khyad par dang / mthong ba dang / bsgom pa'i lam gyi rim gyis kun nas nyon mongs pa'i kun gzhi rnam par shes pa'i bag chags yang dag par bcom pas bar chad med pa dang /
translated: By completely destroying the latent tendencies of the afflicted foundation consciousness, there is the uninterrupted path,

original: spong ba dang / rnam par grol ba dang / khyad par bsgoms pa las gang zag dang chos la bdag med par rtogs te zhi ba'i chos kyi sku 'thob bo //
analyzed: spong ba dang / rnam par grol ba dang / khyad par bsgoms pa las gang zag dang chos la bdag med par rtogs te zhi ba'i chos kyi sku 'thob bo //
translated: abandonment, the path of liberation, and the cultivation of distinction. By realizing the selflessness of persons and phenomena, one attains the peaceful dharmakāya.

original: rgyu dang rkyen dang bral ba las lam gyi bden pa la yang lam dang / rig pa dang / sgrub pa dang / nges par 'byin par yang dag par mthong na 'di ltar mthong ba dang / bsgom pa dang / bar chad med pa dang /
analyzed: rgyu dang rkyen dang bral ba las lam gyi bden pa la yang lam dang / rig pa dang / sgrub pa dang / nges par 'byin par yang dag par mthong na 'di ltar mthong ba dang / bsgom pa dang / bar chad med pa dang /
translated: When one sees the truth of the path as the path, knowledge, practice, and definite emergence free from causes and conditions, one sees in this way, meditates, and is uninterrupted.

original: spong ba dang / rnam par grol ba dang / khyad par gyi lam dang mthun par kun gzhi rnam par shes pa la yod pa'i bag chags yang dag par bcom nas /
analyzed: spong ba dang / rnam par grol ba dang / khyad par gyi lam dang mthun par kun gzhi rnam par shes pa la yod pa'i bag chags yang dag par bcom nas /
translated: Having destroyed the habitual tendencies that exist in the consciousness of the ground of all, in accordance with the paths of abandonment, liberation, and distinction,

original: gang zag dang chos la bdag med pa'i mnyam pa nyid rtogs pa las sku gsum gyi rten zhi ba chos kyi sku yon tan bsam gyis mi khyab cing gzhal du med pa'i tshogs can thog ma dang / bar dang / tha ma dang bral ba don thams cad rgyun mi 'chad par lhun gyis grub par mdzad pa'i @55a * //
analyzed: gang zag dang chos la bdag med pa'i mnyam pa nyid rtogs pa las sku gsum gyi rten zhi ba chos kyi sku yon tan bsam gyis mi khyab cing gzhal du med pa'i tshogs can thog ma dang / bar dang / tha ma dang bral ba don thams cad rgyun mi 'chad par lhun gyis grub par mdzad pa'i @55a * //
translated: one attains the three bodies of a buddha, the body of truth, which is the support for the other two bodies, the body of perfect enjoyment, and the emanation body. The body of truth is endowed with an inconceivable and immeasurable collection of qualities. It is the first, the middle, and the last of all things. It is the nature that spontaneously and effortlessly accomplishes all benefits for all sentient beings without interruption.

original: bdag nyid bla na med pa dang / thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob bo //
analyzed: bdag nyid bla na med pa dang / thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob bo //
translated: It is the nature that attains the unsurpassed and omniscience.

original: yang smras pa /
analyzed: yang smras pa /
translated: Again, it is said:

original: gang gis de ltar de nyid bzod //
analyzed: gang gis de ltar de nyid bzod //
translated: Whoever thus forbears the truth

original: de ni lung bstan the tshom med //
analyzed: de ni lung bstan the tshom med //
translated: will be prophesied and have no doubt.

original: gang gis de ltar bshad ma thag pa'i rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba gang zag dang chos la bdag med pa'i de nyid bzod cing 'dod pa de ni gang zag dang chos la bdag med par bzod pa dang ldan pa'i phyir bla na med pa yang dag par
analyzed: gang gis de ltar bshad ma thag pa'i rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba gang zag dang chos la bdag med pa'i de nyid bzod cing 'dod pa de ni gang zag dang chos la bdag med par bzod pa dang ldan pa'i phyir bla na med pa yang dag par
translated: Whoever accepts and asserts the reality of dependent origination, just explained, as the selflessness of persons and of phenomena, should be regarded as being like one who has been prophesied as a supreme,🔽perfect buddha, because he or she possesses the acceptance of the selflessness of persons and phenomena.

original: rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu lung bstan pa dang 'dra bar blta bar bya zhing shes par bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu lung bstan pa dang 'dra bar blta bar bya zhing shes par bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: This is what should be understood.

original: de nyid kyi phyir mdo las /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir mdo las /
translated: Therefore, a sutra declares:

original: btsun pa sh'a ri'i bu rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo gang la la chos la bzod pa 'di lta bu dang ldan na /
analyzed: btsun pa sh'a ri'i bu rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo gang la la chos la bzod pa 'di lta bu dang ldan na /
translated: “Venerable Sariputra, if a son of a good family or a daughter of a good family possesses this kind of acceptance of the Dharma,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyis bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu lung ston to zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyis bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu lung ston to zhes gsungs so //
translated: the Tathagata, the Arhat, the perfectly accomplished Buddha prophesies his or her supreme, perfect enlightenment.”

original: de skad byams bdag bdag nyid kyis //
analyzed: de skad byams bdag bdag nyid kyis //
translated: Thus, Maitreya himself has said this.

original: sh'a ri'i bu la smras pa dang // de skad du sh'a ri'i bus byang chub sems dpa' byams pa la dris pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' byams pas kyang /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu la smras pa dang // de skad du sh'a ri'i bus byang chub sems dpa' byams pa la dris pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' byams pas kyang /
translated: Śāriputra asked the bodhisattva Maitreya about it, and the bodhisattva Maitreya🔽explained it in detail, using the Rice Seedling Sutra as an example.

original: s'a lu ljang pa dper mdzad pa'i mdo 'di rgya cher rnam par phye nas bshad pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' byams pas bshad pa /
analyzed: s'a lu ljang pa dper mdzad pa'i mdo 'di rgya cher rnam par phye nas bshad pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' byams pas bshad pa /
translated: The bodhisattva Maitreya explained it,

original: s'a lu ljang pa dper mdzad pa //
analyzed: s'a lu ljang pa dper mdzad pa //
translated: using the rice seedling as an example.

original: de ni sh'a ri'i bus thos nas //
analyzed: de ni sh'a ri'i bus thos nas //
translated: Śāriputra heard it,

original: zhes bya ba ni s'a lu ljang pa dpar mdzad pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni s'a lu ljang pa dpar mdzad pa'o //
translated: This is the rice seedling as an example.

original: snying po blangs te lha tshogs kyis //
analyzed: snying po blangs te lha tshogs kyis //
translated: Having taken the essence, the assembly of gods

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: Here,

original: snying po blangs te zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: snying po blangs te zhes bya ba ni /
translated: having taken the essence means

original: chos kyi don de kho na nyid rtogs pa'i phyir snying po bzung ba'o //
analyzed: chos kyi don de kho na nyid rtogs pa'i phyir snying po bzung ba'o //
translated: that they took the essence because they realized the reality of the meaning of the Dharma.

original: lha tshogs kyis zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: lha tshogs kyis zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The assembly of gods means

original: lha dang / klu dang / gnod sbyin dang / dri za la sogs pa dang bcas pa'o //
analyzed: lha dang / klu dang / gnod sbyin dang / dri za la sogs pa dang bcas pa'o //
translated: together with gods, nāgas, yakṣas, gandharvas, and so on.

original: rjes su yi rangs zhes bya ba ni rjes su yi rangs te'o //
analyzed: rjes su yi rangs zhes bya ba ni rjes su yi rangs te'o //
translated: Rejoiced means they rejoiced.

original: mngon bstod nas zhes bya ba ni /🔽khyod kyis ji skad bshad pa de kho na ltar yin gyi /
analyzed: mngon bstod nas zhes bya ba ni / khyod kyis ji skad bshad pa de kho na ltar yin gyi /
translated: The phrase “as it is praised in the Abhidharma” means🔽that the teaching of the bodhisattva Maitreya is just as it is taught, and not otherwise.

original: gzhan du ma yin no zhes nges par bzung zhing nges par bskyed nas so //
analyzed: gzhan du ma yin no zhes nges par bzung zhing nges par bskyed nas so //
translated: Having ascertained this, and having generated this understanding,🔽he rose from his seat and departed,

original: langs te song nas dga' sems kyis //
analyzed: langs te song nas dga' sems kyis //
translated: and with a joyful mind

original: dge slong rnams la bshad pa yin //
analyzed: dge slong rnams la bshad pa yin //
translated: he taught this to the monks.

original: de nyid kyi phyir mdo las /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir mdo las /
translated: Therefore, the sutra says:

original: de nas tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu byang chub sems dpa' byams pas bshad pa la mngon par dga' nas /
analyzed: de nas tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu byang chub sems dpa' byams pas bshad pa la mngon par dga' nas /
translated: Then the venerable Śāriputra, having rejoiced in the teaching of the bodhisattva Maitreya,

original: stan las langs te song ngo zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: stan las langs te song ngo zhes gsungs so //
translated: rose from his seat and departed.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po byams pas de skad ces smras pa ni /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po byams pas de skad ces smras pa ni /
translated: The bodhisattva mahāsattva Maitreya said this,

original: byang chub sems dpa' byams pa de skad ces sh'a ri'i bu la @55b smras pa'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' byams pa de skad ces sh'a ri'i bu la @55b smras pa'o //
translated: and the bodhisattva Maitreya said this to Śāriputra.

original: yi rangs pa ni sh'a ri'i bus de thos nas yid dga' ste /
analyzed: yi rangs pa ni sh'a ri'i bus de thos nas yid dga' ste /
translated: Rejoicing means that having heard this, Śāriputra was delighted,

original: sems mgu zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: sems mgu zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: and the meaning of “his mind was pleased” is the same.

original: song nas dge slong rnams la mdo sde zab cing rgya che ba rmad du byung ba ji ltar thos pa bzhin sems can thams cad la phan pa'i phyir bshad pa yin no //🔽s'a lu ljang pa'i mdo sde yi //
analyzed: song nas dge slong rnams la mdo sde zab cing rgya che ba rmad du byung ba ji ltar thos pa bzhin sems can thams cad la phan pa'i phyir bshad pa yin no // s'a lu ljang pa'i mdo sde yi //
translated: Having gone there, I have explained to the monks the profound and extensive sutra, the marvelous doctrine, just as I have heard it, for the sake of benefiting all sentient beings.🔽The extensive commentary on the Rice Seedling Sutra,

original: rgya cher bshad pa rab bzang po //🔽dman blos rab tu rtogs bya'i phyir //
analyzed: rgya cher bshad pa rab bzang po // dman blos rab tu rtogs bya'i phyir //
translated: Excellent,

original: brgya phrag bcu gnyis kho nar byas //
analyzed: brgya phrag bcu gnyis kho nar byas //
translated: was composed in exactly twelve hundred verses🔽for the sake of understanding by those of inferior intellect.

original: s'a lu ljang pa'i rgya cher bshad pa /
analyzed: s'a lu ljang pa'i rgya cher bshad pa /
translated: The extensive commentary on the Rice Seedling Sutra,

original: slob dpon chen po klu sgrub kyis mdzad pa rdzogs so /
analyzed: slob dpon chen po klu sgrub kyis mdzad pa rdzogs so /
translated: composed by the great master Nagarjuna, is complete.

original: // / rgya gar gyi mkhan po dharma shr'i pra bh'a dang / lo ts'a ba bande legs pa'i blo gros dang / dzny'a na ku m'a ras bsgyur /
analyzed: // / rgya gar gyi mkhan po dharma shr'i pra bh'a dang / lo ts'a ba bande legs pa'i blo gros dang / dzny'a na ku m'a ras bsgyur /
translated: It was translated by the Indian abbot Dharmaśrīprabha and the translator Bandhe Legs pa'i blo gros and Jñāna Kumāra.

analyzed: zhu chen gyi lo ts'a ba bande dpal brtsegs kyis zhus nas gtan la phab pa//
